entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 7} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 5d6 + 3}) fire damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The arcane scavenger casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 15}):

trait.name: Celestial Weapons
entries: The siege archon's weapon attacks are magical. When the archon hits with its Trunk Maul, the weapon deals an extra {@damage 5d8} force damage (included in the attack).

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the siege archon remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an inanimate statue.

trait.name: Immortal Nature
entries: The siege archon doesn't require food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The siege archon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The siege archon deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Trampling Charge
entries: If the siege archon moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a trunk maul attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 19} Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 10 feet and knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the archon can make one Stomp attack against it as a bonus action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The siege archon makes two Trunk Maul attacks or four Trumpeting Blast attacks.

action.name: Trunk Maul
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 4d6 + 6}) bludgeoning damage plus 22 ({@damage 5d8}) force damage.

action.name: Stomp
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one {@condition prone} creature. {@h}22 ({@damage 3d10 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Trumpeting Blast
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 10} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 4d6 + 5}) thunder damage.

action.name: Sundering Quake {@recharge 5}
entries: The siege archon slams its forelegs into the ground. Each creature in contact with the ground within 20 feet of the archon must make a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw, taking 49 ({@damage 14d6}) force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Each structure in contact with the ground within 20 feet of the archon also takes the damage and collapses if the damage reduces it to 0 hp.

trait.name: Celestial Weapons
entries: The ursan archon's weapon attacks are magical. When the ursan archon hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@damage 4d8} force damage (included in the attack).

trait.name: Immortal Nature
entries: The ursan archon doesn't require food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The ursan archon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Reckless
entries: At the start of its turn, the ursan archon can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls it makes during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Relentless (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: If the ursan archon takes 30 damage or less that would reduce it to 0 hp, it is reduced to 1 hp instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The ursan archon makes two Greataxe attacks. When Thunderous Roar is available, it can use the roar in place of one Greataxe attack.

action.name: Greataxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 2d12 + 5}) slashing damage plus 13 ({@damage 3d8}) force damage.

action.name: Thunderous Roar {@recharge 5}
entries: The ursan archon unleashes a terrifying roar in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw, taking 36 ({@damage 8d8}) thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. In addition, each hostile creature within 60 feet of the archon that can hear it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. Creatures in the 30-foot cone have disadvantage on this saving throw. A {@condition frightened} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

reaction.name: Rallying Roar
entries: When the ursan archon reduces a creature to 0 hp, it can utter a triumphant roar. Each friendly creature within 60 feet of the archon that is {@condition frightened}, {@condition paralyzed}, {@condition stunned}, or {@condition unconscious} has advantage on its next saving throw. A friendly creature without those conditions has advantage on its next attack roll. In addition, each friendly creature within 60 feet of the archon that can hear the roar gains 14 ({@damage 4d6}) temporary hp.

trait.name: Immortal Nature
entries: The word archon doesn't require food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Keen Sight
entries: The word archon has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The word archon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) radiant damage.

action.name: Forceful Words
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 5} to hit, range 90 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) radiant damage.

action.name: Share Smite (3/Day)
entries: The word archon empowers the weapon of one creature within 30 feet of it that can hear and see it for 1 minute. The first time the target hits with the weapon on a turn, the weapon deals an extra 9 ({@damage 2d8}) radiant damage. If the creature the target hits is a Fiend or Undead, it takes 13 ({@damage 3d8}) radiant damage instead.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The word archon casts one of the following spells, requiring no material or somatic components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 13}):

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the asp vine remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal cluster of vines.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The asp vine makes four Vine attacks.

action.name: Vine
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage and 5 ({@damage 2d4}) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. If the target is a creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 14}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained} and must succeed on a new saving throw each round it remains {@condition grappled} or take another 5 ({@damage 2d4}) poison damage. The asp vine can grapple up to four targets at a time, though it can still make vine attacks against other targets even if it has four {@condition grappled} opponents.

trait.name: Apposable Thumbs
entries: The astralsupial has advantage on Strength ({@skill Athletics}) checks made to climb.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: The astralsupial has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The astralsupial makes two Claws attacks and uses Astral Pouch.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Astral Pouch
entries: The astralsupial reaches into its extradimensional pouch and chooses a point it can see within 30 feet of it. Each creature within 10 feet of that point must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw. Roll a {@dice d6} to determine which of the following effects happens. The astralsupial is immune to its own Astral Pouch effects.

items.name: Ball Bearings.
items.entry: Ball bearings roll out of the pouch, scattering at the end of the astralsupial's next turn. On a failed save, a creature is knocked {@condition prone}.

items.name: Cooking Utensils.
items.entry: Cast-iron cooking pans fly out of the pouch. On a failed save, a creature takes 5 ({@damage 2d4}) bludgeoning damage.

items.name: Tangled Threads.
items.entry: A mass of thread and string bursts out of the pouch. On a failed save, a creature is {@condition restrained} until a creature takes an action to break the thread by succeeding on a {@dc 10} Strength check.

items.name: Astral Mirror.
items.entry: A mirror imbued with a trace of the Astral Plane's power flashes brilliantly. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 1d4} psychic damage and is {@condition blinded} until the end of its next turn.

items.name: Smelly Trash.
items.entry: Handfuls of putrid trash spill from the pouch. On a failed save, a creature is {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. The creature can make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

items.name: Magic Beans.
items.entry: Magical beans bounce out of the pouch. A creature takes 10 ({@damage 4d4}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

bonus.name: Astral Traveler (2/Day)
entries: The astralsupial briefly surrounds itself in a shower of glittering dust and teleports to an unoccupied space it can see within 30 feet.

reaction.name: Playing Dead
entries: When the astralsupial is reduced to 10 hp or less, it feigns death in hopes of deceiving its attackers. A creature that sees the astralsupial in this state can determine it is a ruse with a successful {@dc 15} Wisdom ({@skill Medicine}) check. This ruse lasts until the astralsupial ends it (no action required), up to 8 hours. The first attack it makes within 1 round of ending the ruse has advantage.

action.name: Battleaxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) slashing damage, or 7 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) slashing damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: Shortbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 2} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Dig In
entries: The avestruzii has resistance to one melee weapon attack that would hit it. To do so, the avestruzii must see the attacker and must not have moved during its previous turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The avestruzii champion makes two Greataxe attacks.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Greataxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d12 + 3}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be pushed 5 feet away from the avestruzii.

action.name: Shortbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 3} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Dig In
entries: The avestruzii champion has resistance to one melee weapon attack that would hit it. To do so, the avestruzii champion must see the attacker and must not have moved during its previous turn.

trait.name: Speak with Frogs and Toads
entries: The aziza can communicate with frogs and toads as if they shared a language.

action.name: Thorn Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Shortbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 11} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute.

action.name: Befuddle
entries: The aziza magically confuses one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 12} Wisdom saving throw or be affected as though it failed a saving throw against the {@spell confusion} spell until the end of its next turn.

reaction.name: Dazzling Glow
entries: When a creature the aziza can see targets it with a melee attack, its skin briefly glows brightly, causing the attacker to have disadvantage on the attack roll.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The aziza casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 12}):

fly.condition: (must start and end its movement on a solid surface)

trait.name: Air Form
entries: The baleful miasma can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. It can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Asphyxiate
entries: If a creature that breathes air starts its turn in the baleful miasma's space, it must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or begin {@quickref suffocating||2} as its lungs fill with the poisonous air emitted by the miasma. The suffocation lasts until the creature ends its turn in a space not occupied by the baleful miasma or the baleful miasma dies. When the suffocation ends, the creature is {@condition poisoned} until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Elemental Nature
entries: The baleful miasma doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The baleful miasma makes two Slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage.

reaction.name: Swift Advance
entries: If a creature in the same space as the baleful miasma moves, the miasma can move up to its speed with the creature. This movement doesn't provoke {@action opportunity attack||opportunity attacks}, but the miasma must move in the same spaces the creature moved, ending in the creature's space or the space nearest to the creature.

trait.name: Hazesight
entries: The bannik can see through areas obscured by fog, smoke, and steam without penalty.

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: The bannik can hold its breath for 10 minutes.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The bannik makes two Scalding Claws attacks.

action.name: Scalding Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) slashing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Scalding Splash {@recharge 5}
entries: The bannik summons a giant ladle full of boiling water that pours down on a point it can see within 60 feet of it, extinguishing exposed flames within 10 feet of that point. Each creature within 10 feet of that point must make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) fire damage and is scalded for 1 minute. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn't scalded. A scalded creature has disadvantage on weapon attack rolls and on Constitution saving throws to maintain concentration. A scalded creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The bannik casts one of the following spells, requiring only a wand of bound fir as a component and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 13}):

trait.name: Elemental Nature
entries: The beach weird doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Invisible in Water
entries: The beach weird is {@condition invisible} while fully immersed in water.

trait.name: Swim in Sand
entries: The beach weird can burrow through sand at half its swimming speed. The beach weird can't make attacks while immersed in sand.

trait.name: Tidepool Bound
entries: The beach weird dies if it moves more than 100 feet from the tide pools to which it is bound or if those tide pools remain waterless for more than 24 hours.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 3d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 10 feet away from the beach weird.

action.name: Create Quicksand (3/Day)
entries: The beach weird creates a 10-foot-radius, 5-foot deep area of quicksand centered on a point it can see within 30 feet of it. A creature that starts its turn in the quicksand or enters the area for the first time on a turn must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be {@condition grappled} by it. A {@condition grappled} creature must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw at the start of each of its turns or sink 1 foot into the quicksand. A Small creature that sinks 2 feet or more or a Medium creature that sinks 3 feet or more is {@condition restrained} instead.

trait.name: Deceptive Steps
entries: While traveling, the bearfolk can perform a stomping dance that mimics the thundering footsteps of mighty giants. Any creature within a half mile that hears the sound, but that can't see the bearfolk, must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check or believe the sound comes from real Giants (or other Huge or larger creatures).

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The bearfolk has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The bearfolk uses Thunder Stomp or Warsong. It then makes one Bite attack and one War Flute attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: War Flute
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) thunder damage.

action.name: Thunder Stomp
entries: The bearfolk hammers its feet on the ground while chanting, emitting destructive energy in a 15-foot cube. Each creature in that area must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or take 10 ({@damage 3d6}) thunder damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Warsong
entries: The bearfolk sets an inspiring rhythm with its dancing. Each friendly creature within 60 feet of the bearfolk has advantage on all saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened} until the end of the bearfolk's next turn.

bonus.name: Taunt (2/Day)
entries: The bearfolk jests at one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can hear the bearfolk, the target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Charisma saving throw or have disadvantage on ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws until the start of the bearfolk's next turn.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The bearfolk casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 15}):

trait.name: Compact
entries: A clacker beetle soldier can occupy the same space as one other clacker beetle soldier.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 0 ft., one creature. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Clack
entries: The beetle clacks its mandibles to create a small but dangerous booming noise in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in the area must make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw, taking 5 ({@damage 2d4}) thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. When multiple beetles clack in the same turn and create overlapping cones, each creature in overlapping cones must make one saving throw with disadvantage against the total damage from all overlapping cones rather than one saving throw for each cone.

trait.name: Constant Clacking
entries: A creature that starts its turn in the swarm's space takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) thunder damage.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny creature. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 0 ft., one target in the swarm's space. {@h}14 ({@damage 4d6}) piercing damage, or 7 ({@damage 2d6}) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer.

trait.name: Healing Lotuscraft
entries: (1/Day). The belu can spend 1 minute crafting a poultice that lasts 24 hours. When a creature takes an action to apply the poultice to a wound or the skin of a creature, the target regains 18 ({@damage 4d8}) hp and is cured of any diseases or conditions affecting it.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The belu makes three Slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 4d6 + 6}) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed 10 a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 10 feet away from the belu and knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Shatterstone {@recharge 5}
entries: The belu hurls an enchanted rock at a point it can see within 60 feet of it. The rock shatters on impact, and each creature within 10 feet of that point must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw, taking 44 ({@damage 8d10}) slashing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

bonus.name: Change Shape
entries: The belu magically transforms into a Small or Medium Humanoid, or back into its true form. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying transforms with it. If the belu dies, it reverts to its true form.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The belu casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 14}):

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The berberoka can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Aqueous Regeneration
entries: If the berberoka starts its turn in contact with a body of water large enough to submerge at least half of its body, it regains 10 hp if it has at least 1 hit point.

trait.name: Swamp Camouflage
entries: The berberoka has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to hide in marshland or swamp terrain.

trait.name: Swamp Stalker
entries: The berberoka leaves behind no tracks or other traces of its passage when it moves through marshland or swamp terrain.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The berberoka makes three Slam attacks or two Muck-Coated Slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Muck-Coated Slam (Saturated Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}24 ({@damage 3d12 + 5}) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or its speed is reduced by 10 feet as mud and muck coat the target. A creature, including the target, can take an action to clean off the mud and muck.

action.name: Water Jet (Saturated Only) {@recharge 4}
entries: The berberoka releases all absorbed water as a powerful jet in a 60-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 40 ({@damage 9d8}) bludgeoning damage and is pushed up to 15 feet away from the berberoka and knocked {@condition prone}. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn't pushed or knocked {@condition prone}. After using Water Jet, the berberoka is no longer saturated.

bonus.name: Saturated Expansion
entries: While in contact with a body of water, the berberoka absorbs water that is a cube up to 10 feet on a side, and it becomes saturated as the water fills its body. While saturated, the berberoka increases in size, along with anything it is wearing or carrying, becoming Huge, and it has advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws. If the berberoka lacks the room to become Huge, it attains the maximum size possible in the space available. Ground exposed by the absorbed water becomes difficult terrain.

trait.name: Frozen to the Spot
entries: When on snow or ice, the birgemon seal can't be moved against its will.

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: The birgemon seal can hold its breath for 90 minutes.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The birgemon seal makes one Bite attack, one Toothy Maw attack, and three Tendril attacks. It can replace all three Tendril attacks with a use of Reel.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Toothy Maw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Tendril
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}The target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 13}) if it is a Medium or smaller creature, and the seal can't use the same tendril on another target. If a creature is {@condition grappled} by two or more tendrils, it is also {@condition Restrained}.

action.name: Reel
entries: The birgemon seal pulls each creature {@condition grappled} by it up to 10 feet straight toward it.

bonus.name: Ice Slide
entries: If the birgemon seal moves at least 10 feet in a straight line while on snow or ice during its turn, it can slide up to 40 feet.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The black patch can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Eldritch Luminance
entries: When a creature that can see the black patch starts its turn within 90 feet of the ooze, the black patch can force it to make a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw if the ooze isn't {@condition incapacitated} and can see the creature. On a failure, the creature is mesmerized for 1 minute. A mesmerized creature that is more than 5 feet away from the black patch must move on its turn toward the ooze by the most direct route, trying to get within 5 feet. It doesn't avoid {@action opportunity attack||opportunity attacks}, but before moving into damaging terrain, such as lava or a pit, and whenever it takes damage from a source other than the ooze, the target can repeat the saving throw. A mesmerized target can also repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the black patch's Eldritch Luminance for the next 24 hours.

trait.name: Flowing Form
entries: The black patch can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. It can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Ooze Nature
entries: The black patch doesn't require sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The black patch makes two Pseudopod attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Viscid Suffocation.

action.name: Pseudopod
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage plus 13 ({@damage 3d8}) acid damage.

action.name: Viscid Suffocation
entries: One creature in the black patch's space must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or take 18 ({@damage 4d8}) acid damage, and the black patch attaches to it, coating the creature and its equipment. While the black patch is attached to it, the creature's speed is halved, it can't breathe, and it takes 9 ({@damage 2d8}) acid damage at the start of each of its turns. In addition, if the creature is in the water, it has disadvantage on ability checks to swim or stay afloat. The black patch can devour flesh quickly, but its acid doesn't harm metal, wood, or other similar objects or creatures without flesh. The black patch can detach itself by spending 5 feet of its movement. A creature, including the target, can take its action to detach the black patch by succeeding on a {@dc 15} Strength check.

monster.name: Black Shuck

immune.note: from nonmagical attacks not made with silvered weapons

languages: understands Abyssal and Common but can't speak

trait.name: Blood Frenzy
entries: The black shuck has advantage on attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hp.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: The black shuck has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

trait.name: Water Walker
entries: The black shuck can move across the surface of water as if it were harmless, solid ground. This trait otherwise works like the {@spell water walk} spell.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The black shuck makes three Bite attacks and can use Curse of the Grave or Fearsome Howl, if available. If at least two Bite attacks hit a Medium or smaller target, the black shuck sinks in its teeth, shaking its head violently, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw or take 7 ({@damage 2d6}) slashing damage and be thrown up to 15 feet in a random direction and knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage and 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Curse of the Grave
entries: The black shuck glares at one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw or be cursed. A cursed creature has disadvantage on the next two death saving throws it makes in the next 7 days. The curse lasts until the cursed creature has made two death saving throws, until 7 days have passed, or until it is lifted by a {@spell remove curse} spell or similar magic.

action.name: Fearsome Howl {@recharge 5}
entries: The black shuck howls a haunting tune. Each creature within 60 feet of the black shuck that can hear the howl must succeed on a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} until the end of its next turn. A {@condition frightened} creature that is concentrating on a spell must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or it loses concentration.

bonus.name: Mist Stalker
entries: While in an area of dim light, fog, or mist, the black shuck takes the {@action Hide} action.

monster.name: Blaspheming Hand

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks not made with silvered weapons

languages: understands Abyssal and Infernal but can't speak

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The blaspheming hand has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Steadfast
entries: The blaspheming hand can't be {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened} while at least one of its allies is within 30 feet of it.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The blaspheming hand makes one Claw attack and uses Evil Fingers.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 14}) if it is a Medium or smaller creature and the hand isn't being used as a mount. Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, the blaspheming hand can't use its Claw on another target, and the hand's walking speed is reduced to 0.

action.name: Evil Fingers
entries: The blaspheming hand gestures at one creature it can see within 60 feet, causing one of the following effects:

action.name: Beckoning Finger
entries: The target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be magically pulled up to 30 feet in a straight line toward the hand. If the creature is pulled to within 5 feet of the hand, the hand can make one Claw attack against it as a bonus action.

action.name: Punishing Finger
entries: The target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Charisma saving throw or take 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage and be marked for punishment. Until the start of the hand's next turn, each time the punished target makes an attack against the blaspheming hand or its rider, the target takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Repelling Finger
entries: The target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or take 11 ({@damage 2d10}) force damage and be pushed up to 10 feet away from the hand and knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Unravelling Finger
entries: The target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or bear a magical mark. Whenever the blaspheming hand deals damage to the marked creature, the hand regains hp equal to half the damage dealt. The mark lasts until the blaspheming hand dismisses it as a bonus action, or it uses Unravelling Finger again.

trait.name: Blur of Motion
entries: When the blestsessebe moves at least 30 feet on its turn, ranged attack rolls against it have disadvantage until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Freedom of Movement
entries: The blestsessebe ignores difficult terrain, and magical effects can't reduce its speed or cause it to be {@condition restrained}. It can spend 5 feet of movement to escape from nonmagical restraints or being {@condition grappled}.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The blestsessebe has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Trampling Charge
entries: If a blestsessebe moves at least 30 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, the target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the blestsessebe can make one hooves attack against it as a bonus action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The blestsessebe makes one Gore attack and two Hooves attacks.

action.name: Gore
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 3d8 + 5}) piercing damage plus 13 ({@damage 3d8}) radiant damage.

action.name: Hooves
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Distracting Glow {@recharge 6}
entries: The blestsessebe's horns flare brightly for a moment, distracting its enemies. Each hostile creature within 60 feet of the blestsessebe and that can see its horns must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or be entranced by the blestsessebe until the start of the blestsessebe's next turn. An entranced creature has disadvantage on attack rolls against creatures other than the blestsessebe.

action.name: Hastening Stomp {@recharge 5}
entries: The blestsessebe rears and stomps, sending out a small, magical shockwave. For 1 minute, each friendly creature within 60 feet of the blestsessebe increases its speed by 10 feet and can use the Free Runner bonus action.

bonus.name: Free Runner
entries: The blestsessebe can take the {@action Dash} action.

trait.name: Barnacle Shivers
entries: Characterized by the inescapable cold-and subsequent shivering-that slowly pervades the victim's body, barnacle shivers is a disease that infects creatures attacked by blood barnacles. Until the disease is cured, the infected creature can't regain hp except by magical means, and its hp maximum decreases by 3 ({@damage 1d6}) for every 24 hours that elapse. This reduction lasts until the disease is cured. The creature dies if the disease reduces its hp maximum to 0. A Humanoid or Beast slain by this disease rises 24 hours later as a zombie. The zombie isn't under the blood barnacle's control, but it views the blood barnacle as an ally.

trait.name: Blood Sense
entries: The blood barnacle can pinpoint, by scent, the location of creatures that aren't Constructs or Undead and that don't have all of their hp within 60 feet of it and can sense the general direction of such creatures within 1 mile of it.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the blood barnacle remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal barnacle.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage, and the blood barnacle attaches to the target. While attached, the blood barnacle doesn't attack. Instead, at the start of each of the blood barnacle's turns, the target loses 5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) hp due to blood loss.

The blood barnacle can detach itself by spending 5 feet of its movement. A creature, including the target, can take its action to detach the blood barnacle by succeeding on a {@dc 12} Strength check. When the blood barnacle is removed, the target takes 2 ({@damage 1d4}) piercing damage.

If a creature ends its turn with a blood barnacle attached to it, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or contract the barnacle shivers disease (see the Barnacle Shivers trait).

reaction.name: Host Defense
entries: When a creature damages an attached blood barnacle with anything other than fire, the creature hosting the barnacle must succeed on a {@dc 12} Wisdom saving throw or use its reaction to protect the barnacle. The barnacle takes half the damage dealt to it, and the host takes the other half.

trait.name: Blood Sense
entries: The blood flurry can pinpoint, by scent, the location of creatures that aren't Undead or Constructs within 30 feet of it.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the blood flurry remains motionless, either resting on the ground or carried by natural winds, it is indistinguishable from a collection of snowflakes. The blood flurry loses this trait if it has consumed blood in the last 24 hours.

trait.name: Rust Vulnerability
entries: The large amount of iron in the blood flurry's diet makes it susceptible to effects that harm ferrous metal, such as the rust monster's Antennae.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The blood flurry can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the blood flurry can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny crystalline Aberration. The blood flurry can't regain hp or gain temporary hp.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The blood flurry makes two Free Bleeding Cuts attacks.

action.name: Free Bleeding Cuts
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 0 ft., one target in the swarm's space. {@h}27 ({@damage 6d8}) slashing damage, or 13 ({@damage 3d8}) slashing damage if the blood flurry has half of its hp or fewer. If the target is a creature other than an Undead or a Construct, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or lose 13 ({@damage 3d8}) hp at the start of each of its turns due to a bleeding wound. Any creature can take an action to stanch the wound with a successful {@dc 12} Wisdom ({@skill Medicine}) check. The wound also closes if the target receives magical healing.

trait.name: Call of the Grave
entries: Attacks made within 60 feet of the bone collector score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20.

trait.name: Death Sense
entries: The bone collector can pinpoint, by scent, the location of Undead creatures and creatures that have been dead no longer than 1 week within 60 feet of it and can sense the general direction of such creatures within 1 mile of it.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The bone collector has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Undead Nature
entries: The bone collector doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Talons
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) slashing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 11} Constitution saving throw or contract a disease. Until the disease is cured, the target can't regain hp except by magical means, and the target's hp maximum decreases by 3 ({@damage 1d6}) every 24 hours. If the target's hp maximum drops to 0 as a result of this disease, the target dies.

action.name: Bad Omen (1/Day)
entries: The bone collector places a bad omen on a creature it can see within 20 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 10} Wisdom saving throw or be cursed for 1 minute. While cursed, the target has disadvantage on attack rolls against the bone collector. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

monster.name: Bone Lord

trait.name: Death-Infused Weapons
entries: The bone lord's weapon attacks are magical. When the bone lord hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@damage 2d8} necrotic damage (included in the attack).

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the bone lord fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Master Tactician
entries: The bone lord and any friendly Undead within 60 feet of it have advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the Undead's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Rejuvenation
entries: As long as at least one of its bones remains, a destroyed bone lord gathers a new body in {@dice 1d10} days, regaining all its hp and becoming active again. The new body appears within 5 feet of the largest remaining bone from its body.

trait.name: Turning Defiance
entries: The bone lord and any Undead within 60 feet of it have advantage on saving throws against effects that turn Undead.

trait.name: Undead Nature
entries: The bone lord doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The bone lord makes four Claw attacks. It can replace one attack with one Tail attack.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) slashing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) necrotic damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 19}). Until the grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}. The bone lord has for claws, each of which can grapple only one target.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d10 + 5}) bludgeoning damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 19} Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 15 feet away from the bone lord.

action.name: Fling
entries: One Medium or smaller object held or creature {@condition grappled} by the bone lord is thrown up to 60 feet in a random direction and knocked {@condition prone}. If a thrown target strikes a solid surface, the target takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet it was thrown. If the target is thrown at another creature, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw or take the same damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Servants of Death
entries: The bone lord magically calls {@dice 3d6} skeletons or zombies, {@dice 2d4} ghouls, or 2 wights. The called creatures arrive in {@dice 1d4} rounds, acting as allies of the bone lord and obeying its spoken commands. The Undead remain for 1 hour, until the bone lord dies, or until the bone lord dismisses them as a bonus action. The bone lord can have any number of Undead under its control at one time, provided the combined total CR of the Undead is no higher than 8.

action.name: Pattern of Death {@recharge 6}
entries: Necrotic energy ripples out from the bone lord. Each creature that isn't a Construct or Undead within 30 feet of the bone lord must make a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw, taking 54 ({@damage 12d8}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Each friendly Undead within 30 feet of the bone lord, including the bone lord, regains hp equal to half the single highest amount of necrotic damage dealt.

legendaryHeader: The bone lord can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The bone lord regains spent legendary actions at the start of their turn.

legendary.name: Sovereign's Onslaught
entries: The bone lord commands up to four friendly Undead it can see within 60 feet of it to move. Each target can use its reaction to immediately move up to its speed. This movement doesn't provoke {@action opportunity attack||opportunity attacks}.

legendary.name: Sovereign's Reprisal
entries: The bone lord commands one friendly Undead within 30 feet of it to attack. The target can make one weapon attack as a reaction.

legendary.name: Call Servants (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The bone lord uses Servants of Death.

legendary.name: Fling (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The bone lord uses Fling.

trait.name: Colony Cluster
entries: The brain coral consists of a Huge central spire and three Small clusters. Each cluster acts on the brain coral's turn and shares its movement, allowing the central spire and the clusters to swim a total of 120 feet on the brain coral's turn. A cluster can't move further than 120 feet away from the central spire. A cluster more than 120 feet away from its central spire for more than 24 hours enters a dormant state, becoming a new brain coral after 30 days.

A brain coral and its clusters share hp, and damage dealt to a cluster or the central spire reduces that shared total. If more than one section of the brain coral is included in a damaging spell or effect, such as a Dragon's breath weapon or the {@spell lightning bolt} spell, the brain coral makes one saving throw and takes damage as if only one of its sections was affected. Whenever the brain coral takes 15 damage or more in a single turn, one of its clusters is destroyed.

At the end of its turn, if the brain coral took damage on the previous turn, it can expel one new cluster from the central spire for every 15 damage it took. The brain coral can't have more than five clusters active at one time.

trait.name: Water Breathing
entries: The brain coral can breathe only underwater.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The brain coral makes one Pseudopod attack from its central spire and one additional Pseudopod attack for each cluster it has. These additional Pseudopod attacks can originate from the central spire or from any cluster, provided the target is within reach of the attack's origin.

action.name: Pseudopod
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Reef Poison Spray {@recharge 5}
entries: The brain coral expels a cloud of poison. Each creature within 15 feet of the brain coral's central spire must make a {@dc 15} Intelligence saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) poison damage and is {@condition incapacitated} until the end of its next turn. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Beasts of the Sea (1/Day)
entries: The brain coral magically calls {@dice 2d4} giant crabs, 2 giant sea horses or reef sharks, or 1 swarm of quippers, provided the brain coral is underwater. The called creatures arrive in {@dice 1d4} rounds, acting as allies of the brain coral and obeying its telepathic commands. The Beasts remain for 1 hour, until the brain coral dies, or until the brain coral dismisses them as a bonus action.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The brownie has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Speak with Beasts
entries: The brownie can communicate with Beasts as if they shared a language.

action.name: Branch Spear
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d4 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Domestic Magic
entries: The brownie can cast the {@spell mending} and {@spell prestidigitation} cantrips at will, requiring no material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability.

action.name: Invisibility
entries: The brownie magically turns {@condition invisible} until it attacks or uses Domestic Magic, or until its concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment the brownie wears or carries is {@condition invisible} with it.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The brownie has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Mounted Warrior
entries: While mounted, the brownie's mount can't be {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Speak with Beasts
entries: The brownie can communicate with Beasts as if they shared a language.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The brownie makes two Branch Spear attacks, or it makes one Branch Spear attack and its mount makes one melee weapon attack.

action.name: Branch Spear
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d4 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Domestic Magic
entries: The brownie can cast the {@spell mending} and {@spell prestidigitation} cantrips at will, requiring no material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability.

action.name: Invisibility
entries: The brownie magically turns {@condition invisible} until it attacks, uses Domestic Magic, or Beasts of the Forest, or until its concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment the brownie wears or carries is {@condition invisible} with it.

action.name: Beasts of the Forest (1/Day)
entries: The brownie magically calls {@dice 2d4} hawks or ravens, or it calls 1 black bear or wolf. The called creatures arrive in {@dice 1d4} rounds, acting as allies of the brownie and obeying its spoken commands. The Beasts remain for 1 hour, until the brownie dies, or until the brownie dismisses them as a bonus action.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The brownie has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Speak with Beasts
entries: The brownie can communicate with Beasts as if they shared a language.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The brownie mystic makes three Mystic Staff or Magical Blast attacks. The mystic can replace one of the attacks with a use of Spellcasting.

action.name: Mystic Staff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d4 + 5}) bludgeoning damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) psychic damage.

action.name: Mystic Blast
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 6} to hit, ranged 60 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) psychic damage.

action.name: Invisibility
entries: The brownie magically turns {@condition invisible} until it attacks or uses Spellcasting, or until its concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment the brownie wears or carries is {@condition invisible} with it.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The brownie casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 13}):

trait.name: Snow Stride
entries: A brumalek can burrow through nonmagical snow and earth. While doing so, it doesn't disturb the material it moves through. In addition, difficult terrain composed of snow doesn't cost it extra movement.

action.name: Headbutt
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Reverberating Howl
entries: The brumalek releases an ear-shattering howl in a 30-foot cone that is audible 300 feet away. Each creature in that cone must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 5 ({@damage 2d4}) thunder damage and is {@condition deafened} for 1 minute. On a success, the creature takes half the damage and isn't {@condition deafened}. A {@condition deafened} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

bonus.name: Skittish
entries: The brumalek can take the {@action Dash} or {@action Disengage} action.

trait.name: Firesight
entries: The caldera kite can see through areas obscured by fire, smoke, and fog without penalty.

trait.name: Flyby
entries: The caldera kite doesn't provoke {@action opportunity attack||opportunity attacks} when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

trait.name: Sulfuric Haze
entries: A glittering haze emanates from the caldera kite within 10 feet of it. The haze moves with the caldera kite, lightly obscuring the area. If dispersed by a wind of moderate or greater speed (at least 10 miles per hour), the haze reappears at the start of the caldera kite's next turn. When a creature enters the haze's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, that creature must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage and is {@condition poisoned} until the end of its next turn. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn't {@condition poisoned}. If a creature's saving throw is successful, it is immune to the Sulphuric Haze of all caldera kites for 1 minute.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The caldera kite makes two Wings attacks or one Wings attack and one Proboscis attack.

action.name: Proboscis
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage. The target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 17}) if it is a Medium or smaller creature and the caldera kite doesn't have another creature {@condition grappled}. Until this grapple ends, the creature is {@condition restrained}, the caldera kite can automatically hit the target with its Proboscis, and the caldera kite can't make Proboscis attacks against other targets.

action.name: Wings
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage and 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Dust Cloud {@recharge 4}
entries: The caldera kite thrashes its body and releases stored toxic gases. Each creature within 20 feet of the caldera kite must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw, taking 28 ({@damage 8d6}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature that fails the saving throw can't speak and is {@quickref suffocating||2} until it is no longer within 20 feet of the caldera kite.

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: The capybear can hold its breath for 30 minutes.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The capybear has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The capybear has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the capybear's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Pounce
entries: If the capybear moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a Slam attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the capybear can make one Bite attack against it as a bonus action.

trait.name: Swamp Camouflage
entries: The capybear has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to hide in swamps or muddy terrain.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.

reaction.name: Protect the Community
entries: When another capybear within 5 feet of this capybear is hit by an attack, this capybear can leap in the way, becoming the new target of the attack.

trait.name: Calming Presence
entries: A creature that enters a space within 5 feet of the caretaker weevil or that starts its turn there must succeed on a {@dc 13} Charisma saving throw or be indifferent to all creatures that it is hostile toward while it remains within 60 feet of the weevil. This indifference ends if the creature is attacked or harmed by a spell or if it witnesses any of its allies being harmed.

trait.name: Diligent Preservation
entries: A creature that isn't a Construct or Undead and that starts its turn with 0 hp within 60 feet of the caretaker weevil becomes stable. In addition, any corpse within 60 feet of the weevil is protected from decay and can't become Undead while it remains within 60 feet of the weevil and for 24 hours after it leaves the area.

action.name: Mandibles
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d8 + 1}) slashing damage.

action.name: Glue Glob
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 3} to hit, range 30/60 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d6}) acid damage. The target must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, it is {@condition restrained} for 1 minute. On a success, its speed is halved for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Regenerative Spittle (3/Day)
entries: The caretaker weevil launches spittle at one creature it can see within 10 feet of it. The target regains 2 ({@damage 1d4}) hp. For 1 minute, the target regains 1 hp at the start of each of its turns.

trait.name: Well-Grounded
entries: The catamount has advantage on ability checks and saving throws made against effects that would knock it {@condition prone}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The catamount makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d4 + 4}) slashing damage.

bonus.name: Control Earth
entries: The catamount molds the ground near it, causing one of the following effects:

items.name: Stone Wall.
items.entry: The catamount causes a wall of rock to rise from the ground at a point it can see within 30 feet of it. The wall is up to 30 feet long, 5 feet high, and 5 feet thick. It can be any shape, as long as its base is connected to the ground. If the wall cuts through a creature's space when it appears, the creature is pushed to one side (the catamount's choice). If a creature would be surrounded on all sides by the wall, it can make a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw. On a success, it can use its reaction to move up to its speed so that it is no longer enclosed by the wall. The wall lasts 1 minute or until the catamount creates a new wall.

items.name: Fissure.
items.entry: The catamount causes a rift to form in the ground at a point it can see within 30 feet of it. The rift can be up to 15 feet wide, up to 30 feet long and up to 10 feet deep, and it can be any shape. Each creature standing on a spot where the fissure opens must succeed on a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw or fall in. A creature that successfully saves moves with the fissure's edge as it opens. A fissure that opens beneath a structure causes it to automatically collapse as if the structure was in the area of an {@spell earthquake} spell. The catamount can have only one fissure open at a time. If it opens another, the previous fissure closes, shunting all creatures inside it to the surface.

items.name: Tremors.
items.entry: The catamount causes the earth beneath its feet to shake and shift. Each creature within 30 feet of the catamount must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or take 3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Pierce the Veil
entries: When a creature the catonoctrix can see is {@condition stunned} by Mind Ravage, the catonoctrix learns one secret the creature knows.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The catonoctrix makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks, or it makes three Psychic Bolt attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 3d8 + 5}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) psychic damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 3d6 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Psychic Bolt
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 8} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 4d6 + 4}) psychic damage.

action.name: Mind Ravage {@recharge 5}
entries: The catonoctrix unleashes a torrent of psychic energy. Each creature within 20 feet of the catonoctrix must make a {@dc 16} Intelligence saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 45 ({@damage 10d8}) psychic damage and is {@condition stunned} for 1 minute. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn't {@condition stunned}. A {@condition stunned} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

reaction.name: Precognitive Dodge
entries: The catonoctrix adds 4 to its AC against one attack that would hit it. To do so, the catonoctrix must see the attacker and be within 30 feet of it.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
headerEntries: The catonoctrix casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 15}):

trait.name: Rubbery Flesh
entries: The catterball is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form, and it has advantage on ability checks and saving throws made to escape a grapple. In addition, it can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Standing Leap (Ball Form Only)
entries: The catterball's long jump is up to 60 feet and its high jump is up to 30 feet, with or without a running start.

action.name: Snap Back (Extended Form Only)
entries: The catterball violently returns to its true form. Each creature within 5 feet of the catterball must make a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 4 ({@damage 1d8}) thunder damage, or 9 ({@damage 2d8}) if the catterball has extended its reach to 15 feet, and is {@condition deafened} for 1 minute. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn't {@condition deafened}. A {@condition deafened} creature can make a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

bonus.name: Change Form
entries: The catterball can extend its body, roll up into a ball, or return to its true form. Each time it extends its body, its reach with its slam attack increases by 5 feet, to a maximum of 15 feet, and its Armor Class decreases by 1.

variant.name: Catterball Familiars
entries: Some catterballs are willing to serve spellcasters, especially those who enjoy mayhem. Such catterballs have the following trait.

entries.name: Familiar
entries: The catterball can serve another creature as a familiar, forming a magic, telepathic bond with that willing companion. While the two are bonded, the companion can sense what the catterball senses as long as they are within 1 mile of each other. While the catterball is within 10 feet of its companion, the companion increases its reach by 5 feet. At any time and for any reason, the catterball can end its service as a familiar, ending the telepathic bond.

items.name: Familiar
entries: The catterball can serve another creature as a familiar, forming a magic, telepathic bond with that willing companion. While the two are bonded, the companion can sense what the catterball senses as long as they are within 1 mile of each other. While the catterball is within 10 feet of its companion, the companion increases its reach by 5 feet. At any time and for any reason, the catterball can end its service as a familiar, ending the telepathic bond.

trait.name: Adhesive (Object or Terrain Form Only)
entries: The mimic adheres to anything that touches it. A creature adhered to the cave mimic is also {@condition grappled} by it (escape {@dc 15}). Ability checks made to escape this grapple have disadvantage. It can choose for a creature to not be affected by this trait.

trait.name: False Appearance (Object or Terrain Form Only)
entries: While the mimic remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary object or terrain feature.

trait.name: Grappler
entries: The mimic has advantage on attack rolls against any creature {@condition grappled} by it.

trait.name: Object Mimicry (Object or Terrain Form Only)
entries: The mimic can shape minor pseudopods into Medium or smaller objects. A creature that sees such an object can tell it is an imitation with a successful {@dc 15} Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) check. A creature with at least half its body in contact with the object, such as sitting on an imitation chair, is subjected to the mimic's Adhesive trait.

trait.name: Stretched Form (Terrain Form Only)
entries: The mimic can occupy another creature's space and vice versa.

trait.name: Tunneler
entries: The cave mimic can burrow through solid rock at half its burrow speed and leaves a 15-foot-diameter tunnel in its wake.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The cave mimic makes four Pseudopod attacks.

action.name: Pseudopod
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d10 + 5}) bludgeoning damage. If the cave mimic is in object or terrain form, the target is subjected to the mimic's Adhesive trait.

action.name: Stalagteeth (Terrain Form Only) {@recharge 4}
entries: The cave mimic launches a harpoon-like pseudopod, shaped like a stalactite or other similarly pointed object, at one creature in its space. The target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw or take 24 ({@damage 7d6}) piercing damage and have the harpoon pseudopod stuck in it. While the pseudopod is stuck, the target is {@condition restrained} and takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) acid damage at the start of each of its turns, and the mimic can use a bonus action to pull the target up to 30 feet toward the mimic's nearest wall, ceiling, or similar surface. A creature, including the target, can take its action to detach the harpoon pseudopod by succeeding on a {@dc 15} Strength check. If the target detaches the harpoon while it is stuck to the ceiling of the mimic, the target takes falling damage as normal.

bonus.name: Change Shape
entries: The cave mimic transforms into a Gargantuan object or stretches itself out as terrain no larger than a 35-foot cube or back into its true, amorphous form. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks not made with adamantine weapons

trait.name: Deathlights
entries: When a creature that can see the cave sovereign's glowing antennae starts its turn within 30 feet of the cave sovereign, the cave sovereign can force it to make a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw if the cave sovereign isn't {@condition incapacitated} and can see the creature. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the creature is {@condition stunned} until the start of its next turn. Otherwise, a creature that fails the save is {@condition incapacitated} and its speed is reduced to 0 until the start of its next turn as it remains transfixed in place by the lights.

Unless surprised, a creature can avert its eyes to avoid the saving throw at the start of its turn. If the creature does so, it can't see the cave sovereign until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again. If the creature looks at the cave sovereign in the meantime, it must immediately make the save.

trait.name: Illumination
entries: The cave sovereign's antennae shed dim light in a 5-foot radius. This radius increases to 20 feet while at least one creature is {@condition incapacitated} or {@condition stunned} by Deathlights. At the start of its turn if no creatures are incapacitated or {@condition stunned} by Deathlights, the cave sovereign can suppress this light until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Inscrutable
entries: The cave sovereign is immune to any effect that would sense its emotions or read its thoughts, as well as any divination spell that it refuses. Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) checks made to ascertain the cave sovereign's intentions or sincerity have disadvantage.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the cave sovereign fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The cave sovereign has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Sinuous Form
entries: Provided there is suitable room to accommodate its bulk, the cave sovereign can squeeze through any opening large enough for a Small creature.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The cave sovereign can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The cave sovereign makes one Bite attack and two Slam attacks. It can make one Tail attack in place of its Bite attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}25 ({@damage 4d8 + 7}) piercing damage plus 11 ({@damage 2d10}) poison damage.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}23 ({@damage 3d10 + 7}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}26 ({@damage 3d12 + 7}) slashing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 18}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the cave sovereign can't use its tail on another target.

action.name: Consume Soul {@recharge 5}
entries: The cave sovereign chooses up to three creatures it can see within 60 feet of it that are incapacitated or {@condition stunned} by Deathlights. Each target must make a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw, taking 55 ({@damage 10d10}) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature {@condition stunned} by Deathlights has disadvantage on this saving throw. The cave sovereign then regains hit points equal to half the total psychic damage dealt.

A Humanoid slain by this attack rises {@dice 1d4} rounds later as a zombie under the cave sovereign's control, unless the Humanoid is restored to life or its body is destroyed. The cave sovereign can have no more than thirty zombies under its control at one time.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
headerEntries: The cave sovereign casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 18}):

legendary.name: Move
entries: The cave sovereign moves up to its speed without provoking {@action opportunity attack||opportunity attacks}.

legendary.name: Telekinetic Reel
entries: The cave sovereign magically pulls a creature it can see that is {@condition incapacitated} or {@condition stunned} by its Deathlights up to 20 feet straight toward it.

legendary.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The cave sovereign uses Spellcasting.

legendary.name: Tail Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The cave sovereign makes one Tail attack.

trait.name: Pandemonium Fruit
entries: The chaos creeper produces pitcher-shaped magical fruit. When a creature picks a fruit, it is subjected to the chaos creeper's Wondrous Cornucopia trait. A fruit withers 24 hours after being picked, losing all magic. If a creature expends a spell slot of 3rd level or higher or volunteers some of its life force while picking the fruit, it can choose which Wondrous Cornucopia effect happens instead of determining the effect randomly. A creature volunteering its life force must spend two Hit Dice, rolling the dice and losing hp equal to the total.

trait.name: Wondrous Cornucopia
entries: A creature that picks one of the chaos creeper's fruits or that is struck by the creeper's Fruit Bomb triggers the chaotic magic within the fruit. Roll a {@dice d8} to determine which of the following effects happens:

trait.name: Butterfly Cloud
entries: The fruit explodes into a cloud of butterflies, swirling out in a 30-foot radius from the fruit for 1 minute, making the area heavily obscured.

trait.name: Restoration
entries: A creature eating the fruit ends one condition, disease, or any reduction to one of its ability scores, or it reduces its {@condition exhaustion} level by one.

trait.name: Poison Gas
entries: The fruit bursts into a cloud of red gas in a 20-foot radius centered on the fruit. The area is heavily obscured and lasts for 1 minute or until dispersed by a strong wind. When a creature enters the cloud for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, that creature must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw, taking 22 ({@damage 5d8}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Healing
entries: A creature eating the fruit regains 22 ({@damage 5d8}) hp.

trait.name: Swarming Insects
entries: The fruit bursts, releasing {@dice 2d4} swarms of insects.

trait.name: Protection
entries: A creature eating the fruit gains resistance to acid, cold, fire, lightning, poison, or thunder damage (determined randomly) for 8 hours.

trait.name: Squirrel Transformation
entries: A creature eating the fruit must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or transform into a squirrel for 10 minutes.

trait.name: Cleansing
entries: All curses and diseases afflicting a creature end when it eats the fruit.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The chaos creeper makes three Vine Whip attacks or two Fruit Bomb attacks.

action.name: Vine Whip
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 4d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Fruit Bomb
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}31 ({@damage 5d10 + 4}) acid, cold, fire, lightning, poison, or thunder damage (the chaos creeper's choice). Instead of dealing damage, the chaos creeper can choose for the fruit to trigger its Wondrous Cornucopia trait. Treat the target as if it ate the fruit, where applicable.

monster.name: Chaos Raptor
languages: understands Common and Terran, but can't speak

trait.name: Aura of Chaos
entries: When a creature with an Intelligence of 4 or higher starts its turn within 30 feet of the chaos raptor, the creature must make a {@dc 18} Charisma saving throw. On a failure, the creature can't take reactions until the start of its next turn and must roll a {@dice d8} to determine what it does during that turn. On a 1 to 4, the creature does nothing. On a 5 or 6, the creature takes no action but uses all its movement to move in a random direction. On a 7 or 8, the creature makes one melee attack against a randomly determined creature within its reach, or it does nothing if no creature is within its reach. At the start of the chaos raptor's turn, it chooses whether this aura is active.

trait.name: Earth Glide
entries: The chaos raptor can burrow through nonmagical, unworked earth and stone. While doing so, the chaos raptor doesn't disturb the material it moves through.

trait.name: Keen Sight
entries: The chaos raptor has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The chaos raptor regains 20 hp at the start of its turn if at least half of its body is submerged in earth or stone. If the chaos raptor takes thunder damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the chaos raptor's next turn. The chaos raptor dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hp and doesn't regenerate.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The chaos raptor makes one Beak attack and one Talons attack.

action.name: Beak
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}27 ({@damage 4d8 + 9}) piercing damage.

action.name: Talons
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}23 ({@damage 4d6 + 9}) slashing damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 18}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the chaos raptor can't use its talons on another target.

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks not made with silvered weapons

trait.name: Inner Light
entries: Its open mouth emits a red light, shedding bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet. Opening or closing its mouth doesn't require an action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The chemosit makes one Beak attack and two Crutch attacks.

action.name: Beak
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Crutch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or become infected with the cackle fever disease.

action.name: Inviting Song
entries: The chemosit sings an enchanting tune. Each creature with an Intelligence of 5 or higher within 300 feet of the chemosit that can hear the song must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} until the song ends. The chemosit must take a bonus action on its subsequent turns to continue singing. It can stop singing at any time. The song ends if the chemosit is {@condition incapacitated}.

If the {@condition charmed} target is more than 5 feet away from the chemosit, the target must move on its turn toward the chemosit by the most direct route, trying to get within 5 feet. It won't move into damaging terrain, such as lava or a pit, taking whatever route it can to avoid the terrain and still reach the chemosit. If the target can't find a safe route to the chemosit, the {@condition charmed} effect ends. Whenever the target takes damage or at the end of each of its turns, the target can repeat the saving throw. If the saving throw is successful, the effect ends on it. A target that successfully saves is immune to this chemosit's Inviting Song for the next 24 hours.

bonus.name: Change Shape
entries: The chemosit magically transforms into a Small or Medium Humanoid or back into its true Fiendish form. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. No matter the form, the chemosit always has only one leg. Its crutch adjusts to fit its new form, but no other equipment transforms. It reverts to its true form if it dies, and its crutch becomes nonmagical.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the royal chimera fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Regal Bearing
entries: The chimera's AC includes its Charisma modifier.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The chimera makes one Bite attack, one Claws attack, and one Eldritch Horns attack, or it makes two Arcane Blast attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 3d6 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 3d6 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Eldritch Horns
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 2d12 + 5}) force damage.

action.name: Serpent Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Arcane Blast
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 10} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 3d10 + 5}) force damage.

action.name: Searing Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The dragon head exhales a 30-foot cone of fire that burns and blinds. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 45 ({@damage 10d8}) fire damage and is {@condition blinded} until the end of its next turn. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn't {@condition blinded}.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The chimera's goat head casts one of the following spells, requiring only verbal components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 18}):

legendary.name: Prideful Prowl
entries: The chimera moves up to its walking speed, or flies up to half its flying speed, without provoking {@action opportunity attack||opportunity attacks}.

legendary.name: Serpent Strike
entries: The chimera makes one Serpent Strike attack.

legendary.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The chimera uses Spellcasting.

legendary.name: Roar of the King (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The lion head lets out a bellow that spurs on its allies. Each friendly creature, including the chimera, within 30 feet of the chimera that can hear the roar gains 11 ({@damage 2d10}) temporary hp and can't be {@condition frightened} for 1 minute.
