This chimera has a lion's mane plaited in gold, a goat head with magic sparking between its curved horns, a smoking dragon's head, and a hissing serpent for a tail.

Chimeras that discover the luxury of long life inevitably enjoy the servitude of lesser creatures. Declaring sovereignty—with few willing to dispute the claim—such chimera foster unceasing ambition for power, wealth, and status.

entries.name: Profane Magic
entries: Any chimera that lives long enough to claim royalty and be recognized as such soon gains magical power, often commanded by its goat head. With this power, the goat transfigures the chimera's tail into a snake, giving the chimera the knowledge of speech and greater capability for deception and manipulation. Though the transformation of the tail provides the knowledge of speech, the chimera can speak through any of its heads.

trait.name: Mirror Scales
entries: While the chroma lizard is in bright light, creatures that rely on sight have disadvantage on attack rolls against the lizard.

trait.name: Mirror Shy
entries: If the chroma lizard sees itself reflected in a polished surface within 30 feet of it and in an area of bright light, the lizard immediately closes its eyes and is {@condition blinded} until the start of its next turn when it can check for the reflection again.

trait.name: Radiant Reflection
entries: When a creature deals radiant damage to the chroma lizard, half the radiant damage the lizard took is reflected back at that creature.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The chroma lizard uses Dazzling Display. It then makes one Bite attack and one Claws attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d10 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Dazzling Display
entries: The chroma lizard causes its chrome scales to ripple, casting dizzying reflections of light. Each creature that can see the chroma lizard must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution save or be {@condition blinded} until the end of its next turn. The lizard can't use this action while in darkness, and creatures have advantage on the saving throw if the chroma lizard is in dim light.

trait.name: Digestive Dew
entries: A creature that starts its turned {@condition grappled} by the climbing vine takes 2 ({@damage 1d4}) acid damage.

trait.name: Flexible Form
entries: A climbing vine can move through a space as narrow as 6 inches wide without squeezing.

action.name: Dewvine
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}The target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 11}). The climbing vine has two attacking vines, each of which can grapple only one creature.

action.name: Squeeze
entries: The climbing vine squeezes creatures in its grasp. Each creature {@condition grappled} by the climbing vine must succeed on a {@dc 11} Strength saving throw or take 5 ({@damage 2d4}) bludgeoning damage.

reaction.name: Grasping Retaliation
entries: When a creature hits the climbing vine with a melee attack while within 5 feet of the vine, the vine can make one Dewvine attack against it.

monster.name: Clockwork Armadillo
languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

trait.name: Construct Nature
entries: The armadillo doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The armadillo is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The armadillo has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Overclocked
entries: The armadillo has advantage on initiative rolls.

action.name: Scissor Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) slashing damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 11} Constitution saving throw or drop whatever it is currently holding.

action.name: Tuck In
entries: The armadillo tucks its entire body into its shell, forming an armored ball. While an armored ball, it moves by rolling, has resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage, is immune to the {@condition prone} condition, and it can't make Scissor Claws attacks. As part of this action, the armadillo can expand its shell outward to contain one object of its size or smaller that isn't being worn or carried and is within 5 feet of the armadillo. The armadillo can uncurl its body and release any contained item as a bonus action.

monster.name: Clockwork Conductor
languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

trait.name: Construct Nature
entries: The conductor doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The conductor is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The conductor has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Metronomic Aura
entries: When a friendly creature within 20 feet of the conductor makes an attack or a Charisma ({@skill Performance}) check, the creature can treat the d20 roll as a 10 instead of using the die's actual roll.

action.name: Conductive Baton
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) bludgeoning damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) lightning damage, and the target can't take reactions until the start of its next turn.

action.name: Overclocked Finale (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The conductor makes a grand sacrifice, spurring its allies on in a final masterstroke. Each friendly creature within 30 feet of the conductor that can see it gains a +5 bonus to attack rolls, damage rolls, and ability checks for until the end of the conductor's next turn. Roll a {@dice d6}. On a 1 to 4, the conductor can't use Concerted Effort until it finishes a short rest. On a 5 or 6, it can't use Concerted Effort, and its Metronomic Aura becomes inactive until it finishes a short rest.

bonus.name: Concerted Effort
entries: The conductor inspires itself or one friendly creature it can see within 30 feet of it until the start of the conductor's next turn. When the target makes an attack roll or a Constitution saving throw to maintain concentration on a spell, the target can roll a {@dice d4} and add the number rolled to the attack roll or saving throw.

trait.name: Construct Nature
entries: A clockwork pugilist doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The clockwork pugilist is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The clockwork pugilist has advantage on saving throws against spells or other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The clockwork pugilist makes two Fist attacks.

action.name: Fist
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Brass Onslaught {@recharge 6}
entries: The pugilist moves up to 10 feet and makes one fist attack. If it hits, the target takes an extra 10 ({@damage 3d6}) bludgeoning damage. This movement doesn't provoke {@action opportunity attack||opportunity attacks}.

reaction.name: Get Down, Sir!
entries: When a creature within 5 feet of the pugilist is targeted by a ranged attack or spell, the pugilist steps in the way, and the ranged attack or spell targets the pugilist instead.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The pugilist adds 2 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the pugilist must see the attacker and have at least one hand empty.

monster.name: Clockwork Scorpion

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks not made with adamantine weapons

languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

trait.name: Construct Nature
entries: The clockwork scorpion doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The clockwork scorpion is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The clockwork scorpion has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The clockwork scorpion makes one Sting attack and two Claw attacks.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d12 + 4}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 16}). The clockwork scorpion has two claws, each of which can grapple only one target.

action.name: Sting
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) piercing damage plus 22 ({@damage 4d10}) poison damage. The scorpion then chooses one of the following alchemical solutions, and the target must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw. The effect is determined by the chosen solution.

action.name: Hallucinatory Elixir
entries: On a failed save, the target sees enemies everywhere for 1 minute. On its turn, the target uses its action to make a melee attack against the nearest creature that is not the clockwork scorpion, moving up to its speed toward the creature, if necessary. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If the target succeeds on the initial save, it is {@condition charmed} until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Sleep Solution
entries: On a failed save, the target falls {@condition unconscious} for 1 minute. This effect ends for the target if it takes damage or if another creature takes an action to wake it. On a successful save, the target is {@condition incapacitated} until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Vocal Paralytic
entries: On a failed save, the target is {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. While {@condition poisoned} in this way, the target is unable to speak or cast spells that require verbal components. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If the target succeeds on the initial save, it is {@condition poisoned} in this way until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Acid Spray {@recharge 5}
entries: The clockwork scorpion spews acid in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw, taking 42 ({@damage 12d6}) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

reaction.name: Gas Nozzles
entries: When the clockwork scorpion takes damage, each creature within 5 feet of it takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) poison damage. If the damage it took was fire, the gas ignites and deals an extra 5 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage.

monster.name: Clockwork Tactician
languages: Common plus up to two languages of its creator

trait.name: Construct Nature
entries: The clockwork tactician doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The clockwork tactician is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The clockwork tactician has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The tactician's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: This clockwork tactician has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of this tactician's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The clockwork tactician makes four Multiweapon attacks.

action.name: Multiweapon
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage. The clockwork tactician chooses the damage type when it attacks.

action.name: Heavy Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) piercing damage.

bonus.name: Battlefield Commands
entries: The clockwork tactician issues commands to up to three friendly creatures it can see within 60 feet of it. Each target has advantage on its next ability check or attack roll, provided it can hear and understand the tactician.

bonus.name: Press the Attack
entries: If the clockwork tactician hits one target with two Multiweapon attacks or scores a critical hit with its multiweapon, it can make one additional Multiweapon attack.

reaction.name: Quick Study
entries: When a creature hits the clockwork tactician with an attack, the tactician makes a {@dc 13} Intelligence check. On a success, it chooses one of the following benefits:

items: The tactician has advantage on melee attack rolls against the attacker.
The attacker has disadvantage on attack rolls against the tactician.
The tactician has resistance to the type of damage from the attack that hit it.

entries: The tactician can have more than one benefit active at a time. The benefits end when the tactician attacks a different creature or uses Quick Study on a different creature.

trait.name: Shoving Charge
entries: If the cloudhoof assassin moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a Headbutt attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 10 feet away from the cloudhoof. If a creature fails this saving throw by 5 or more, it is pushed up to 15 feet.

trait.name: Sure-Hooved
entries: The cloudhoof assassin has advantage on Strength and Dexterity checks and saving throws made against effects that would knock it {@condition prone}. In addition, it has advantage on Strength ({@skill Athletics}) checks to climb rocky surfaces and Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) checks to maintain its balance on rocky surfaces.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The cloudhoof assassin makes one Headbutt attack and one Shoving Kick attack.

action.name: Headbutt
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Shoving Kick
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 5 feet away from the cloudhoof assassin. If the cloudhoof scores a critical hit, the target is pushed up to 10 feet on a failed save.

trait.name: Glowing Organs
entries: While underwater, the coastline reaper's internal organs glow an eerie, pale blue, shedding dim light in a 10-foot radius.

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: While out of water, the coastline reaper can hold its breath for 30 minutes.

trait.name: Water Breathing
entries: The coastline reaper can breathe only underwater.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The coastline reaper makes two Tentacle Lash attacks and one Stinging Tentacle attack.

action.name: Tentacle Lash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 3d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Stinging Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) poison damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute. A {@condition frightened} creature has disadvantage on this saving throw. The {@condition paralyzed} target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Frightening Visage {@recharge 5}
entries: If underwater, the coastline reaper flares the light from its organs, making the skull-like structure within more apparent. If above water, the coastline reaper tightly pulls in its outer flesh, causing its body to take on a fleshy, skull-like appearance. Each Humanoid within 30 feet of the coastline reaper that can see it must make a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) psychic damage and is {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn't {@condition frightened}. A {@condition frightened} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

trait.name: Death Trap
entries: When the conniption bug dies, its mandibles remain locked in place, continuing to grapple beyond its death. Until the grapple ends, the creature takes 4 ({@damage 1d8}) piercing damage at the start of each of its turns as if the bug was still alive. Any creature can take an action to remove the mandibles with a successful {@dc 11} Strength ({@skill Athletics}) or Wisdom ({@skill Medicine}) check.

trait.name: Limited Amphibiousness
entries: The conniption bug can breathe air and water, but it needs to be submerged at least once every 4 hours to avoid {@quickref suffocating||2}.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The conniption bug has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the bug's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: The conniption bug's long jump is up to 20 feet and its high jump is up to 10 feet, with or without a running start.

trait.name: Vicious Wound
entries: The conniption bug's melee attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20.

action.name: Barbed Mandibles
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage. The target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 13}) if it is a Medium or smaller creature and the conniption bug doesn't have another creature {@condition grappled}. Until this grapple ends, the target takes 4 ({@damage 1d8}) piercing damage at the start of each of its turns, and the conniption bug can't make Barbed Mandible attacks against other targets.

action.name: Barbed Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

variant.name: Scourge Bug
entries: Those conniption bugs that mature in magically inundated regions develop a little differently. They are known as "scourge bugs" and have an affinity for elemental magic, which seeps from their saliva and coats their mandibles. A scourge bug has a challenge rating of 2 (450 XP), has resistance to acid, cold, fire, lightning, and poison damage, and has the following action option in place of Barbed Mandibles:

entries.name: Elemental Mandibles
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage. The target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 13}) if it is a Medium or smaller creature and the scourge bug doesn't have another creature {@condition grappled}. Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained} and takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison damage (the scourge bug's choice) at the start of each of its turns, and the scourge bug can't make Elemental Mandible attacks against other targets.

items.name: Elemental Mandibles
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage. The target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 13}) if it is a Medium or smaller creature and the scourge bug doesn't have another creature {@condition grappled}. Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained} and takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison damage (the scourge bug's choice) at the start of each of its turns, and the scourge bug can't make Elemental Mandible attacks against other targets.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the prismatic dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The prismatic dragon uses its Frightful Presence. It then makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 2d10 + 7}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d6 + 7}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d8 + 7}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Frightful Presence
entries: Each creature of the prismatic dragon's choice that is within 120 feet of the dragon and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the dragon's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Breath Weapon {@recharge 5}
entries: The prismatic dragon uses one of the following breath weapons:

items.name: Light Beam.
items.entry: The prismatic dragon emits a beam of white light in a 120-foot line that is 10 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a {@dc 23} Dexterity saving throw, taking 90 ({@damage 20d8}) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

items.name: Rainbow Blast.
items.entry: The prismatic dragon emits multicolored light in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 23} Dexterity saving throw, taking 72 ({@damage 16d8}) damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The dragon splits the damage up among acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison, choosing a number of {@dice d8|d8s} for each damage type totaling {@dice 16d8}. It must choose at least two damage types.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The prismatic dragon casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 20}):

legendary.name: Detect
entries: The prismatic dragon makes a Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check.

legendary.name: Tail Attack
entries: The prismatic dragon makes a tail attack.

legendary.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The prismatic dragon uses Spellcasting.

legendary.name: Shimmering Wings (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The prismatic dragon beats its wings. Each creature within 20 feet of the dragon must succeed on a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw or take 16 ({@damage 3d10}) radiant damage and become {@condition blinded} until the start of the dragon's next turn.

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The slime can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Ooze Nature
entries: The copperkill slime doesn't require sleep.

trait.name: Patinated Appearance
entries: While the slime remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from the object or structure it is stretched across, though the object or structure appears to be covered in green paint or verdigris.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The slime can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The copperkill slime makes three Pseudopod attacks. If the slime hits one creature with two Pseudopod attacks, the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained} and takes 9 ({@damage 2d8}) poison damage at the start of each of its turns. The copperkill slime can have only one target {@condition grappled} in this way at a time.

action.name: Pseudopod
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) poison damage.

action.name: Poisonous Snap (Stretched Body Only) {@recharge 5}
entries: While the copperkill slime is covering an object or structure, it can rapidly collapse back to its normal form, ending the stretch and spraying all nearby creatures with poisonous slime. Each creature within 10 feet of any space the stretched slime occupied before collapsing must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 27 ({@damage 6d8}) poison damage and is coated in poisonous slime. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn't coated in slime. A creature coated in poisonous slime takes 9 ({@damage 2d8}) poison damage at the start of each of its turns. A creature, including the slime-coated creature, can take an action to clean off the slime.

bonus.name: Stretch Body
entries: The copperkill slime stretches its body across the surface of a Gargantuan or smaller object or across the surface of a wall, pillar, or similar structure no larger than a 20-foot square within 5 feet of it, sharing the space of the object or structure. The slime can end the stretch as a bonus action, occupying the nearest unoccupied space to the object or structure.

trait.name: Downdraft
entries: While the moth is flying, the area within 10 feet of it is difficult terrain.

trait.name: Glow
entries: The moth casts light from its abdomen, shedding bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The moth has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Necrotic Dampening
entries: Each friendly creature within 30 feet of the moth has resistance to necrotic damage.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The moth can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The corpselight moth makes two Proboscis attacks.

action.name: Proboscis
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) radiant damage.

action.name: Radiant Wind {@recharge 4}
entries: The corpselight moth flaps its wings, releasing magical wind in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw. On a failure, a target takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) radiant damage and is flung up 15 feet away from the moth in a direction following the cone and knocked {@condition prone}.

If a thrown target strikes an object, such as a wall or floor, the target takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet it was thrown. If the target is thrown into another creature, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or take the same damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.
If the saving throw is successful, the target takes half the radiant damage and isn't flung away or knocked {@condition prone}.

variant.name: Midden Moth
entries: If the necrotic energy that accumulates in a corpselight moth isn't removed, the moth eventually transforms into a midden moth. Where the corpselight moth is like moonlight, the midden moth is like a moonless night.

A midden moth uses the statistics here, except it has resistance to radiant damage and immunity to necrotic damage, and it deals necrotic damage instead of radiant damage. It has the following trait in place of the Glow trait:

entries.name: Gloom
entries: A gloom extends from the midden moth's abdomen. Bright light within 40 feet of the midden moth becomes dim light, and dim light in the area becomes darkness.

items.name: Gloom
entries: A gloom extends from the midden moth's abdomen. Bright light within 40 feet of the midden moth becomes dim light, and dim light in the area becomes darkness.

monster.name: Cosmic Symphony
languages: understands all languages but can't speak

trait.name: Invisible
entries: The cosmic symphony is {@condition invisible}.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the cosmic symphony fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The cosmic symphony has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The cosmic symphony can use Universal Music. It then makes one Discordant Wave attack and one Slam attack or two Discordant Wave attacks.

action.name: Discordant Wave
entries: {@atk ms,rs} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 60/120 ft., one target. {@h}27 ({@damage 5d8 + 5}) thunder damage. The target and each creature within 10 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition deafened} until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}24 ({@damage 3d10 + 8}) bludgeoning damage plus 22 ({@damage 5d8}) thunder damage.

action.name: Universal Music
entries: Each creature of the symphony's choice within 120 feet of the cosmic symphony must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition incapacitated} for 1 minute. A creature that fails the saving throw by 5 or more is {@condition stunned} for 1 minute instead. A {@condition stunned} or {@condition incapacitated} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the cosmic symphony's Universal Music for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Celestial Crescendo {@recharge 5}
entries: Sound waves explode from the cosmic symphony. Each creature within 30 feet of the symphony must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 45 ({@damage 10d8}) thunder damage and is {@condition deafened} for 1 minute. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn't {@condition deafened}. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

legendary.name: Fly
entries: The cosmic symphony flies up to half its flying speed without provoking {@action opportunity attack||opportunity attacks}.

legendary.name: Major Chord (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The symphony regains 18 ({@damage 4d8}) hp.

legendary.name: Minor Chord (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Each creature within 10 feet of the symphony must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw or take 9 ({@damage 2d8}) thunder damage.

trait.name: Extradimensional Bag
entries: The duffel crab uses an extra-dimensional space, such as a bag of holding, as its "shell." The bag can hold creatures in addition to the crab, based on the size of the extradimensional space. Breathing creatures inside the bag can survive up to a number of minutes equal to 10 divided by the number of creatures (minimum 1 minute), after which time they begin to suffocate. If the bag is overloaded, pierced, or torn, it ruptures and is destroyed. While this would normally cause the contents to be lost in the Astral Plane, the crab's half-in, half-out existence kept the bag constantly open, even when it fully withdrew, altering the bag, which simply spills out its contents into the area when the bag is destroyed or the crab dies. The bag becomes a standard bag of holding or similar magic item with extradimensional space 24 hours after the crab dies.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While motionless and withdrawn into its extradimensional bag, the duffel crab is indistinguishable from its extradimensional bag with an ajar lid or opening.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The duffel crab makes two Claw attacks, or it makes one Claw attack and uses Collect.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 13}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the crab can't attack another target with that claw. The crab has two claws, each of which can grapple only one target.

action.name: Collect
entries: The crab places one target it is grappling into its extradimensional space, provided there is room, and the grapple ends. The target is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, and it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the extradimensional space. A trapped creature can take its action to climb out of the bag by succeeding on a {@dc 13} Strength or Dexterity check (the creature's choice). If the crab dies, a trapped creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by the crab and can escape from the bag using 5 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.
An enormous hermit crab pulls itself along the beach with its deep-red claws. Oddly, the bulk of its body is hidden inside a bag much too small to contain a creature of its size.

Duffel crabs are often found along coastlines and shipping routes where shipwrecks are common. Destroyed shipping vessels using extradimensional bags, chests, and other items to save on weight leave valuable trinkets for curious creatures. Duffel crabs come into existence when a hermit crab stumbles upon an extradimensional bag and takes it up as a shell. The latent magic of the bag causes the crab to grow to an enormous size.

entries.name: Food Hoarders
entries: The crab's bag provides an excellent storage solution to save food for a later date. A duffel crab's bag is often stocked with rotting sea creatures and the bodies of unfortunate sailors collected from shipwrecks. Living creatures are no exception in the crab's eyes, as they never live long in the suffocating interior of the extradimensional space.

entries.name: Risky Treasure
entries: To budding adventurers, duffel crabs present the opportunity to gain a unique treasure, if they are experienced and strong enough to face a hungry crab the size of a draft horse.

trait.name: Bladed Shell
entries: A creature that touches the crab or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Pounce
entries: If the crab moves at least 15 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a Shell Bash attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the crab can make one Claw attack against it as a bonus action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The crab makes one Claw attack and one Shell Bash attack.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 13}). The crab has two claws, each of which can grapple only one target.

action.name: Shell Bash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) bludgeoning plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) slashing damage.
With a thick exoskeleton studded with sharp ridges and low spines, this large crab harkens back to the primordial era before recorded history.

Razorback crabs are a rare form of crustacean that has evolved to live outside the water. In fact, the crabs' evolution has deprived it of its gills entirely, making it markedly unsuited for coastal or aquatic living. Instead, razorback crabs thrive in farmland and grassy plains and are the bane of farmers and other plains dwellers.

entries.name: Scuttling Tunnelers
entries: In places where a colony of razorback crabs has taken hold, the land is riddled with crisscrossing tunnels and moderately-sized burrows large enough to house three or four of the pests. The tunnels are large enough for a human to crawl through, or for a hound to walk in without difficulty, though the occasion of a dog touring the tunnels often ends in tragedy for the poor beast. Colonies of the crustaceans rarely number more than ten individuals. When a group grows larger, the heartiest young crab leaves with a few of its siblings to found a new colony nearby.

entries.name: Farmland Threat
entries: Razorback crabs are carnivorous and have a diet comprised primarily of insects and small animals. In their burrows, the crabs devour insects, annelids, and arthropods, but their favorite food is fowl, particularly chicken, partridge, and pheasant. Razorback crabs are not voracious, requiring only a few pounds of meat every week to survive, but a small colony of them can empty a chicken coop in a single night simply by burrowing into it. Farmers and their families take evidence of razorback crabs in an area very seriously, and they form search parties to track the creatures to their nests and put an end to them. A single crab is deadly, even to a group of armed farmers. When facing an infestation, the farmers prefer to keep their distance and burn the nuisances out without having to get close enough to come to harm.

entries.name: Succulent Flesh
entries: Like their aquatic counterparts, razorback crabs have tender, flavorful flesh, particularly when roasted. After a razorback crab colony has been put to the torch, the exultant farmers haul the carcasses away and invite their friends and neighbors for a feast of legs and pincers. A single razorback crab can easily feed a dozen people.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The samurai crab can breathe air and water.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The samurai crab makes three melee attacks. If the crab is grappling two creatures, it can't make Crustaceous Sword attacks.

action.name: Crustaceous Sword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}), and the crab can't use this claw to attack another target. The crab has two claws, each of which can grapple only one target.

bonus.name: Fighting Stance
entries: The samurai crab adopts a fighting stance, choosing from the options below. The stance lasts until the crab ends it (no action required) or uses this bonus action again.

items.name: Banded Claw.
items.entry: The samurai crab adopts a wide, grappler's stance. While the samurai crab is in this stance, each creature that starts its turn {@condition grappled} by the crab takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage.

items.name: Hard Shell.
items.entry: The samurai crab adopts a defensive stance, increasing its AC by 2.

items.name: Soft Shell.
items.entry: The samurai crab adopts an offensive stance, gaining advantage on the first Crustaceous Sword attack it makes each turn.

entries: A crab with a peculiar looking shell shaped like a helmet scuttles forward. It moves with uncanny precision as it draws a sword from a scabbard-like section of its carapace.

There are many rumors surrounding the creation of the first samurai crab. Some say they are cursed warriors who broke the creed they swore to uphold. Others say they were a wizard experiment gone wrong. Still other scholars speculate they are just unusually intelligent crabs who watched skilled warriors' movements from the shallows and began to mimic them. Samurai crabs are found near coastal cities, especially those with significant martial forces. It is believed that the presence of talented and skilled fighters attracts the crabs.

entries.name: Unclear Motives
entries: From outside observations, the samurai crab appears to be simply a large crab with an odd shell. However, samurai crabs are quite skilled with blades, and they constantly seek out opponents to test their combat prowess. Though they can't speak, they understand rudimentary {@language Common}, and they know the basic weapon movements and signals for initiating honorable duels with armed combatants. Whether bested or the winner, a samurai crab competing in an honorable duel never kills an opponent unless its own life is threatened.

entries.name: Carapace Blade
entries: One of the most unique and interesting aspects of the samurai crab is the presence of its iconic sword or in some cases swords. Some crabs salvage the swords from shipwrecks while others seem to be hatched with them. Samurai crabs fight to the death when creatures attempt to relieve them of their swords.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the crystallite remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a large geode.

trait.name: Final Form
entries: When a crystallite dies, its corpse transforms into crystal and becomes a Large object that can be attacked and destroyed (AC 17; hp 45; immunity to poison and psychic damage). It can no longer be affected by spells and effects that target creatures.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The crystallite makes two Crystal Limb attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Biomineralize.

action.name: Crystal Limb
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage, and the crystallite impales the target on its limb, grappling the target (escape {@dc 14}) if it is a Medium or smaller creature. When this grapple ends, the target takes 9 ({@damage 2d8}) slashing damage. The crystallite has two Crystal Limbs, each of which can grapple only one target.

action.name: Biomineralize
entries: The crystallite absorbs lifeforce from one creature {@condition grappled} by it. The target must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw, taking 14 ({@damage 4d6}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The target's hp maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken, and the crystallite regains hp equal to that amount. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hp maximum to 0.

reaction.name: Calcify
entries: When the crystallite takes 5 damage or more on a single turn, it can reduce its hp maximum by an amount equal to the damage taken and gains a +1 bonus to AC. The reduction and the bonus last until the crystallite finishes a long rest. The crystallite can't increase its AC above 20 using this reaction.

monster.name: Adult Prismatic Dragon

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the prismatic dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The prismatic dragon uses its Frightful Presence. It then makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d10 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Frightful Presence
entries: Each creature of the prismatic dragon's choice that is within 120 feet of the dragon and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the dragon's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Breath Weapon {@recharge 5}
entries: The prismatic dragon uses one of the following breath weapons:

items.name: Light Beam.
items.entry: The prismatic dragon emits a beam of white light in a 90-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw, taking 45 ({@damage 10d8}) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

items.name: Rainbow Blast.
items.entry: The prismatic dragon emits multicolored light in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw, taking 36 ({@damage 8d8}) damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The dragon splits the damage up among acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison, choosing a number of {@dice d8|d8s} for each damage type totaling {@dice 8d8}. It must choose at least two damage types.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The prismatic dragon casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 17}):

legendaryHeader: The prismatic dragon can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from
the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time
and only at the end of another creature's turn. The dragon regains
spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: The prismatic dragon makes a Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check.

legendary.name: Tail Attack
entries: The prismatic dragon makes a tail attack.

legendary.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The prismatic dragon uses Spellcasting

legendary.name: Shimmering Wings (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The prismatic dragon beats its crystalline wings. Each creature within 20 feet of the dragon must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or take 11 ({@damage 2d10}) radiant damage and become {@condition blinded} until the start of the dragon's next turn.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The warchief can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Insect Affinity
entries: Insects understand the warchief and view it favorably. The warchief can communicate simple ideas, through words and gestures, with insectoid Beasts, and the warchief has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Animal Handling}) checks made when interacting with such Beasts.

trait.name: Jungle Camouflage
entries: The warchief has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to hide in jungle terrain.

trait.name: Locked Saddle
entries: The warchief can't be knocked {@condition prone}, dismounted, or moved against its will while mounted.

trait.name: Mounted Warrior
entries: While the warchief is mounted, its mount can't be {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Slippery
entries: The warchief has advantage on saving throws and ability checks made to escape a grapple.

trait.name: Spirited Charge
entries: If the warchief moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature while mounted and then hits with a Lance attack on the same turn, the warchief can use a bonus action to command its mount to make one melee weapon attack against that creature as a reaction.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: The warchief's long jump is up to 20 feet and its high jump is up to 10 feet, with or without a running start.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The cueyatl warchief makes two Lance attacks. If the warchief is mounted, its mount can then make one melee weapon attack.

action.name: Lance
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d12 + 4}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Javelin
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage.

reaction.name: Mounted Parry
entries: The warchief adds 3 to its AC or its mount's AC against one melee attack that would hit it or its mount. To do so, the warchief must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

trait.name: Blur of Motion
entries: When the cyonaxin moves at least 30 feet on its turn, ranged attack rolls against it have disadvantage until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Chain Breaker
entries: The cyonaxin deals double damage to objects that restrain creatures.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If the cyonaxin is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the cyonaxin instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

trait.name: Freedom of Movement
entries: The cyonaxin ignores difficult terrain, and magical effects can't reduce its speed or cause it to be {@condition restrained}. It can spend 5 feet of movement to escape from nonmagical restraints or being {@condition grappled}.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The cyonaxin has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The cyonaxin has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The cyonaxin's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Pounce
entries: If the cyonaxin moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a Claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the cyonaxin can make one Bite attack against it as a bonus action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The cyonaxin makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 3d6 + 6}) piercing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) radiant damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 3d4 + 6}) slashing damage.

action.name: Frightful Yowl {@recharge 6}
entries: The cyonaxin screeches, the sound growing more intense over a few seconds. Each hostile creature within 60 feet of the cyonaxin and that can hear it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature grappling or restraining another creature has disadvantage on its saving throws. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Liberating Churr {@recharge 5}
entries: The cyonaxin issues a loud, staccato chirp. Each friendly creature within 90 feet of the cyonaxin and that can hear it gains the benefits of the cyonaxin's Freedom of Movement trait. In addition, each affected creature grows claws, which it can use to make unarmed strikes. When an affected creature hits with a claw, its claw deals slashing damage equal to {@dice 1d6} + its Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike. These benefits last until the start of the cyonaxin's next turn.

bonus.name: Free Runner
entries: The cyonaxin can take the {@action Dash} action.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The daeodon has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Relentless (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: If the daeodon takes 15 damage or less that would reduce it to 0 hp, it is reduced to 1 hp instead.

trait.name: Trampling Charge
entries: If the daeodon moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a Bite attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the daeodon can make one Slam attack against it as a bonus action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The daeodon makes one Bite attack and one Slam attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) piercing damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 13}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the daeodon can't Bite another target.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d4 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Fierce Call (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The daeodon lets out a loud, fearsome call. Each hostile creature within 60 feet of the daeodon must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or drop whatever it is holding and become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. While {@condition frightened}, a creature must take the {@action Dash} action and move away from the daeodon by the safest available route on each of its turns, unless there is nowhere to move. A {@condition frightened} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

trait.name: Flyby
entries: The dawnfly doesn't provoke {@action opportunity attack||opportunity attacks} when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The dawnfly deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Unsettling Drone
entries: A creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the dawnfly must succeed on a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition incapacitated} until the start of its next turn. {@condition Deafened} creatures have advantage on the saving throw. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to the dawnfly's Unsettling Drone for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dawnfly makes one Bite attack and three Tail attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d8 + 6}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 3d10 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Wing Slice {@recharge 4}
entries: The dawnfly flies up to 40 feet in a straight line and can move through the space of any Huge or smaller creature. The first time it enters a creature's space during this move, that creature must make a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 54 ({@damage 12d8}) slashing damage and is {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn. If the dawnfly's wings are ignited from Winged Inferno, the creature takes an extra 14 ({@damage 4d6}) fire damage. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn't {@condition stunned}.

bonus.name: Winged Inferno
entries: The dawnfly rapidly beats its wings igniting them until the start of its next turn. Its wings shed bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light an additional 20 feet. A creature that touches the dawnfly or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage. In addition, when a creature starts its turn within 5 feet of the dawnfly, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw or take 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage. This effect ends early if the dawnfly stops flying.

legendary.name: Dust Burst
entries: The dawnfly's wings shed blinding dust within 10 feet of it. Each creature in the area must succeed on a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition blinded} until the end of its next turn.

legendary.name: Fiery Downburst (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The dawnfly's wings beat furiously, releasing a downdraft of heated air in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in the area must make a {@dc 19} Strength saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 9 ({@damage 2d8}) bludgeoning damage and 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage, is pushed up to 15 feet away from the dawnfly in a direction following the cone, and is knocked {@condition prone}. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn't pushed or knocked {@condition prone}.

legendary.name: Snatch and Drop (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The dawnfly flies up to half its flying speed, making one Tail attack at a creature within its reach along the way. If the attack hits, the creature is {@condition grappled} and carried with the dawnfly, which immediately drops the creature at the end of the movement. The creature takes falling damage, as normal.

trait.name: Limited Amphibiousness
entries: The desolation nymph can breathe air and water, but it needs to be submerged at least once every 4 hours to avoid {@quickref suffocating||2}.

trait.name: Shifting Camouflage
entries: The desolation nymph's carapace adapts to its current surroundings. The nymph has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to hide in nonmagical, natural terrain.

action.name: Hinged Maw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 15 ft., one creature. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d10 + 3}) piercing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 13}) and pulled to within 5 feet of the nymph. Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the desolation nymph can't use its Hinged Maw on another target.

action.name: Swallow
entries: The desolation nymph makes one Hinged Maw attack against a Medium or smaller target it is grappling. If the attack hits, the target is also swallowed, and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the target is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the nymph, and it takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) acid damage at the start of each of the nymph's turns. The nymph can have only one creature swallowed at a time.
If the desolation nymph dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse using 5 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

bonus.name: Water Jet
entries: The desolation nymph takes the {@action Disengage} action, and each creature within 5 feet of the nymph must succeed a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw or be {@condition blinded} until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Detect Life
entries: The death worm can sense the general direction of creatures that aren't Constructs or Undead within 1 mile of it.

trait.name: Discharge
entries: When a creature ends its turn within 5 feet of a death worm, the creature takes 2 ({@damage 1d4}) lightning damage.

trait.name: Dreaming Venom
entries: The death worm's poison influences the dreams of those poisoned by it. A creature that succumbs to this poison has disadvantage on Wisdom saving throws and suffers strange dreams. Every 24 hours that elapse, it must repeat the saving throw, reducing its hp maximum by 2 ({@damage 1d4}) on a failure. The poison is neutralized on a success. The target dies if dreaming venom reduces its hp maximum to 0. This reduction lasts until the poison is neutralized.

trait.name: Lightning Arc
entries: When a creature starts its turn within 15 feet of at least two death worms, the creature must succeed on a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw or take 5 ({@damage 2d4}) lightning damage. The creature has disadvantage on the saving throw if it is within 15 feet of three or more death worms.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The death worm regains 3 hp at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hp.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage plus 2 ({@damage 1d4}) lightning damage and 4 ({@damage 1d8}) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or succumb to the worm's venom (see the Dreaming Venom trait).

action.name: Spit Poison
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 15/30 ft., one creature. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d8}) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or succumb to the worm's venom (see the Dreaming Venom trait).

trait.name: Aquatic Invisibility
entries: The balbazu is {@condition invisible} while fully immersed in water.

trait.name: Blood Reservoir
entries: The balbazu stores drained blood within itself. Each time it causes blood loss to a creature, the balbazu's Blood Reservoir increases by an amount equal to the hp of blood it drained from the creature.

trait.name: Demon Food
entries: A demon within 5 feet of the balbazu and that isn't another balbazu can use a bonus action to reduce the Blood Reservoir by up to 10, regaining hp equal to that amount as it drinks blood from the reservoir.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The balbazu has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) piercing damage, and the balbazu attaches to the target. While attached, the balbazu doesn't attack. Instead, at the start of each of the balbazu's turns, the target loses 10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) hp from blood loss. When the balbazu first attaches to the target and each time the target loses hp from blood loss, the target must succeed on a {@dc 11} Constitution saving throw or be unaware of the attack (and the balbazu if it is invisible). The target is still aware of the hp loss, but it feels no pain from the attack. On a success, the target is aware of the attack and the balbazu and doesn't need to continue making this saving throw while the balbazu remains attached to it.

The balbazu regains hp equal to half the hp of blood it drains. The balbazu can detach itself by spending 5 feet of its movement. A creature that is aware of the balbazu, including the target, can use its action to detach the balbazu.

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The inciter demon can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Aura of Distrust
entries: The inciter demon radiates a psychic aura that causes creatures to doubt the intentions of their friends. Each creature within 30 feet of the inciter that isn't a Fiend has disadvantage on Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) checks. When a creature enters the aura's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, that creature must make a {@dc 13} Charisma saving throw. On a failure, any spell cast by the creature can't affect allies or friendly creatures, including spells already in effect, such as bless, while it remains in the aura. In addition, the creature can't use the {@action Help} action or accept assistance from a friendly creature, including assistance from spells, such as bless or cure wounds, while it remains in the aura.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The inciter demon makes two Claw attacks.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Inspire Violence {@recharge 5}
entries: The inciter demon whispers to a creature within 5 feet of it that can hear it, stoking paranoia and hatred. The creature must succeed on a {@dc 13} Charisma saving throw or it uses its next action to make one attack against a creature that both the target and the inciter demon can see. A creature immune to being {@condition charmed} isn't affected by the inciter demon's Inspire Violence.

bonus.name: Invisibility
entries: The inciter demon magically turns {@condition invisible} until it attacks, or until its concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment the inciter wears or carries is {@condition invisible} with it.
A humanoid wisp of flame and smoke briefly appears and then vanishes again. It slips through the gathered assembly, sowing discord and inspiring violence with its hissing words.

Inciter demons are the embodiment of malicious mischief. They are wicked fiends whose only love is to disrupt the social ties between other creatures. Their whispers spoil trust and goodwill, and domineering mages employ them to ruin important alliances and turn former friends toward infighting and hostility.

entries.name: Flame Form
entries: An inciter demon's true form is that of a slender humanoid figure of cold flames and smoke. The only sign that an inciter is to blame for a breakdown in diplomacy is the flicker of fire that appears before they vanish, as they retreat to delight in what they have wrought.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The kogukhpak has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: The kogukhpak's long jump is up to 30 feet and its high jump is up to 15 feet, with or without a running start.

trait.name: Sunlight Hypersensitivity
entries: The kogukhpak takes 20 radiant damage when it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The kogukhpak makes one Bite attack and two Gore attacks, or it makes three Spit Fire attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 16} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 2d8 + 10}) bludgeoning damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) fire damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 18}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, the kogukhpak can automatically hit the target with its Bite, and the kogukhpak can't make Bite attacks against other targets.

action.name: Gore
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 16} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}37 ({@damage 5d10 + 10}) piercing damage.

action.name: Spit Fire
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 11} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}32 ({@damage 6d8 + 5}) fire damage.

action.name: Devastating Leap {@recharge 6}
entries: The kogukhpak leaps up to 30 feet and lands on its feet in a space it can see. Each creature in the space or within 5 feet of the kogukhpak when it lands must make a {@dc 20} Strength saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 72 ({@damage 16d8}) bludgeoning damage and is knocked {@condition prone}. On a success, a creature takes half the damage, isn't knocked {@condition prone}, and, if it is in the kogukhpak's space, can choose to be pushed 5 feet back or to the side of the kogukhpak. A creature in the kogukhpak's space that chooses not to be pushed suffers the consequences of a failed saving throw.

action.name: Fire Breath {@recharge 6}
entries: The kogukhpak exhales fire in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw, taking 70 ({@damage 20d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
Tusks jut from the jaw of this massive albino toad, and small, spiky horns rise from above its demonic eyes.

Kogukhpak demons are massive toad-like creatures with mammoth tusks and a bottomless cauldron of untamed flame deep within their bellies. They are typically found in colder climes, which helps keep the raging fires within in check. They inhabit deep caverns to avoid the sun and visit the surface only at night to hunt.

entries.name: Enemy of the Light
entries: In the cold, far north, the nights are long and winter nearly interminable. This allows the kogukhpak to hunt and kill at its leisure, rarely having to fear its only true weakness: sunlight. During the summer, when daylight rarely ceases, the fiend remains underground.

entries.name: Voracious Killer
entries: The kogukhpak is a scourge to all it encounters. The fiend will attack and devour anyone or anything it comes across while hunting, to fuel the incessant fires within it. A koguhkpak eats everything, leaving little trace except blood and signs of struggle, with occasionally ashes or burnt grasses. Remnants of a settlement destroyed by a seemingly sourceless flame are a sure sign of a kogukhpak.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The leech demon can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Blood Sense
entries: The leech demon can pinpoint, by scent, the location of creatures that aren't Constructs or Undead within 30 feet of it.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The leech demon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The leech demon makes one Bite attack and two Tentacle Bite attacks, or it makes two Bite attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 3d6 + 4}) piercing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Tentacle Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage and 4 ({@damage 1d8}) necrotic damage, and the leech demon can attach its tentacle to the target. The demon has two tentacles, each of which can attach to only one target. While a tentacle is attached, the demon can't use that tentacle to make Tentacle Bite attacks, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the demon doesn't attack with the tentacle. Instead, at the start of each of the demon's turns, each creature with a tentacle attached to it loses 11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) hp due to blood loss, and the demon gains temporary hp equal to that amount. The demon can add temporary hp gained from this attack together and can add it to temporary hp gained from Release Swarm. The demon's temporary hp can't exceed half its hp maximum.
The leech demon can detach one or both tentacles as a bonus action. A creature, including the target, can use its action to detach the demon's tentacle by succeeding on a {@dc 17} Strength check.

action.name: Release Swarm {@recharge 5}
entries: The leech demon shakes loose dozens of leeches, creating a {@creature leech swarm|ToB2} (or use a {@creature swarm of poisonous snakes}). The swarm acts as an ally of the leech demon and obeys its spoken commands. The swarm remains for 1 minute, until the leech demon dies, or until the demon dismisses it as a bonus action. If the leech demon is within 5 feet of the swarm, it can use its action to consume the swarm, gaining temporary hp equal to the swarm's current hp. It can add temporary hp gained in this way with temporary hp gained from its Tentacle Bite attack. The demon's temporary hp can't exceed half its hp maximum. The demon can have only one swarm active at one time.
Hundreds of leeches cling to and crawl around this serpentine creature, which has a toothy maw filling most of its face. It raises two tentacles, revealing similar toothy maws lining each tentacle.

Leech demons prefer to spend their time on the Material Plane, where their unsettling appearance draws more of a reaction and where they can better inflict suffering. They especially enjoy infesting their victims' bodies with leeches, which burst forth from the corpses to wreck havoc on the victims' loved ones.

entries.name: Implements of Swampland Revenge
entries: Rumors proliferate about rituals to summon leech demons to right a grievous wrong. The demons gleefully wreak vengeance on their targets and try to ensure their summoners witness the gruesome deaths. The stories fail to disclose the demons demand a price from their callers, usually paid by the life of someone dear to them. Only the most desperate benefit from calling leech demons for retribution, as they often have no problem offering themselves up as payment when the demons complete their deeds.

trait.name: Frozen Aura
entries: When a creature enters a space within 30 feet of the maha or starts its turn there, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or have its speed reduced by 10 feet until it starts its turn outside the aura.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The maha has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Snow Camouflage
entries: The maha has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) made to hide in snowy or icy terrain.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The maha makes three Claw attacks. If the maha hits one creature with two Claw attacks, the target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw or chuckle until the end of its next turn. While chuckling, a creature can't speak coherently, can't cast spells with verbal components, and has disadvantage on attack rolls with weapons that use Strength or Dexterity.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 3d6 + 4}) piercing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) cold damage.

action.name: Deadly Laughter {@recharge 5}
entries: The maha chuckles, giggles, and chortles at nearby creatures. Each creature within 30 feet of the maha must make a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 42 ({@damage 12d6}) psychic damage, drops whatever it is holding, and laughs for 1 minute. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and doesn't drop whatever it is holding or laugh. While laughing, a creature is {@condition incapacitated}, can't speak coherently, and takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) psychic damage at the start of each of its turns. A laughing creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature dies while laughing, its face turns pale blue and displays a wide grin.
This emaciated creature with long, stringy black hair, milky white eyes, and pale blue skin squats in the snow. Its face is split in an almost too-wide grin.
Mahas are demons of the cold north, reveling in the snowy wastes but never far from civilization, which holds their preferred food source: humanoids.

entries.name: Laughing Nightmares
entries: Maha demons are always seen smiling, laughing, or giggling. They spread their malevolent hilarity wherever they go by tickling their victims with their claws, all the while tearing into flesh. The victims' bodies are said to retain that same grotesque and eternal smile on their cold and rigid faces.

entries.name: Sustained by Torment
entries: The ongoing torment mahas create sustains them. A maha will try to unsettle victims long before confronting them. By manipulating the environment and creating baffling and frightening conditions, the demon seeks to slowly build a feeling of terror. A maha often ambushes single travelers or picks off stragglers, separating them from their companions and building terror on multiple fronts.

entries.name: Not so Bright
entries: According to legends, maha demons are not terribly intelligent. Stories abound of travelers escaping mahas by tricking the demons into following false footsteps in the snow, attacking cloaked snow sculptures, or ambushing an empty campsite. Such deceptions often result in the loss of equipment or a reliable pack mule, but it is preferable to contending with the maha directly

trait.name: Corpse Stride
entries: Once on its turn, the vetala can use 10 feet of its movement to step magically into one corpse or Undead within its reach and emerge from a second corpse or Undead within 60 feet of the first, appearing in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the second corpse or Undead.

trait.name: Graveyard Walker
entries: Difficult terrain composed of tombstones, grave dirt, corpses, or other objects or features common to graveyards and necropolises doesn't cost the vetala extra movement, and the vetala can move through graveyard objects and structures, such as sarcophaguses and mausoleums, as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The vetala has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Master of Undeath
entries: A Humanoid killed by the vetala or an Undead under its control rises 1 minute later as a {@creature skeleton} or {@creature zombie} (the vetala's choice), unless the Humanoid is restored to life or its body is destroyed. The vetala can have no more than 20 total {@creature skeleton||skeletons} and {@creature zombie||zombies} under its control at one time.

trait.name: Shepherd of Death
entries: When an Undead under the vetala's control hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 4 ({@damage 1d8}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The vetala makes two Claw attacks.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) slashing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Raise Corpse
entries: One Humanoid corpse the vetala can see within 30 feet of it rises as a {@creature skeleton} or {@creature zombie} (the vetala's choice) under the vetala's control.

bonus.name: Command Corpse
entries: The vetala commands one Undead under its control that it can see to make one weapon attack as a reaction. If it does so, the Undead has advantage on the attack roll.

reaction.name: Corpse Detonation
entries: When an Undead under the vetala'a control is reduced to 0 hp, the vetala can force it to explode. Each creature that isn't an Undead or the vetala within 5 feet of the exploding Undead must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 10 ({@damage 3d6}) bludgeoning (if zombie) or slashing (if skeleton) damage and 5 ({@damage 2d4}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
This shadowy figure has eyes like two cinders and loose, flowing hair that seems buffeted by a gentle breeze. Its chest cavity burns with hellish light, and its hands end in wicked claws.

Vetala lurk in graveyards and battlefields, where they claim corpses to serve as minions. Capricious and vain, vetala demons occasionally make bargains to protect nearby villages, requiring villagers to provide regular sacrificial goods, while the demon keeps the corpses of any killed. These bargains state the vetala may claim the residents if the village fails to meet its obligations.

entries.name: Celebrators of the Necropolis
entries: Vetala are strangely vain about their occupied graveyards, wanting the graveyards to be decorated with strings of flowers, treats, and votive offerings. They never claim these objects themselves, but they viciously attack anyone attempting to steal the items. This vanity extends to the demon's minions, which stop decaying while controlled and eventually appear less decayed.

trait.name: Insanity
entries: The abysswalker has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Poisonous Vapors
entries: When a creature enters a space within 5 feet of the abysswalker or starts its turn there, that creature must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the creature takes 13 ({@damage 2d12}) poison damage and is {@condition poisoned} until the start of its next turn. On a success, the creature takes half the damage and isn't {@condition poisoned}.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the abysswalker has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The abysswalker makes one Bite attack, one Claw attack, and one Scimitar attack, or it makes one Bite attack and two Scimitar attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) piercing and 5 ({@damage 2d4}) poison damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) bludgeoning, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}) if it is a Medium or smaller creature. Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the abysswalker can't make Claw attacks against other targets.

action.name: Scimitar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks not made with silvered weapons

trait.name: Insanity
entries: The hellforged has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Hellfire Weapons
entries: The hellforged's weapon attacks are magical. When the hellforged hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@damage 2d6} fire damage (included in the attack).

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the hellforged has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The hellforged makes three Battleaxe or Hurl Hellfire attacks.

action.name: Battleaxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage, or 8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) slashing damage if used with two hands, plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Hurl Hellfire
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 5} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 3d6 + 2}) fire damage. If the target is a creature or a flammable object, it ignites. Until a creature takes an action to douse the fire, the target takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

reaction.name: Voice of Authority {@recharge 5}
entries: When a creature hits the hellforged with an attack, the hellforged shrieks a one-word command. The attacker must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or carry out this command on its next turn. This reaction works like the {@spell command} spell, except the attacker doesn't have to understand the hellforged's language.
