In addition, the hippopotamus can sense when such a creature moves within 100 feet of the site and can sense the general direction of such creatures within 1 mile of the site.

action.name: Gore
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}23 ({@damage 4d8 + 5}) piercing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) necrotic damage or radiant damage (the hippopotamus's choice).

action.name: Divine Cacophony {@recharge 5}
entries: The sacred hippopotamus opens its jaws and releases a cacophony of otherworldly screams, songs, and roars from the Upper or Lower Planes in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) necrotic damage or radiant damage (the sacred hippopotamus's choice) and is {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn't {@condition stunned}.

action.name: Healing Rumble (2/Day)
entries: The sacred hippopotamus touches another creature with its snout as it hums a tone that reverberates through its jaw. The target magically regains 10 ({@damage 3d6}) hp and is freed from any disease, poison, blindness, or deafness.

bonus.name: Protector's Step
entries: The sacred hippopotamus magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space within its sacred site or within 30 feet of the exterior of its sacred site. Swirls of golden light or tendrils of inky shadow (the hippopotamus's choice) appear at the origin and destination when it uses this bonus action.

trait.name: Infernal Runes
entries: The Black Sun ogre's tattoos give it a +2 bonus to its AC (included above). In addition, the ogre has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Unholy Blade
entries: Infused with unholy power, the ogre's weapon attacks are magical. When the ogre hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@damage 2d6} necrotic damage (included in the attack).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Black Sun ogre makes two Greatsword attacks.

action.name: Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 4d6 + 5}) slashing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Dark Word
entries: The ogre speaks an infernal word of unmaking at up to two creatures it can see within 120 feet of it. Each target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or take 22 ({@damage 5d8}) necrotic damage.

reaction.name: Gauntleted Backhand
entries: When a creature within 5 feet of the Black Sun ogre misses the ogre with a melee attack, the attacker must succeed on a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.
A pale, scarred ogre lumbers forward, half its body covered in armor, the other half covered in tattooed glyphs and arcane symbols.

Hulking armored killers fueled by infernal magic and cold brutality, Black Sun ogres serve as enforcers, guardians, and a nearly unstoppable assault force for those they serve. Dark priests and priestesses of the Black Sun seek out the most ruthless ogres among their followers and empower them with tattooed glyphs to enhance their tremendous strength and fortitude. Unlike many ogres, those sought for initiation into the ranks of the Knights of the Black Sun can control their ferocity and rage, holding it back until it is needed most.

entries.name: Infernally Empowered
entries: Once selected to join the Knights of the Black Sun, these ogres undergo a series of torturous and unholy rituals, their skin marked to channel infernal energy into their bodies. This new power gives Black Sun ogres greater protection and fuels their already brutal attacks into something otherworldly. When caught at a distance, Black Sun ogres can call upon these infernal brandings to shred their opponents with dark energy from afar. Up close, the unholy blades of the Knights of the Black Sun writhe with malevolent magic.

entries.name: Knights of the Black Sun
entries: Black Sun ogres serve their lieges in many ways. The knights often serve as guardians for powerful priests or priestesses. Often Black Sun knights are sent on quests in pairs, an elder and a newly-branded squire, to recover lost artifacts, find scribes useful to the Black Sun's research, eliminate heretical and chosen enemies, or seek lost ruins discovered in prophecies. In war, Black Sun knights serve as a nearly unstoppable vanguard of an army, attacking in groups of ten or twenty during sieges or frontal assaults. Few armies have seen the coming of the Knights of the Black Sun and survived the experience.

monster.name: Hirudine Stalker
languages: telepathy 120 ft. (only with other hirudine stalkers)

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The hirudine stalker can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Blood Scent
entries: The hirudine stalker has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) and Wisdom ({@skill Survival}) checks to find or track a creature that doesn't have all its hp.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The hirudine stalker makes two Bite or Spit Tooth attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) piercing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) necrotic damage, and the hirudine stalker regains hp equal to the necrotic damage dealt.

action.name: Spit Tooth
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or suffer one of the following effects (the hirudine stalker's choice): Anesthetic. On a failed save, the target is unaware of any damage it takes from the hirudine stalker's Spit Tooth attack for 1 hour, but it is still aware of other sources of damage.

action.name: Debilitating
entries: On a failed save, the target is {@condition incapacitated} until the end of its next turn. If the target fails the saving throw by 5 or more, it also suffers one level of {@condition exhaustion}. A creature can't suffer more than three levels of {@condition exhaustion} from this attack.

action.name: Magebane
entries: On a failed save, the target has disadvantage on Constitution saving throws to maintain its concentration for 1 hour. If the target fails the saving throw by 5 or more, it also loses its lowest-level available spell slot.

bonus.name: Hidden Predator
entries: The hirudine stalker takes the {@action Hide} action.

monster.name: Howler of the Hill
languages: and Void Speech but can't speak

trait.name: Hungry Void Traveler
entries: The howler of the hill doesn't require air, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Inscrutable
entries: The howler is immune to any effect that would sense its emotions or read its thoughts, as well as any divination spell that it refuses. Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) checks made to ascertain the howler's intentions or sincerity have disadvantage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The howler of the hill uses Gloaming Howl. It then makes three Claw or Psychic Bolt attacks.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) slashing damage plus 13 ({@damage 3d8}) psychic damage.

action.name: Psychic Bolt
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 9} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}26 ({@damage 5d8 + 4}) psychic damage.

action.name: Gloaming Howl
entries: The howler emits a magical howl that changes in melody and frequency, depending on the light surrounding the howler. Each creature of the howler's choice that is within 120 feet of it and can hear the howl must succeed on a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw or succumb to the effects of one of the following howls. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the howl's effect ends for it, the creature is immune to that particular howl for the next 24 hours.

items.name: Bright Howl.
items.entry: When the howler is in bright light, each target that fails the saving throw is {@condition incapacitated} until the end of its next turn.

items.name: Dim Howl.
items.entry: When the howler is in dim light, each target that fails the saving throw is {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn.

items.name: Dark Howl.
items.entry: When the howler is in darkness, each target that fails the saving throw drops whatever it is holding and is {@condition paralyzed} with fear for 1 minute. A {@condition paralyzed} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Otherworldly Hunter
entries: The howler can transport itself to a different plane of existence. This works like the {@spell plane shift} spell, except the howler can affect only itself and can't use this action to banish an unwilling creature to another plane.

trait.name: Echolocation (Whale Form Only)
entries: The hvalfiskr can't use its {@sense blindsight} while {@condition deafened}.

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: The hvalfiskr can hold its breath for 1 hour.

trait.name: Speak with Cetaceans
entries: The hvalfiskr can communicate with dolphins, porpoises, and whales as if they shared a language.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The hvalfiskr makes four Bite or Slam attacks, or it makes three Chained Anchor attacks.

action.name: Bite (Whale Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}23 ({@damage 5d6 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Chained Anchor (Giant or Hybrid Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 15 ft. or range 30/60 ft., one target. {@h}28 ({@damage 5d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage, and the anchor hooks around the target. While hooked by the anchor, the target and the hvalfiskr can't move further than 60 feet from each other. A creature, including the target, can take its action to detach the anchor by succeeding on a {@dc 19} Strength check. Alternatively, the anchor's chain can be attacked and destroyed (AC 18; hp 50; vulnerability to thunder damage; immunity to piercing, poison, and psychic damage), dislodging the anchor into an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the target and preventing the hvalfiskr from using Reel Anchor.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}24 ({@damage 4d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Whale Song {@recharge 5}
entries: The hvalfiskr sings a magical melody. Each hostile creature within 60 feet of the hvalfiskr that can hear the song must make a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 45 ({@damage 10d8}) psychic damage and is {@condition charmed} for 1 minute. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn't {@condition charmed}. A {@condition charmed} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature fails the saving throw by 5 or more, it also suffers {@table short-term madness}.

bonus.name: Change Shape
entries: The hvalfiskr transforms into a Huge frost giant, a Huge whale, or back into its true form, which is a whale-giant hybrid. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying transforms with it. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

bonus.name: Reel Anchor
entries: The hvalfiskr pulls on the chain connected to its anchor, returning the anchor to its empty hand. If the anchor is hooked around a creature, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 19} Strength saving throw or be pulled up to 30 feet toward the hvalfiskr.

trait.name: Fiery Blood
entries: When the ibexian takes damage, each creature within 5 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or take 3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage. The fire ignites flammable objects within 5 feet of the ibexian that aren't being worn or carried.

trait.name: Fiery Charge
entries: If the ibexian moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a Ram attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 10 feet away and knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: An ibexian has advantage on attack rolls if at least one of the ibexian's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The ibexian makes one Ram attack and one Hooves attack, or it makes two Spit Fire attacks.

action.name: Ram
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Hooves
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d4 + 4}) bludgeoning damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Spit Fire
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 5} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 4d6 + 2}) fire damage.

action.name: Pyroclasm (1/Day)
entries: The ibexian moves up to 30 feet in a straight line toward a creature and can move through the space of any Medium or smaller creature, stopping when it moves within 5 feet of the target. Each friendly ibexian within 50 feet of the ibexian can use its reaction to also move up to its speed in a straight line toward the target, stopping when it moves within 5 feet of the target. This movement doesn't provoke opportunity attacks.

The target and each creature within 20 feet of it must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 14 ({@damage 4d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. For each ibexian in the Pyroclasm after the first, the fire damage increases by 3 ({@damage 1d6}), to a maximum of 28 ({@dice 8d6}).

trait.name: Fear of Fire
entries: An ice urchin is inherently fearful of fire. If presented forcefully with fire, or if it is dealt fire damage, the ice urchin must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} until the end of its next turn. Once it has been {@condition frightened} by a specific source of fire (such as a torch), the ice urchin can't be {@condition frightened} by that same source again for 24 hours.

trait.name: Ice Slide
entries: The ice urchin's speed increases to 60 feet when it moves on snow or ice. Additionally, difficult terrain composed of ice or snow doesn't cost it extra movement.

trait.name: Melting Away
entries: If the ice urchin takes fire damage, its AC is reduced by 2, and it has disadvantage on attack rolls until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Spiny Defense
entries: A creature that touches the ice urchin or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) piercing and 2 ({@damage 1d4}) cold damage.

trait.name: Venomous Spine Regrowth
entries: An ice urchin has twelve venomous spines. Used spines regrow when the ice urchin finishes a long rest.

action.name: Ice Spine
entries: {@atk mw} +4, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) piercing damage plus 2 ({@damage 1d4}) cold damage

action.name: Venomous Spine
entries: {@atk rw} +3, range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) piercing plus 2 ({@damage 1d4}) cold damage and 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the ice willow remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ice-covered willow tree.

trait.name: Ice Melt
entries: If the ice willow takes fire damage, its icicles partially melt. Until the end of the ice willow's next turn, creatures have advantage on saving throws against the willow's Icicle Drop and Icicle Spray.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The ice willow makes two Slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) bludgeoning plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) cold damage.

action.name: Icicle Drop {@recharge 4}
entries: The ice willow shakes several spear-like icicles loose. Each creature within 10 feet of the willow must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 9 ({@damage 2d8}) piercing damage and 7 ({@damage 2d6}) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Icicle Spray {@recharge 6}
entries: The ice willow flings icicles in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 18 ({@damage 4d8}) piercing damage and 14 ({@damage 4d6}) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

reaction.name: Melting Icicles
entries: When the ice willow takes fire damage, it can immediately use Icicle Drop, if available.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The iceworm can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Cold Physiology
entries: The iceworm can't abide constant warmth. Each hour it spends in an area with a temperature above 40 degrees Fahrenheit, the ice worm must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or suffer one level of {@condition exhaustion} that can't be removed until it finishes a long rest in an area with a temperature below 40 degrees.

trait.name: Heat Sensitivity
entries: The iceworm has disadvantage on attack rolls when within 5 feet of a strong source of heat that isn't a warm‑blooded creature's natural warmth, such as a torch or campfire. In addition, the iceworm can pinpoint the location of warm-blooded creatures within 90 feet of it and can sense the general direction of such creatures within 1 mile of it.

trait.name: Slippery
entries: The iceworm has advantage on saving throws and ability checks made to escape a grapple.

action.name: Icy Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) cold damage.

action.name: Icy Spit
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one creature. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) cold damage, and the target is coated in freezing, viscous slime. While coated in the freezing slime, a creature's speed is reduced by 10 feet, and it has disadvantage on the first attack roll it makes on each of its turns. A creature, including the target, can take its action to clean off the slime, ending the effect.

trait.name: Essential Oiliness
entries: The imperator has advantage on saving throws and ability checks made to escape a grapple or end the {@condition restrained} condition.

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: The imperator can hold its breath for 1 hour.

trait.name: Penguin Telepathy
entries: The imperator can magically command any penguin within 120 feet of it, using a limited telepathy.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The imperator deals double damage to objects and structures.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The imperator makes one Beak attack and two Wing Slap attacks.

action.name: Beak
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}24 ({@damage 3d12 + 5}) piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw or be swallowed by the imperator. A swallowed creature is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the imperator, and it takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) acid damage at the start of each of the imperator's turns.

If the imperator takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the imperator must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of the imperator. If the imperator dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse by using 15 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

action.name: Wing Slap
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d10 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Pelagic Bile {@recharge 6}
entries: The imperator regurgitates its stomach contents in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 17 ({@damage 5d6}) acid damage and 17 ({@damage 5d6}) poison damage and is {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn't {@condition poisoned}. A {@condition poisoned} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. Swallowed creatures are then regurgitated, falling {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of the imperator.

action.name: Toboggan Charge {@recharge 5}
entries: The imperator moves up to 30 feet in a straight line over ice or snow and can move through the space of any Large or smaller creature. The first time it enters a creature's space during this move, that creature must make a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 36 ({@damage 8d8}) bludgeoning damage and is knocked {@condition prone}. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn't knocked {@condition prone}.

reaction.name: Muster the Legions (1/Day)
entries: When the imperator is reduced to half its hp or lower, it magically calls {@dice 1d4} swarms of penguins. The penguins arrive on initiative count 20 of the next round, acting as allies of the vampire and obeying its telepathic commands. The penguins remain for 1 hour, until the imperator dies, or until the imperator dismisses them as a bonus action.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice-versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Medium penguin. The swarm can't regain hp or gain temporary hp.

trait.name: Tobogganing Tide
entries: The swarm can move at double its walking speed over ice and snow.

action.name: Beaks
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 0 ft., one creature in the swarm's space. {@h}21 ({@damage 6d6}) piercing damage, or 10 ({@damage 3d6}) if the swarm has half its hp or fewer.

action.name: Toboggan Charge {@recharge 5}
entries: The swarm moves up to 20 feet in a straight line over ice or snow and can move through the space of any Large or smaller creature. The first time it enters a creature's space during this move, that creature must make a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) bludgeoning damage and 10 ({@damage 3d6}) piercing damage and is knocked {@condition prone}. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn't knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Aqueous Form
entries: The incandescent one can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. It can move through a space as narrow as 1 foot wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The incandescent one can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Flyby
entries: The incandescent one doesn't provoke {@action opportunity attack||opportunity attacks} when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

trait.name: Immortal Nature
entries: The incandescent one doesn't require food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Luminous
entries: The incandescent one sheds dim light in a 5-foot radius.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The incandescent one has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The incandescent one's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The incandescent one makes two Slam attacks or three Astral Bolt attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage plus 18 ({@damage 4d8}) cold damage.

action.name: Astral Bolt.
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 8} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 4d6 + 4}) radiant damage, and the next attack roll made against the target before the end of the incandescent one's next turn has advantage.

bonus.name: Celestial Inspiration
entries: The incandescent one inspires one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. Whenever the target makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the start of the incandescent one's next turn, the target can roll a {@dice d4} and add the number rolled to the attack roll or saving throw.

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The ion slime can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Ionic Form
entries: Whenever the ion slime is subjected to lightning damage, it takes no damage and instead regains hp equal to the lightning damage dealt. The slime's Supercharge action then recharges. If the ooze takes cold damage while supercharged, it must roll a {@dice d6}. On a 1 or 2, it loses the supercharged state.

trait.name: Ooze Nature
entries: The ion slime doesn't require sleep.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The ion slime can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The ion slime makes two Pseudopod attacks.

action.name: Pseudopod
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) bludgeoning plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) lightning damage.

action.name: Discharge (Supercharged Only)
entries: The ion slime sends a shock of lightning through its supercharged pseudopod at one creature it can see within 5 feet of it, ending the supercharged state. The target must make {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw, taking 27 ({@damage 6d8}) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Three bolts of lightning then leap to as many as three targets, each of which must be within 20 feet of the first target. A target can be a creature or an object and each can be targeted by only one of the bolts. Each target must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw, taking 13 ({@damage 3d8}) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

bonus.name: Charged Motion (Supercharged Only)
entries: The ion slime takes the {@action Dash} or {@action Dodge} action.

bonus.name: Supercharge {@recharge 5}
entries: The ion slime gathers ambient electricity to supercharge itself for 3 rounds. While supercharged, the ion slime gains a +2 bonus to its AC, and it gains an additional action on each of its turns. At the end of the third round, if the slime hasn't used the Discharge action, it suffers feedback, taking 18 ({@damage 4d8}) force damage. Its supercharged state then ends.

trait.name: Elemental Weapons
entries: The jinnborn's weapon attacks are imbued with its elemental power. When the jinnborn hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@damage 1d6} lightning damage (included in the attack).

trait.name: Flamboyant Defense
entries: While the jinnborn pirate is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Charisma modifier.

trait.name: Knows the Ropes
entries: The jinnborn pirate has proficiency with airships, sandships, or waterborne ships (the jinnborn's choice). It adds its proficiency bonus to any check it makes to control the chosen type of ship, and it adds its proficiency bonus to any saving throws made while on the chosen type of vehicle.

action.name: Rapier
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) lightning damage.

action.name: Shortbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, ranged 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) lightning damage.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The jinnborn pirate adds 2 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the jinnborn must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

trait.name: Elemental Weapons
entries: The jinnborn's weapon attacks are imbued with its elemental power. When the jinnborn hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@damage 1d6} acid damage (included in the attack).

trait.name: Flamboyant Defense
entries: While the jinnborn pirate is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Charisma modifier.

trait.name: Knows the Ropes
entries: The jinnborn pirate has proficiency with airships, sandships, or waterborne ships (the jinnborn's choice). It adds its proficiency bonus to any check it makes to control the chosen type of ship, and it adds its proficiency bonus to any saving throws made while on the chosen type of vehicle.

action.name: Rapier
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) acid damage.

action.name: Shortbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, ranged 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) acid damage.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The jinnborn pirate adds 2 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the jinnborn must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

trait.name: Elemental Weapons
entries: The jinnborn's weapon attacks are imbued with its elemental power. When the jinnborn hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@damage 1d6} fire damage (included in the attack).

trait.name: Flamboyant Defense
entries: While the jinnborn pirate is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Charisma modifier.

trait.name: Knows the Ropes
entries: The jinnborn pirate has proficiency with airships, sandships, or waterborne ships (the jinnborn's choice). It adds its proficiency bonus to any check it makes to control the chosen type of ship, and it adds its proficiency bonus to any saving throws made while on the chosen type of vehicle.

action.name: Rapier
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Shortbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, ranged 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The jinnborn pirate adds 2 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the jinnborn must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

trait.name: Elemental Weapons
entries: The jinnborn's weapon attacks are imbued with its elemental power. When the jinnborn hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@damage 1d6} cold damage (included in the attack).

trait.name: Flamboyant Defense
entries: While the jinnborn pirate is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Charisma modifier.

trait.name: Knows the Ropes
entries: The jinnborn pirate has proficiency with airships, sandships, or waterborne ships (the jinnborn's choice). It adds its proficiency bonus to any check it makes to control the chosen type of ship, and it adds its proficiency bonus to any saving throws made while on the chosen type of vehicle.

action.name: Rapier
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) cold damage.

action.name: Shortbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, ranged 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) cold damage.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The jinnborn pirate adds 2 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the jinnborn must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

trait.name: Shrill Screech
entries: When agitated, the jubjub bird makes a nearconstant shrill and high scream, giving it advantage on Charisma ({@skill Intimidation}) checks.

trait.name: Stubborn
entries: The jubjub bird has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}. In addition, Wisdom ({@skill Animal Handling}) checks are made with disadvantage against the jubjub bird.

trait.name: Unpredictable
entries: {@action opportunity attack||Opportunity attacks} against the jubjub bird are made with disadvantage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The jubjub bird makes two Bite attacks, or it makes one Bite attack and one Constrict attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Constrict
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d10 + 3}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 13}). Until this grapple ends, the creature is {@condition restrained}, and the jubjub bird can't constrict another target.

reaction.name: Impassioned Riposte
entries: When a creature the jubjub bird can see misses it with an attack while within 10 feet of it, the jubjub bird can make one Bite attack against the attacker.

trait.name: Aura of Honesty
entries: A creature that enters a space within 10 feet of the juniper sheriff for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there must succeed on a {@dc 13} Charisma saving throw or be unable to speak a deliberate lie until it starts its turn more than 10 feet away from the sheriff. Creatures affected by this trait are aware of it, and the juniper sheriff knows whether a creature in the area succeeded or failed on its saving throw.

trait.name: Sheriff's Duty
entries: The juniper sheriff knows if it hears a lie and can't speak a deliberate lie.

trait.name: Unfailing Memory
entries: The juniper sheriff remembers every creature that has ever spoken to it. If a creature has spoken to the sheriff and speaks to the sheriff again while polymorphed or disguised, the sheriff has advantage on Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}), Wisdom ({@skill Insight}), and Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks to identify or recognize that creature.

action.name: Saber
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Bitter Truth
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 5} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) psychic damage, and the target has disadvantage on the next saving throw it makes against the juniper sheriff's Aura of Honesty within the next 1 minute.

bonus.name: Hop Away
entries: The juniper sheriff takes the {@action Dash} or {@action Disengage} action.

trait.name: Impaling Charge
entries: If the karkadann moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a Horn attack on the same turn, the karkadann impales the target on its horn, grappling the target if it is a Large or smaller creature (escape {@dc 15}). Until the grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, takes 18 ({@damage 4d8}) piercing damage at the start of each of its turns, and the karkadann can't make horn attacks against other targets.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The karkadann has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The karkadann makes two Hooves attacks or one Horn attack and one Hooves attack.

action.name: Hooves
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Horn
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}24 ({@damage 4d8 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Toss
entries: One Large or smaller creature impaled by the karkadann is thrown up to 30 feet in a random direction and knocked {@condition prone}. If a thrown target strikes a solid surface, the target takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet it was thrown. If the target is thrown at another creature, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or take the same damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Healing Touch (3/Day)
entries: The karkadann touches another creature with its horn. The target magically regains 22 ({@damage 4d8 + 2}) hp and is cured of all diseases and poisons afflicting it.

trait.name: Elemental Nature
entries: The khamaseen doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Stinging Dust
entries: The khamaseen is surrounded by a cloud of swirling dust and small stones. A creature that starts its turn within 5 feet of the khamaseen must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or have disadvantage on attack rolls until the start of its next turn. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to the khamaseen's Stinging Dust for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage plus 5 ({@damage 2d4}) lightning damage.

action.name: Choking Cloud {@recharge 6}
entries: The khamaseen surrounds itself with a large cloud of dust and debris. Each creature within 10 feet of the khamaseen must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition incapacitated} for 1 minute. While {@condition incapacitated}, the creature is unable to breathe and coughs uncontrollably. An {@condition incapacitated} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

reaction.name: Shock
entries: If a creature wearing metal armor or wielding a metal weapon or shield moves within 5 feet of the khamaseen, it must succeed on a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw or take 5 ({@damage 2d4}) lightning damage.

monster.name: Khargi
languages: understands Abyssal and Infernal but can't speak

trait.name: Deadly Infestation
entries: A creature that touches the khargi or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage as stinging insects rise up to protect the khargi.

trait.name: Death Swarms
entries: When the khargi dies, the insects crawling across and within it burst from its body, forming {@dice 2d4} swarms of insects that appear in unoccupied spaces within 5 feet of the khargi's space.

trait.name: Infested Weapons
entries: The khargi's weapon attacks are magical. When the khargi hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@damage 2d6} poison damage (included in the attack).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The khargi makes one Bite attack and two Leg attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Legs
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d4 + 5}) bludgeoning damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Swarming Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The khargi exhales biting, stinging insects in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw, taking 31 ({@damage 9d6}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

reaction.name: Adaptive Carapace
entries: When the khargi takes acid, cold, force, lightning, or thunder damage, it can magically attune itself to that type of damage. Until the end of its next turn, the khargi has resistance to damage of the triggering type, and when it hits with any weapon, the target takes an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) damage of the triggering type.

trait.name: Drake Mount
entries: The drake rider has formed a bond with a Medium or larger drake mount (found in this or other books or use the statistics of a giant lizard). Regardless of the drake's intelligence, it acts as a controlled mount while carrying a drake rider, obeying the rider's spoken commands. Mounting and dismounting the drake costs the drake rider only 5 feet of movement.

trait.name: Mounted Warrior
entries: While the drake rider is mounted, its mount can't be {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the drake rider has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Sure Seat
entries: While mounted and not incapacitated, the drake rider can't be knocked {@condition prone}, dismounted, or moved against its will.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The drake rider makes three Spear attacks. If the rider is mounted, its mount can then make one Bite, Claw, Slam, or Tail attack.

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage, or 7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

action.name: Trained Tactics {@recharge 4}
entries: The drake rider commands its mount to move up to 30 feet in a straight line, moving through the space of any Large or smaller creature and performing one of the following tactical maneuvers. This movement doesn't provoke {@action opportunity attack||opportunity attacks}.

action.name: Barrel Roll
entries: The mount flies up and over one creature in the line, ending its movement at least 10 feet past the target. As the drake rider hangs upside down at the top of the loop, it makes one Spear attack against the target with advantage. On a hit, the rider rolls damage dice three times. The mount must have a flying speed to use this maneuver.

action.name: Corkscrew Roll
entries: The mount swims in a corkscrew around the creatures in the line. Each creature in the line must succeed on a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw or be {@condition incapacitated} with dizziness until the end of its next turn. The mount must have a swimming speed to use this maneuver.

action.name: Weaving Rush
entries: The mount weaves back and forth along the line. Each creature in the line must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or take 10 ({@damage 3d6}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.

reaction.name: Failsafe Equipment
entries: The drake rider wears wing-like arm and feet flaps folded on its back. If its mount dies or it is dismounted, the rider descends 60 feet per round and takes no damage from falling, if its mount was flying, or it gains a swimming speed of 30 feet for 1 minute, if its mount was swimming.
The kobold sits astride a drake, taking a brief respite. Words pass between them, and they laugh, their wings and scales shining.
Kobold drake riders specialize in training and riding drakes—whether through the skies, the seas, or the trees. Their skills are especially valued as scouts in times of war.

entries.name: Bonded Companions
entries: The bond of trust needed between a drake and rider to work effectively together takes time and effort to forge. Since there are so many types of drakes, these kobolds specialize, focusing their training on just a few types of drakes, either taken from tradition or from proximity. Drakes and their riders often meld their families together, creating successive generations of drakes and their riders.

trait.name: Aura of Draconic Virtue
entries: Kobolds within 30 feet of an empyrean kobold have advantage on attack rolls and ability checks. At the start of each of its turns, the empyrean kobold can choose to exclude any number of kobolds from this aura (no action required).

trait.name: Elemental Weapons
entries: The empyrean kobold's weapon attacks are magical. When the kobold hits with any weapon, the weapon deal an extra {@dice 3d8} acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison damage (included in the attack), the kobold's choice.

trait.name: Immortal Nature
entries: The empyrean kobold doesn't require food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The empyrean kobold has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The empyrean kobold makes three Claw attacks. It can replace one Claw attack with a use of Divine Command.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) slashing plus 13 ({@damage 3d8}) acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison damage (the kobold's choice).

action.name: Invoke the Dragon Gods {@recharge 5}
entries: The empyrean kobold channels the might of the dragon gods and exhales elemental energy in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in the area must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw, taking 49 ({@damage 14d6}) acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison damage (the kobold's choice) on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Divine Command
entries: The empyrean kobold chooses a creature it can see within its Aura of Draconic Virtue and directs a kobold within the aura to attack the target. The kobold can make one weapon attack against the target as a reaction.

action.name: Invisibility
entries: The empyrean kobold magically turns {@condition invisible} until it attacks or until its concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment the empyrean kobold wears or carries is {@condition invisible} with it.

reaction.name: Draconic Ascension
entries: When a kobold it can see is reduced to 0 hp, the empyrean kobold can reincarnate the kobold as a wyrmling dragon of a type befitting that kobold and its virtues. The empyrean kobold can provide ascension to up to two kobolds each hour with this reaction.
This angelic kobold shimmers as its iridescent scales shift through the full color spectrum. It floats above the battlefield on ethereal, prismatic wings.

Kobold are known for fearlessly throwing themselves into battle against any foe large or small; however, few know the underlying source of their reckless approach to combat and life in general. The truth lies in kobold's desire to impress an empyrean kobold.

entries.name: Servants of the Dragon Gods
entries: Empyrean kobolds often work with, or operate on behalf of, {@creature zirnitran|ToB3|zirnitran angels}, though they operate independently until actively called upon by the angels. Similar to the {@creature zirnitran|ToB3|zirnitran angel's} observation of dragons, empyrean kobolds secretly watch the activities of kobolds, rarely choosing to reveal themselves. When an observed kobold dies while performing any action that embodies a true dragon spirit, an empyrean kobold carries out its sacred charge and reincarnates the heroic kobold as a dragon. The dragon type always matches the spirit the kobold lived and died to embody.

trait.name: Arcane Weapons
entries: The cunning artisan's weapon attacks are magical. When the ogre hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@damage 1d8} force damage (included in the attack).

trait.name: Artisan's Prowess
entries: If a magic item requires an action to activate, the cunning artisan can activate it as a bonus action instead.

trait.name: Sense Magic
entries: The cunning artisan senses magic within 120 feet of it at will. This trait otherwise works like the {@spell detect magic} spell but isn't itself magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The cunning artisan makes two Battleaxe attacks or three Arcane Bolt attacks.

action.name: Battleaxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) slashing damage, or 15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) slashing damage if used with two hands, plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) force damage.

action.name: Arcane Bolt
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 6} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) force damage.

action.name: Curse Item {@recharge 5}
entries: The cunning artisan curses one magic item it can see within 60 feet of it. If the item is being worn or carried by a creature, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 15} Charisma saving throw to avoid the curse. For 1 minute, the cursed item suffers one of the curses described in the Artisan Curses sidebar, as appropriate for its item type.

footer.name: Artisan Curses
entries: The cunning artisan can curse any item it creates, placing a dormant curse, a deactivation command word, or an active curse. Choose a curse that best fits the item and the story you want to tell, or use the curses listed here based on the item's type.

rows: The wearer becomes vulnerable to one of the following damage types: bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing.
Each round the item is in use in combat or other dangerous circumstance, it has a {@chance 25} chance of losing all magical properties for {@dice 1d4} rounds.
If a target succeeds on a saving throw against the item's effect, the effect rebounds on the item's wielder. If there is no saving throw, the effect has a {@chance 25} chance to rebound.
The weapon's bonus to hit, if any, becomes a penalty.

entries: This creature has the brutish build of a common {@creature ogre}, but its clothing and weapons are well-made and maintained. Beneath a heavy brow, small eyes gleam with intelligence.

Cunning artisan ogres exhibit a keen intellect and magical aptitude. They create magic items, weaving subtle curses into their creations. They can sense the auras of enchanted items and can warp those auras to cause malfunctions and misfires.

entries.name: Magic For a Price
entries: The cunning artisan creates magic items for its own personal use as well as trade. Due to its selfish and suspicious nature, these items are often cursed from the start. Likewise, any item the ogre trades or gives to another likely has a dormant curse or a command word it can use to deactivate the item, in case relations sour.

entries.name: Artisan Curses
entries: The cunning artisan can curse any item it creates, placing a dormant curse, a deactivation command word, or an active curse. Choose a curse that best fits the item and the story you want to tell, or use the curses listed here based on the item's type.

rows: The wearer becomes vulnerable to one of the following damage types: bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing.
Each round the item is in use in combat or other dangerous circumstance, it has a {@chance 25} chance of losing all magical properties for {@dice 1d4} rounds.
If a target succeeds on a saving throw against the item's effect, the effect rebounds on the item's wielder. If there is no saving throw, the effect has a {@chance 25} chance to rebound.
The weapon's bonus to hit, if any, becomes a penalty.

trait.name: Blessed Weapons
entries: The ghost hunter's weapon attacks are magical. When the hunter hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@damage 3d8} radiant damage (included in the attack).

trait.name: Ethereal Sight
entries: The ghost hunter can see 60 feet into the Ethereal Plane when it is on the Material Plane, and vice versa.

trait.name: Hidden Hunter
entries: While the ghost hunter remains motionless, it is {@condition invisible} to Undead.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The ghost hunter has advantage on attack rolls against a target if at least one of the hunter's allies is within 5 feet of the target and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the ghost hunter has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Undead Hunter
entries: The ghost hunter has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) and Wisdom ({@skill Survival}) checks to find and track Undead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The ghost hunter makes three Shortsword or Hand Crossbow attacks. It can replace one attack with a Flame Jet attack.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d6 + 6}) piercing damage plus 13 ({@damage 9d8}) radiant damage.

action.name: Hand Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 10} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d6 + 6}) piercing damage plus 13 ({@damage 3d8}) radiant damage.

action.name: Flame Jet
entries: {@atk ms,rs} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 4d6 + 4}) fire damage. If the target is a creature or a flammable object that isn't being worn or carried, it ignites. Until a creature takes an action to douse the fire, the target takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

action.name: Holy Strike {@recharge 5}
entries: The ghost hunter flips up its eyepatch to reveal a holy relic embedded within the empty socket. Each creature within 30 feet of the ghost hunter must make a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw, taking 36 ({@damage 8d8}) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If an Undead fails the saving throw, it is also {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn.

bonus.name: Grappling Hook {@recharge 4}
entries: The ghost hunter launches its grappling hook at a Large or larger object or structure or at a Huge or larger creature it can see within 60 feet of it and is pulled to an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the target without provoking {@action opportunity attack||opportunity attacks}.

bonus.name: Elusive Hunter
entries: The ghost hunter takes the {@action Dodge} or {@action Hide} action.

reaction.name: Flame Burst
entries: When a hostile creature enters a space within 5 feet of the ghost hunter, the hunter can release a burst of fire from its clockwork hand. The creature must succeed on a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw or take 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage and have disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes against the ghost hunter before the end of the ghost hunter's next turn.

trait.name: Expert Wrestler
entries: The leviathan hunter can grapple creatures that are two sizes larger than itself and can move at its full speed when dragging a creature it has {@condition grappled}. If the hunter grapples a Medium or smaller creature, the target has disadvantage on its escape attempts. In addition, the hunter has advantage on ability checks and saving throws made to escape a grapple or end the {@condition restrained} condition.

trait.name: Hardy Defense
entries: While the leviathan hunter is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Constitution modifier.

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: The hunter can hold its breath for 30 minutes.

trait.name: Leviathan Hunter
entries: The leviathan hunter has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) and Wisdom ({@skill Survival}) checks to find and track Large or larger creatures with a swimming speed.

trait.name: Marine Weapons
entries: The leviathan hunter's weapon attacks are magical. When the hunter hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@damage 2d8} cold damage or poison damage (included in the attack), the hunter's choice.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The leviathan hunter has advantage on an attack roll against a target if at least one of the hunter's allies is within 5 feet of the target and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the leviathan hunter has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The leviathan hunter makes three Slam attacks, or it makes one Harpoon attack and two Slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) cold damage or poison damage (the hunter's choice), and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 17}). The hunter can grapple only one target at a time.

action.name: Harpoon
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) piercing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) cold damage or poison damage (the hunter's choice), and the harpoon sticks in the target. While the harpoon is stuck, the target takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) piercing damage at the start of each of its turns, the hunter can't make Harpoon attacks against other targets, and the target and hunter can't move further than 60 feet away from each other. A creature, including the target, can take its action to detach the harpoon by succeeding on a {@dc 17} Strength check. Alternatively, the cord connecting the leviathan hunter to the harpoon can be attacked and destroyed (AC 10; hp 25; immunity to bludgeoning, poison, and psychic damage), dislodging the harpoon into an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the target and preventing the leviathan hunter from using Recall Harpoon.

action.name: Crush
entries: One creature {@condition grappled} by the hunter must make a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw, taking 33 ({@damage 8d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

bonus.name: Recall Harpoon
entries: The leviathan hunter pulls on the cord connected to its harpoon, returning the harpoon to its empty hand. If the harpoon is stuck in a creature, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw or be pulled up to 20 feet toward the hunter.

reaction.name: Grappled Redirect
entries: If the leviathan hunter is the target of an attack it can see while grappling a creature, it can hold the {@condition grappled} creature in the way, and the {@condition grappled} creature becomes the target of the attack instead.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The planes hunter has advantage on attack rolls against a target if at least one of the hunter's allies is within 5 feet of the target and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Planar Attunement
entries: At the start of each of its turns, the planes hunter chooses one of the following damage types: acid, cold, fire, lightning, necrotic, radiant, or thunder. It has resistance to the chosen damage type until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Planar Weapons
entries: The planes hunter's weapon attacks are magical. When it hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@damage 3d8} damage of the type chosen with Planar Attunement (included in the attack).

trait.name: Planes Hunter
entries: The planes hunter has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) and Wisdom ({@skill Survival}) checks to find and track Celestials, Fiends, and Elementals.

trait.name: Snaring Blade
entries: If the planes hunter scores a critical hit against a creature, that creature can't use any method of extradimensional movement, including teleportation or travel to a different plane of existence, for 1 minute. The creature can make a {@dc 16} Charisma saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the planes hunter has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The planes hunter makes three Longsword attacks.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage, or 9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) slashing damage if used with two hands, plus 13 ({@damage 3d8}) acid, cold, fire, lightning, necrotic, radiant, or thunder damage (as determined by Planar Attunement).

action.name: Warping Whirlwind {@recharge 5}
entries: The planes hunter bends reality around it, slicing nearby creatures with sword strikes from across the planes. Each creature within 10 feet of the planes hunter must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw, taking 18 ({@damage 4d8}) slashing damage and 18 ({@damage 4d8}) acid, cold, fire, lightning, necrotic, radiant, or thunder damage (as determined by Planar Attunement) on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Planar Traveler (1/Day)
entries: The planes hunter can transport itself to a different plane of existence. This works like the {@spell plane shift} spell, except the hunter can only affect itself and can't use this action to banish an unwilling creature to another plane.

bonus.name: Planar Step
entries: The planes hunter teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see. Glowing swirls of elemental energy appear at the origin and destination when it uses this bonus action.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The planes hunter adds 4 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the hunter must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

trait.name: Crafty
entries: The sapper has advantage on ability checks made to pick locks or to detect, disarm, or set traps.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If the sapper is subjected to an effect that allows a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the sapper instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The sapper has advantage on attack rolls against a target if at least one of the sapper's allies is within 5 feet of the target and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The sapper deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the sapper has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The sapper makes three Mining Pick attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Throw Explosive.

action.name: Mining Pick
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Throw Explosive
entries: The sapper throws a minor explosive at one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 9 ({@damage 2d8}) force damage and is knocked {@condition prone}. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn't knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Explosive Charge {@recharge 5}
entries: The sapper throws a powerful explosive at a point it can see on the ground within 60 feet of it. Each creature within 15 feet of that point must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 9 ({@damage 2d8}) fire damage and 9 ({@damage 2d8}) force damage and is pushed up to 10 feet away from the point and knocked {@condition prone}. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn't pushed or knocked {@condition prone}. If a creature fails the saving throw by 5 or more, it is also {@condition deafened} for 1 minute. Alternatively, the sapper can place the explosive in a space within 5 feet of it and delay the explosion until the end of the sapper's next turn or when a creature moves to a space within 5 feet of the explosive, whichever happens first.
The kobold's scales are covered in soot. and a bit of smoke trickles up from its gear. It excitedly pores over maps and floorplans.
A sapper's job is to helps their allies move, fight, and survive. As combat engineers they take on a wide variety of roles, but what they cherish most is blowing up enemy defenses.

entries.name: Breaking Things
entries: Sappers are adept at breaking things: tunneling into fortresses, destroying bridges, busting through fortifications, or similar acts of structural destruction. Whether able to plan for weeks or forced to improvise on the spot, they have a hundred solutions for every problem—some of which will likely even minimize collateral damage.

entries.name: Black Powder
entries: By far, black powder is the sapper's favored tool, and few problems can't be solved with it. Black powder isn't always available, but that doesn't stop sappers. With just a little time, sappers can formulate magical explosions without the need for black powder, using what's on hand and a guarded alchemical formulation or two.

trait.name: Toxic Ichor
entries: While submerged in water, the lakescourge lotus's ichor taints the water within 10 feet of it. When a creature enters the area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} while it remains in the area and for 1 minute after it leaves. A {@condition poisoned} creature that is no longer in the water can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If the purify food and drink spell is cast on a space within 5 feet of the lakescourge lotus or on the space it occupies, this trait ceases to function for 1 minute.

trait.name: Undead Nature
entries: The lakescourge lotus doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Waterwalker
entries: The lakescourge lotus can walk across the surface of water as if it were solid ground. This trait otherwise works like the {@spell water walk} spell but isn't itself magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The lakescourge lotus makes two Tainted Claw or Poisonous Water Jet attacks.

action.name: Tainted Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. A {@condition poisoned} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Poisonous Water Jet
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 5} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 3d8 + 2}) poison damage.

action.name: Enter Reflection
entries: The lakescourge lotus touches a body of water large enough to hold it and becomes a reflection on the surface of the water. While in this form, the lotus has immunity to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks and resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from magical attacks. While a reflection, its speed is reduced to 5 feet, it can't make Tainted Claw attacks, and it can revert to its true form as a bonus action. If the lakescourge lotus takes damage that isn't bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing while it is a reflection, it is forced back into its true form.

monster.name: Leashed Lesion
languages: understands Void Speech but can't speak

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The leashed lesion makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage plus 5 ({@damage 2d4}) necrotic damage. The lesion and any creature {@condition grappled} by its Life Tether regain hp equal to the necrotic damage dealt.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: Draining Burst {@recharge 5}
entries: The leashed lesion selects a point it can see within 120 feet of it. Each creature within 20 feet of that point must make a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw, taking 13 ({@damage 3d8}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The lesion and any creature {@condition grappled} by its Life Tether each gain 13 ({@damage 3d8}) temporary hp.

bonus.name: Life Tether
entries: The leashed lesion attaches a symbiotic tether to a creature sitting in the recess in its back. A creature in the recess that isn't attached to the tether takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) piercing damage at the end of the lesion's turn, and the lesion regains hp equal to the damage dealt. While the tether is attached, the creature is {@condition grappled} by the lesion. The lesion or the creature can detach the tether as a bonus action. The lesion can have its symbiotic tether attached to only one creature at a time.

trait.name: Sense Magic
entries: The ley wanderer senses magic within 120 feet of it at will. This trait otherwise works like the {@spell detect magic} spell but isn't itself magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The ley wanderer makes three Slam or Psychic Lash attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) bludgeoning damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) psychic damage.

action.name: Psychic Lash
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 3d8 + 4}) psychic damage.

action.name: Dispelling Burst {@recharge 5}
entries: The ley wanderer emits a psychic burst that disrupts magic within 30 feet of it. Each creature in the area must make a {@dc 15} Intelligence saving throw, taking 27 ({@damage 6d8}) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. In addition, each spell of 3rd level or lower in the area immediately ends, and the ley wanderer gains 5 temporary hp for each spell ended in this way.

action.name: Teleport (3/Day)
entries: The ley wanderer magically teleports itself and up to six willing creatures holding hands with the ley wanderer, along with any equipment they are wearing or carrying, to a location the ley wanderer is familiar with, up to 100 miles away. If the destination is a location rich in magical energy, such as a ley line, the ley wanderer can teleport up to 300 miles away.

bonus.name: Drain Magic Item
entries: The ley wanderer drains the magic from an item it is holding. A magic item with charges loses {@dice 1d6} charges, an item with limited uses per day loses one daily use, and a single-use item, such as a potion or spell scroll is destroyed. All other magic items have their effects suppressed for 1 minute. The ley wanderer gains 5 temporary hp each time it drains a magic item. A drained item regains its magic after 24 hours.

reaction.name: Absorb Spell
entries: When a creature the ley wanderer can see within 30 feet of it casts a spell, the ley wanderer can absorb the spell's energy, countering it. This works like the {@spell counterspell} spell, except the ley wanderer must always make a spellcasting ability check, no matter the spell's level. Its ability check for this is +7. If it successfully counters the spell, the ley wanderer gains 5 temporary hp for each level of the spell.

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks not made with cold iron weapons

trait.name: Draw Life Essence
entries: The life broker can spend 10 minutes coaxing the life essence out of a willing creature, taking only the agreed‑upon amount of time from the creature's maximum lifetime. The life essence appears as a rosy mist that rises from the mouth, nose, or skin of the creature and snakes into a carved crystal vial in the broker's cloak, where it takes on the form of a crimson liquid. A creature that drinks such a vial gains the life stored within it, provided the life broker gave the vial willingly. If the life broker draws all the remaining life from a creature, that creature dies, and it can be returned to life only by means of a {@spell wish} spell.

trait.name: Life Reading
entries: If the life broker spends 1 minute studying a mortal creature it can see within 30 feet of it, the broker can determine the remainder of that creature's natural life, to the second.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The life broker has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Necrotic Weapons
entries: The life broker's weapon attacks are magical. When the life broker hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@damage 4d8} necrotic damage (included in the attack).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The life broker makes three Rapier attacks.

action.name: Rapier
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing plus 18 ({@damage 4d8}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Life Feast {@recharge 5}
entries: The life broker pulls life from hostile creatures within 30 feet of it that aren't Constructs or Undead. Each such creature in the area must make a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw, taking 36 ({@damage 8d8}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The life broker gains temporary hp equal to the single highest amount of necrotic damage dealt and has advantage on attack rolls until the end of its next turn.

bonus.name: Quick-Footed
entries: The life broker takes the {@action Dash}, {@action Disengage}, or {@action Dodge} action.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the light eater remains motionless in dim light or darkness, it is indistinguishable from a normal rock.

trait.name: Light Absorption
entries: When the light eater starts its turn within 5 feet of a source of light, the light is reduced while the light eater remains within 100 feet of the light source. Bright light becomes dim light, and dim light becomes darkness. If the light eater reduces a light source's light to darkness, the light eater sheds multicolored bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet for 1 hour, and the light source is extinguished if it is nonmagical flame or dispelled if it was created by a spell of 2nd level or lower.

trait.name: Light Sense
entries: The light eater can pinpoint the location of any source of light within 100 feet of it and can sense the general direction of any source of light within 1 mile of it.

action.name: Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.

variant.name: Light Eater Familiars
entries: Some light eaters are willing to serve spellcasters as a familiar. Such light eaters have the following trait.

entries.name: Familiar
entries: The light eater can serve another creature as a familiar, forming a magic, telepathic bond with that willing companion. While the two are bonded, the companion can sense what the light eater senses as long as they are within 1 mile of each other. While the light eater is within 10 feet of its companion, the companion gains resistance to radiant damage. At any time and for any reason, the light eater can end its service as a familiar, ending the telepathic bond.

items.name: Familiar
entries: The light eater can serve another creature as a familiar, forming a magic, telepathic bond with that willing companion. While the two are bonded, the companion can sense what the light eater senses as long as they are within 1 mile of each other. While the light eater is within 10 feet of its companion, the companion gains resistance to radiant damage. At any time and for any reason, the light eater can end its service as a familiar, ending the telepathic bond.

trait.name: Brittle
entries: If the living soot takes cold damage, it partially freezes; its speed is reduced by 10 feet and its AC is reduced by 2 until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Choking Air Form
entries: The living soot can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there, and it can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing. In addition, when a creature starts its turn in the same space as the living soot, the creature must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or take 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage and be unable to breathe until it starts its turn outside the soot's space.

trait.name: Elemental Nature
entries: The living soot doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the living soot remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a tangled mass of blackened, dusty webbing.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The elemental makes two Slam attacks, or it makes one Slam attack and one Constrict attack.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Constrict
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the living soot can't Constrict another target.

action.name: Engulfing Sootstorm {@recharge 4}
entries: The living soot spins violently in place, spreading out tendrils of thick, poisonous ash. Each creature within 20 feet of it must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) poison damage and its speed is halved. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and its speed isn't reduced. The speed reduction lasts until a creature spends an action cleaning off the ash.

trait.name: Danger From Above
entries: If the lobe lemur jumps at least 10 feet straight toward a creature from a higher position than the target, such as leaping down from a tree, it has advantage on the next attack roll it makes against that creature.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: The lobe lemur's long jump is up to 30 feet and its high jump is up to 15 feet, with or without a running start.

trait.name: Swamp Camouflage
entries: The lobe lemur has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to hide in swampy terrain.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The lobe lemur makes three Claw Swipe attacks, or it makes one Face Clamp attack and two Claw Swipe attacks.

action.name: Claw Swipe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d4 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Face Clamp
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d4 + 4}) piercing damage, and the lobe lemur attaches to the target's head. If the lobe lemur is already attached to the target when it hits with this attack, the attack doesn't deal damage.

Instead, the target is {@condition blinded} until the end of its next turn. While attached to the target, the lobe lemur can attack no other creature except the target but has advantage on its attack rolls. The lemur's speed also becomes 0, it can't benefit from any bonus to its speed, and it moves with the target.

A creature, including the target, can take its action to detach the lemur by succeeding on a {@dc 14} Strength check. On its turn, the lemur can detach itself from the target by using 5 feet of movement.

trait.name: Scent of Death
entries: Any creature that isn't Undead and that starts its turn within 5 feet of the kadag ogre must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} until the start of its next turn. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to the kadag ogre's Scent of Death for 1 hour.

trait.name: Undead Affinity
entries: An Undead has disadvantage on attack rolls against the kadag ogre if the ogre hasn't attacked that Undead within the past 24 hours. In addition, each skeleton and zombie within 30 feet of the kadag ogre that has no master follows the ogre's verbal commands until a master asserts magical control over it.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The kadag ogre makes three Spear attacks.

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) piercing damage, or 14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

action.name: Master of Death {@recharge 5}
entries: The kadag ogre empowers up to three friendly Undead it can see within 30 feet of it. Each empowered Undead can use a reaction to move up to half its speed and make one melee weapon attack. In addition, an empowered Undead gains 5 ({@damage 2d4}) temporary hit points for 1 minute. The kadag ogre can't empower Undead with an Intelligence score of 10 or higher.
This gray-skinned {@creature ogre} is clad in worked leather and stands straighter than its brethren. The stench of rotting flesh radiates from the creature.

Occasionally, an {@creature ogre} will seclude itself and master its hunger. Claiming a cave atop a desolate mountainside or deep in the badlands, the {@creature ogre} becomes a hermit and leaves its caves only to ritualistically murder whatever it finds. {@creature ogre||Ogres} that stick through the process and resist the urge to feast eventually become kadag ogres, strengthened by murder and masters of their own urges. They are smarter and tougher than most of their kin but are much less sociable.

entries.name: Masters of Death
entries: While not true necromancers, the rites performed by kadag ogres make them kin to the undead.
