entries: When the obsidian ophidian takes bludgeoning damage, each creature within 5 feet of the ophidian takes 2 ({@damage 1d4}) piercing damage, as shards of obsidian fly out from the elemental's body.

trait.name: Volcanic Rejuvenation
entries: The obsidian ophidian regains 10 hp at the start of its turn if at least part of its body is in contact with lava. If the obsidian ophidian takes cold damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the obsidian ophidian's next turn. The obsidian ophidian dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hp and doesn't regenerate.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The obsidian ophidian makes two Bite attacks or one Bite attack and one Constrict attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) piercing damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or take 5 ({@damage 2d4}) piercing damage at the start of each of its turns, as shards of obsidian lodge in the wound. Any creature can take an action to remove the shards with a successful {@dc 12} Wisdom ({@skill Medicine}) check. The shards shatter and crumble to dust if the target receives magical healing.

action.name: Constrict
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}) if it is a Large or smaller creature. Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained} and takes 5 ({@damage 2d4}) slashing damage at the start of each of its turns, and the ophidian can't use Constrict on another target.

action.name: Lava Splash {@recharge 4}
entries: The obsidian ophidian writhes and flails, splashing lava at everything near it. Each creature within 20 feet of the obsidian ophidian must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 21 ({@damage 6d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. To use this action, the obsidian ophidian must be touching lava or within 5 feet of lava.

monster.name: Offal Walker
languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

trait.name: Gut Lassos
entries: The offal walker can have up to three gut lassos at a time. Each gut lasso can be attacked (AC 13; 5 hp; immunity to poison damage). Destroying a lasso deals no damage to the offal walker, which can extrude a replacement gut lasso on its next turn. A gut lasso can also be broken if a creature takes an action and succeeds on a {@dc 13} Strength check against it.

trait.name: Undead Nature
entries: The offal walker doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The offal walker makes one Lasso attack for each gut lasso it has then uses Reel.

action.name: Lasso
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 30 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 13}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained} and the offal walker can't use the same gut lasso on another target.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} +3 reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d6 + 1}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Reel
entries: The offal walker pulls one creature {@condition grappled} by it up to 25 feet straight toward it.

monster.name: Old Salt
languages: the languages it knew in life

trait.name: Experienced Sailor
entries: The old salt has advantage on Strength ({@skill Athletics}) checks made to climb while on a sailing ship and on Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) checks to maintain its footing while on a sailing ship.

trait.name: Seaside Rejuvenation
entries: If at least one of the old salt's accusers is still alive or if the old salt's name hasn't been cleared, a destroyed old salt gains a new body in 13 days, regaining all its hp and becoming active again. The new body appears on the beach or dock nearest one of its living accusers.

trait.name: Undead Nature
entries: The old salt doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The old salt makes two Desiccating Slam attacks.

action.name: Desiccating Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or its hp maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hp maximum to 0.

action.name: Wave of Seawater {@recharge 5}
entries: The old salt throws its hand forward, sending out a wave of seawater in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) bludgeoning damage and begins choking as its lungs fill with seawater. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn't choking. A creature that can breathe water doesn't choke from failing this saving throw. A choking creature can make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns, coughing up the seawater and ending the effect on itself on a success.

bonus.name: Cunning Action
entries: The old salt can take the {@action Dash}, {@action Disengage}, or {@action Hide} action.

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The leavesrot ooze can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the leavesrot ooze remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary pile of leaves.

trait.name: Ooze Nature
entries: The leavesrot ooze doesn't require sleep.

trait.name: Rotting Leaves
entries: When a creature hits the leavesrot ooze with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it, mold spores and decomposing matter fly out from the wound. Each creature within 5 feet of the ooze must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Pseudopod
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage plus 13 ({@damage 3d8}) acid damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 13}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, the ooze can automatically hit the target with its Pseudopod, and the ooze can't make Pseudopod attacks against other targets.

action.name: Release Spores {@recharge 5}
entries: The leavesrot ooze releases spores from the mold coating its leaves. Each creature within 20 feet of the ooze must make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) poison damage and is choking. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn't choking. A choking creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
This pile of rotting leaves—in reds and yellows, oranges and browns—rustles as it scuttles along the ground in search of its next meal.

Leavesrot oozes spring to life when sentient mold grows on fallen leaves, causing them to coalesce and act in concert. Many believe they are the unlikely result of meddling by a wizard's apprentice, who grew tired of raking leaves outside the tower.

entries.name: Corrosive Heaps
entries: As piles of fallen leaves decompose, they coalesce, and as the mold grows, the ooze exudes acid potent enough to strip flesh from bone. Druids sometimes use these oozes to accelerate the decomposition of rotting corpses.

entries.name: Autumnal Ambuscade
entries: Leavesrot oozes lie in ambush on the forest floor, grabbing and devouring creatures that cross its path. Travelers have heard the cries of their companions who, after being wrestled to the ground with a withering squelch, are slowly eaten by these predatory mounds.

entries.name: Carnivorous Mounds
entries: No one is sure how the leavesrot ooze developed a taste for flesh, but they are sated, however briefly, after consuming seven creatures in a single month, temporarily entering a dormant state. Travelers in areas known to contain leavesrot oozes often bring along extra chickens, pigs, or other livestock to sate the creatures long enough to secure passage through the forest.

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The ooze can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Eye-Watering Stench
entries: The manure ooze gives off an odor so pungent it can bring tears to the eyes. A creature that starts its turn within 20 feet of the ooze must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or have disadvantage on attack rolls until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Flammable
entries: If a manure ooze takes fire damage, it bursts into flame until the end of its next turn. When it hits with a Pseudopod attack while on fire, the Pseudopod deals an extra 3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage.

trait.name: Ooze Nature
entries: The manure ooze doesn't require sleep.

action.name: Pseudopod
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Digest Corpse
entries: The manure ooze dissolves a corpse in its space that is less than 1 week old. It regains {@dice 1d6} hp per size category of the creature it consumes. For example, it regains {@dice 1d6} hp when consuming a Tiny creature or {@dice 4d6} hp when consuming a Large creature. The corpse is then destroyed, and this action can't be used on it again.

reaction.name: Split
entries: When a manure ooze that is Medium or larger is subjected to slashing damage, it splits into two new oozes if it has at least 10 hp. Each new ooze has hp equal to half the original ooze's rounded down. New oozes are one size smaller than the original ooze.
Miniscule particles and larger unidentifiable chunks punctuate this sludgy, brown mass.

Sometimes putrid spirits in refuse, water, and fertilizer combine and lurch into a primordial form of life, especially in farmland where the soil itself has absorbed vast amounts of arcane energy, such as ancient battlegrounds or the sites of crumbled, mystical artifacts. Manure oozes consume and grow from that energy, and if left unchecked, they can increase their mass and volume to that of a large pond.

entries.name: Corrosive Heaps
entries: Manure oozes pose a considerable threat to farm hands, shepherds, and others who work in the countryside or farmlands. They can lie still for days, looking no different than any other pile of compost, until they kill and digest a farmer or grab unattended livestock. When the ooze runs out of food, it moves on to the next farm and begins its cycle again.

entries.name: Rich Remains
entries: Despite the danger they present, manure oozes can be surprisingly beneficial to a farm. As it moves, a manure ooze leaves a sticky, nutrient rich trail behind it. Plants sown in such soil grow faster and larger than plants grown with normal compost or fertilizer. Similarly, when a manure ooze is destroyed, it enriches the land as its decomposing form revitalizes the soil, resulting in healthy, lush gardens.

entries.name: Manure Oozes in Midgard
entries: Manure oozes are most commonly encountered in the lush farmlands of the Magocracy of Alain. A few families with some magical ability have taken on the dangerous but very lucrative occupation of breeding and raising manure oozes. Properties that house breeding facilities keep the nature of their business a secret as much to avoid depredation from their competitors as to avoid causing a panic amongst the common folk.

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The ooze can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Corrosive Form
entries: A creature that touches a scintillating ooze or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) acid damage.

trait.name: Ooze Nature
entries: The scintillating ooze doesn't require sleep.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The scintillating ooze can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The scintillating ooze makes one Pseudopod attack and three Weapon Thrash attacks.

action.name: Weapon Thrash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d4 + 5}) bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing (the ooze's choice) damage.

action.name: Pseudopod
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d4 + 5}) bludgeoning damage plus 18 ({@damage 4d8}) acid damage.

reaction.name: Shed Oozling
entries: When the scintillating ooze has more than 10 hp and is subjected to acid, cold, lightning, or slashing damage, the scintillating ooze can lose 10 hp to create an oozling. An oozling has the same statistics as the scintillating ooze, except it is Tiny, has 10 hp, can't make Weapon Thrash attacks, and can't use this reaction or use legendary actions.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The scintillating ooze moves up to its speed without provoking {@action opportunity attack||opportunity attacks}.

legendary.name: Grasping Pseudopod
entries: The scintillating ooze launches a pseudopod at one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw or be pulled up to 30 feet toward the ooze.

legendary.name: Lunging Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The scintillating ooze makes one Weapon Thrash attack at a creature it can see within 10 feet of it.
A tentacled horror oozes forward, its long, slimy pseudopods wielding an assortment of weapons.

A scintillating ooze can be found anywhere junk collects. Legends say the oozes were created to protect treasures and armories, but they ended up consuming their creators, along with any other adventurers unlucky enough to stumble across them.

entries.name: Apex Predator
entries: Scintillating oozes represents the final step in the evolution of oozes. They possess several traits common in smaller oozes, slimes, and jellies and are smart enough to apply predatory tactics and wield weapons left by victims. Though they understand which end of the weapon to use against their prey, they aren't intelligent enough to activate magic weapons with command words, buttons, or similar. It can't be reasoned with, but it can be tricked, lured, or corralled by effective tactics. Like a {@creature lion} or {@creature tiger}, it is an apex predator capable of waiting until the right moment to strike.

entries.name: Sparkling Lures
entries: Scintillating oozes understand that sparkling treasures lure prey, and they use such treasures as traps for greedy adventures and curious animals alike, lying in wait to ambush the distracted prey. It attacks with weapons from its treasure hoard if possible and uses its pseudopods to grasp and hold prey. An injured scintillating ooze doesn't run from potential prey, but it sends any severed pieces of itself to flee. These severed pieces eventually grow into full-sized scintillating oozes, and stories claim some regrown scintillating oozes even recognize prey that escaped them in their previous "lives."

trait.name: Divine Weapons
entries: When the apostle hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@dice 2d8} necrotic or radiant damage (included in the attack), the apostle's choice.

trait.name: Faith's Reward
entries: When the apostle casts the {@spell bless} spell, it gains the benefit of the spell even if it doesn't include itself as a target. In addition, when the apostle restores hp to another creature, it regains hp equal to half that amount.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The apostle makes three Mace or Divine Bolt attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting.

action.name: Mace
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) bludgeoning damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) necrotic or radiant damage (the apostle's choice).

action.name: Divine Bolt
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 7} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) necrotic or radiant damage (the apostle's choice).

action.name: Destroy Undead (2/Day)
entries: The apostle presents its holy symbol and intones a prayer. Each undead within 30 feet of the apostle that can see or hear it must make a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw, taking 28 ({@damage 8d6}) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The apostle casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 15}):

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: Until the shoal ooze attacks, it is indistinguishable from a large school of fish.

trait.name: Ooze Nature
entries: The shoal ooze doesn't require sleep.

trait.name: Symbiotically Bound
entries: The ooze and the fish's life force have become entwined. They share statistics as if they were one creature and can't be separated.

trait.name: Water Breathing
entries: The shoal ooze can breathe only underwater.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The shoal ooze uses Mesmerizing Spiral. It then makes three Pseudopod attacks and uses Engulf.

action.name: Pseudopod
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d10 + 5}) bludgeoning damage, the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 16}).

action.name: Engulf
entries: The shoal ooze engulfs one Huge or smaller creature {@condition grappled} by it. The engulfed target is {@condition restrained} and unable to breathe unless it can breathe water, and it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw at the start of each of the ooze's turns or take 21 ({@damage 6d6}) acid damage. If the ooze moves, the engulfed target moves with it. The ooze can have two Huge creatures or up to eight Large or smaller creatures engulfed at a time.

An engulfed creature, or a creature within 5 feet of the ooze, can take its action to remove the engulfed creature from the ooze by succeeding on a {@dc 16} Strength check, putting the engulfed creature in an unoccupied space of its choice within 5 feet of the ooze.

action.name: Mesmerizing Spiral
entries: The fish inside the shoal ooze swim rapidly in a hypnotic spiral. Each creature within 20 feet of the ooze that can see the fish must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition incapacitated} for 1 minute. While {@condition incapacitated}, its speed is reduced to 0. The {@condition incapacitated} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the Mesmerizing Spiral of all shoal oozes for the next 24 hours.
Hundreds of small silver fish school together in a tightly-packed sphere inside this enormous, near-invisible ooze.

The shoal ooze is a deadly, ocean-dwelling predator that thrives in symbiosis with a school of acid-resistant fish. In return for the ooze's protection from predators, the fish lure prey toward the ooze. When {@creature shark||sharks} or other would-be predators approach, the schooling fish swim in mesmerizing spiral patterns, allowing the ooze to surprise the hunters and devour them. As the ooze's acid dissolves its engulfed victims, the fish eagerly gobble up tiny pieces.

entries.name: Obscure Origins
entries: {@creature Merfolk} scholars believe these fish were once native to volcanic seas, eventually growing resistant to acidic environments. Encounters between an ocean-dwelling ooze and the fish long ago allowed them to develop their symbiotic relationship. The deranged—some say visionary—{@creature lich} who created the first {@creature giant shark bowl|CCodex} ooze may have been inspired by studying the shoal ooze.

entries.name: Inextricably Linked
entries: The fish live entirely inside the ooze, including hatching offspring. When the school—and its surrounding ooze—gets too big, part of the school splits off, forming a new shoal ooze. Small shoal oozes might combine into a larger shoal ooze, securing themselves against predators.

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The ooze can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Hollow Cylindrical Form (Stretched Body Only)
entries: Creatures can occupy the space in the center of the cylinder formed by the sinkhole ooze, and each such space is always within the ooze's reach, regardless of the size of the cylinder.

trait.name: Ooze Nature
entries: The sinkhole ooze doesn't require sleep.

trait.name: Seizing Pseudopods
entries: The sinkhole ooze can have up to six tendril-like Pseudopods at a time. Each Pseudopod can be attacked (AC 10; 10 hp; immunity to acid, poison, and psychic damage). Destroying a Pseudopod deals no damage to the ooze, which can extrude a replacement Pseudopod on its next turn. A Pseudopod can also be broken if a creature takes an action and succeeds on a {@dc 14} Strength check against it.

trait.name: Slimy Appearance (Stretched Body Only)
entries: While the sinkhole ooze remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from the interior of the pit or hole in the ground it is stretched across, though the interior walls appear to be wet.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The sinkhole ooze can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The sinkhole ooze makes two Pseudopod attacks.

action.name: Pseudopod
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 15 ft., one creature. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) bludgeoning damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) acid damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 14}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained} and takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) acid damage at the start of each of its turns, and the ooze can't use the same Pseudopod on another target.

bonus.name: Stretch Body
entries: The sinkhole ooze stretches its body around the inner walls of a pit, sinkhole, or other circular opening in the ground. When stretched in this way, the ooze forms a hollow cylinder that is up to 25 feet tall with an up to 25-foot radius. The ooze can end the stretch as a bonus action, occupying the nearest unoccupied space to the hole in the ground.

reaction.name: Pluck (Stretched Body Only)
entries: When at least one creature falls down the center of the cylinder formed by the sinkhole ooze, the ooze can try to grab up to two of the creatures. Each target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw or be {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 14}) in one of the ooze's Pseudopods.
The walls of the pit shift, and half a dozen tendrils pluck the falling deer from the air, dissolve it, and drop its skeleton into the darkness below.

Sinkhole oozes are translucent creatures that can stretch themselves around or across a well, pit, sinkhole, gully or similar opening and catch whatever falls down the hole. They catch and hold the falling creatures, dissolving and consuming the prey's softer tissues before releasing the skeleton.

entries.name: Terrors of Sinkholes
entries: Sinkhole oozes ambush prey underground, in flatlands or low hills, with limestone bedrock, and in humanoid-made wells and traps.

entries.name: Symbiotic Relationships
entries: A sinkhole ooze has just enough intelligence to work with other creatures. Some intelligent creatures will use a sinkhole ooze as a trap, driving or luring enemies into its clutches. The ooze recognizes this and avoids eating its partners—so long as they provide it with food.

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The snow ooze can move through a space as narrow as 1 foot wide without squeezing.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the snow ooze remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a patch of snow.

trait.name: Ice Walk
entries: The snow ooze can move across icy surfaces without needing to make an ability check. Additionally, difficult terrain composed of ice or snow doesn't cost it extra movement.

trait.name: Ooze Nature
entries: The snow ooze doesn't require sleep.

trait.name: Snow Blindness
entries: When a creature that can see the snow ooze starts its turn within 30 feet of the ooze, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition blinded} until the start of its next turn. This trait doesn't function while the snow ooze is in dim light or darkness.

trait.name: Snow Burrower
entries: The snow ooze can burrow through nonmagical snow and ice in addition to sand, earth, and mud.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The snow ooze makes two Pseudopod attacks.

action.name: Pseudopod
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 3d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) cold damage.

action.name: Avalanche {@recharge 4}
entries: The snow ooze rumbles forward, stirring up snow as it goes. The ooze moves up to 30 feet in a straight line and can move through the space of any Large or smaller creature. The first time it enters a creature's space during this move, that creature must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw.

On a failure, a creature takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) bludgeoning damage and 18 ({@damage 4d8}) cold damage and is buried in slushy snow. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn't buried. A buried creature is {@condition restrained} and unable to breathe or stand up. A creature, including the buried creature, can take its action to free the buried creature by succeeding on a {@dc 15} Strength check. A buried creature with a swimming speed has advantage on this check.
The field of snow suddenly reveals itself to be a huge white ooze that rolls forward like an avalanche.
The exterior of the snow ooze is firm like packed snow, but its interior is slushy and semi-liquid, allowing them to hide in their snowy homes more effectively.

entries.name: Cold Climate Hunters
entries: Snow oozes hunt in perpetually snow-covered land in the subartic and extreme arctic or in high mountainous areas. Their range increases in winter, allowing them to hunt further into temperate climes, retreating to the arctic and subarctic areas as the snow melts.

entries.name: Convenient Disposal
entries: Intelligent creatures in colder climes, such as {@creature frost giant||frost giants}, often trick snow oozes into pits or enclosed sections of their fortresses, using them as garbage disposals or deadly traps.

monster.name: Painted Phantasm
languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

trait.name: Construct Nature
entries: The painted phantasm doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The painted phantasm is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The painted phantasm has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The painted phantasm makes two Paint Slash attacks or one Capture Image attack and one Paint Slash attack.

action.name: Capture Image
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 4d10}) force damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Charisma saving throw or be captured as an image on a flat surface of the phantasm's choice within 60 feet of it. While an image, the target appears on the surface as a painting, drawing, or similar caricature of itself, and it is {@condition incapacitated} and {@condition restrained}. The target can see and hear outside of the surface, but it can't target those outside the surface with spells or cast spells or use features that allow it to leave the surface. If the surface where the target is captured takes damage, the target takes half the damage. If the surface is reduced to 0 hp, the target is freed. A successful {@spell dispel magic} ({@dc 15}) cast on the surface also frees the captured creature.

If the painted phantasm takes 20 damage or more on a single turn, the phantasm must succeed on a {@dc 15} Charisma saving throw at the end of that turn or lose its focus, releasing all captured creatures.

action.name: Paint Slash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing plus 16 ({@damage 3d10}) poison damage.

action.name: Painting Sensor
entries: While touching one artwork, the painted phantasm can see and hear through another artwork it has previously touched as if it was in that artwork's space, provided the artwork is within 1 mile of it. "Artwork" can mean any painting, drawing, or other design on a flat surface, including a pattern painted on a wall or in a book.

bonus.name: Painting Portal
entries: The painted phantasm uses 10 feet of its movement to step magically into one artwork within its reach and emerge from a second artwork within 100 feet of the first artwork, appearing in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the second artwork. If both artworks are Large or larger, the phantasm can bring up to three willing creatures with it as part of this movement.

trait.name: Echolocation
entries: The pelagic blush worm can't use its {@sense blindsight} while {@condition deafened}.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The pelagic blush worm deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Water Breathing
entries: The pelagic blush worm can breathe only underwater.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The worm makes one Bite attack and one Tail Fin attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d8 + 6}) piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw or be swallowed by the worm. A swallowed creature is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the worm, and it takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) acid damage at the start of each of the worm's turns.

If the worm takes 25 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the worm must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of the worm. If the worm dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse by using 15 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

action.name: Tail Fin
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 3d6 + 6}) slashing damage plus 16 ({@damage 3d6 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Red Acid Spume {@recharge 5}
entries: The worm exhales a gout of crimson stomach acid in a 30-foot cone, if the worm is underwater, or a 50-foot line that is 5 feet wide, if the worm is above water. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw, taking 31 ({@damage 9d6}) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Elemental Demise
entries: If the peri dies, its body disintegrates into a warm breeze, leaving behind only the equipment the peri was wearing or carrying.

action.name: Wind Slash
entries: {@atk ms,rs} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d4 + 4}) slashing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) lightning damage or thunder damage (the peri's choice).

action.name: Invisibility
entries: The peri magically turns {@condition invisible} until it attacks or uses Storm Wave, or until its concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment the peri wears or carries is {@condition invisible} with it.

action.name: Storm Wave (1/Day)
entries: The peri throws its arms forward, releasing a blast of stormy wind in a 30-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) lightning damage and 7 ({@damage 2d6}) thunder damage and is pushed up to 10 feet away from the peri. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn't pushed.

trait.name: Celestial Weapons
entries: The pescavitus's weapon attacks are magical. When the pescavitus hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@damage 2d4} radiant damage (included in the attack).

trait.name: Immortal Nature
entries: The pescavitus doesn't require food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The pescavitus has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Piscine Curse
entries: When a creature reduces the pescavitus to 0 hp, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 13} Charisma saving throw or be cursed for 5 days. A cursed creature can be detected as a fiend with spells such as detect evil and good. In addition, for the duration, the cursed creature gains only half the benefit of magic that restores hp and gains no benefits from finishing a long rest. A creature that consumes any amount of the flesh of a pescavitus is automatically cursed. The curse can be lifted by a {@spell remove curse} spell or similar magic.

trait.name: Water Breathing
entries: The pescavitus can breathe only underwater.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage plus 5 ({@damage 2d4}) radiant damage.

action.name: Air Bubble (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The pescavitus creates an air bubble around the heads of any number of creatures that are touching it. A creature that benefits from an air bubble can breathe underwater and gains a swimming speed of 20 feet, if it doesn't already have a swimming speed. The air bubbles hold enough air for 24 hours of breathing, divided by the number of breathing creatures that received an air bubble.

action.name: Healing Touch (3/Day)
entries: The pescavitus touches another creature. The target magically regains 5 ({@damage 1d8 + 1}) hp and is freed from any disease, poison, blindness, or deafness.

trait.name: Fiery Feathers
entries: The phoenixborn sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet.

trait.name: Rebirth (1/Day)
entries: If the phoenixborn is reduced to 0 hp, it erupts in a burst of flame. Each creature within 10 feet of it takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage, and the phoenixborn regains hp equal to the total damage taken.

action.name: Talon
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Hurl Flame
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 4} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) fire damage.

trait.name: Fiery Feathers
entries: The phoenixborn sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet.

trait.name: Rebirth (1/Day)
entries: If the phoenixborn sorcerer is reduced to 0 hp, it erupts in a burst of flame. Each creature within 10 feet of it takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage, and the phoenixborn sorcerer regains hp equal to the total damage taken.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The phoenixborn sorcerer makes two Talon or Hurl Flame attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting.

action.name: Talon
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Hurl Flame
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 5} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) fire damage.

action.name: Fire Jet {@recharge 6}
entries: The phoenixborn sorcerer shoots a jet of fire in a 30-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw, taking 14 ({@damage 4d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The phoenixborn sorcerer casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 13}):

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: The porcillina has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The porcillina has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the porcellina's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Poisonous Flesh
entries: A creature that touches the porcellina or consumes the meat of the porcellina must succeed on a {@dc 11} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} for 1 hour.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 11} Dexterity saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. The DC increases by 1 for each other porcellina that hit the target since the end of this porcellina's previous turn, to a maximum of {@dc 15}.

reaction.name: Squeal
entries: When a porcellina is hit with an attack, it can let out a blood-curdling scream. Each creature within 10 feet of the porcellina must succeed on a {@dc 11} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} until the end of its next turn.

monster.name: Primordial Matriarch

trait.name: Elemental Attacks
entries: The primordial matriarch's weapon attacks are magical. When she hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@damage 5d6} damage of the type determined by Roiling Elements.

trait.name: Elemental Aura
entries: At the start of each of the primordial matriarch's turns, each creature within 5 feet of her takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) damage of the type determined by Roiling Elements. A creature that touches the primordial matriarch or hits her with a melee attack while within 10 feet of her takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) damage of the type determined by Roiling Elements. A nonmagical weapon that hits the matriarch is destroyed after dealing damage.

trait.name: Elemental Nature
entries: The primordial matriarch doesn't require air, food, drink or sleep.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the primordial matriarch fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The primordial matriarch has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Roiling Elements
entries: At the start of each of her turns, the primordial matriarch chooses one of the following damage types: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder. The matriarch has immunity to that damage type until the start of her next turn.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The primordial matriarch deals double damage to objects and structures.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The elemental matriarch uses Storm Blast. She then makes two Elemental Lash attacks.

action.name: Elemental Lash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 17} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}32 ({@damage 4d10 + 10}) bludgeoning damage plus 17 ({@damage 5d6}) damage of the type determined by Roiling Elements.

action.name: Storm Blast
entries: The primordial matriarch emits elemental energy in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in the area must make a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) damage of the type determined by Roiling Elements and suffers one of the following effects, depending on the damage type. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and doesn't suffer an additional effect, unless specified below.

items.name: Acid Blast
items.entry: On a failed save, the creature is covered in acid. At the start of each of its turns, it takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) acid damage until it or another creature takes an action to scrape or wash off the acid.

items.name: Cold Blast.
items.entry: On a failed save, the creature is {@condition restrained} by ice until the end of its next turn, or until it or another creature takes an action to break it free. On a successful save, the creature's speed is reduced by 10 feet until the end of its next turn.

items.name: Fire Blast.
items.entry: On a failed save, the creature catches fire. Until it or another creature takes an action to douse the fire, the creature takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

items.name: Lightning Blast.
items.entry: On a failed save, the creature is {@condition incapacitated} until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature can't take reactions until the start of its next turn.

items.name: Thunder Blast.
items.entry: On a failed save, the creature is {@condition deafened} for 1 minute. At the end of each of its turns, a {@condition deafened} creature can repeat the saving throw, ending the deafness on itself on a success. On a successful save, the creature is {@condition deafened} until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Create Elementals
entries: The primordial matriarch magically creates up to {@dice 3d6} {@filter mephits|bestiary|search=mephit}, 2 {@creature air elemental||air}, {@creature earth elemental||earth}, {@creature fire elemental||fire}, or {@creature water elemental||water elementals}, 2 {@creature ice elemental|ToB2|ice elementals}, or 1 {@creature rockslide elemental|ToB3}. The Elementals arrive at the start of her next turn, acting as allies of the matriarch and obeying her spoken commands. The Elementals remain for 1 hour, until the matriarch dies, or until the matriarch dismisses them as a bonus action. The primordial matriarch can have any number of Elementals under her control at one time, provided the combined total CR of the Elementals is no higher than 10.

reaction.name: Elemental Adaptation
entries: When the matriarch would take acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage, she can change the element selected with Roiling Elements to that type of damage, gaining immunity to that damage type, including the triggering damage.

legendaryHeader: The primordial matriarch can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The matriarch regains spent legendary actions at the start of her turn.

legendary.name: Elemental Change
entries: The primordial matriarch changes the damage immunity granted by Roiling Elements.

legendary.name: Fly
entries: The primordial matriarch flies up to half her flying speed without provoking {@action opportunity attack||opportunity attacks}.

legendary.name: Create Elemental (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The primordial matriarch uses Create Elementals.

legendary.name: Return to Mother (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The primordial matriarch absorbs an Elemental within 10 feet of her, gaining a temporary hp equal to 10 times the CR of the Elemental absorbed.

trait.name: Elemental Nature
entries: The primordial surge doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Life From Death
entries: When the surge dies, it explodes in a burst of raw creation. The area in a 50-foot radius centered on the primordial surge is blanketed in lush flora native to the region, providing enough food to feed a dozen Large or smaller creatures for 6 ({@damage 1d12}) days. Creatures in the area that have been dead no longer than 1 day are returned to life with 4 ({@damage 1d8}) hp.

trait.name: Primordial Form
entries: The primordial surge can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing. A creature that touches the primordial surge or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage (the primordial surge's choice). In addition, the primordial surge can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. The first time it enters a creature's space on a turn, that creature takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage (the surge's choice). A creature that starts its turn in the primordial surge's space must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition blinded} and {@condition deafened} until it starts its turn outside the surge's space.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The primordial surge makes three Elemental Strike attacks.

action.name: Elemental Strike
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 15 ft. or range 60 ft., one target. {@h}28 ({@damage 4d10 + 6}) acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage (the primordial surge's choice).

action.name: Primordial Storm {@recharge 6}
entries: A rain of elemental energies falls around the primordial surge, producing one of the following effects:

items.name: Restorative Rain.
items.entry: Each creature within 30 feet of the surge that isn't a Construct or Undead regains 27 ({@damage 5d10}) hp. The area becomes difficult terrain as nonmagical plants in the area become thick and overgrown.

items.name: Ruinous Rain.
items.entry: Each creature within 30 feet of the surge must make a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 27 ({@damage 5d10}) acid damage and 27 ({@damage 5d10}) fire damage and is coated in burning acid. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn't coated in acid. A creature coated in acid takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) acid damage and 5 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage at the start of each of its turns until it or another creature takes an action to scrape or wash off the acid.

trait.name: Malleable Physiology
entries: At the start of its turn, the atavist gains one of the following benefits until it ends the effect (no action required) or the start of its next turn: {@sense Darkvision} out to a range of 30 feet.
A climbing, flying, or swimming speed of 30 feet.
Advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing or smell.
Bony spikes sprout along its skin, and a creature that touches the atavist or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 4 ({@damage 1d8}) piercing damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The atavist makes two Keratin Blade or Bone Shard attacks. If both attacks hit one target, the target takes an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) piercing damage as bits of bone dig deeper into the target.

action.name: Keratin Blade
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Bone Shard
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks not made with cold iron weapons

trait.name: Beguiling Aura
entries: The mere sight of the pca is a temptation for road-weary travelers. Whenever a creature that can see the pca starts its turn within 30 feet of the pca, that creature succeed on make a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} for 1 minute. A {@condition charmed} creature must take the {@action Dash} action and move toward the pca by the safest available route on each of its turns, trying to get within 5 feet of the fey horse to mount it. Each time the creature takes damage and at the end of each of its turns, the creature can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the pca's Beguiling Aura for the next 24 hours.

trait.name: Nightmarish Ride
entries: If a creature mounts the pca, the creature must succeed on a {@dc 15} Charisma saving throw or become {@condition paralyzed} and {@condition restrained} by chains on the pca's back until the next dawn. While it has a rider captured in this way, the pca takes the {@action Dash} or {@action Disengage} actions on each of its turns to flee with the rider. After it moves 100 feet, it disappears with the captured rider, magically racing along a nightmarish landscape. At the next dawn, it returns to the space where it disappeared or the nearest unoccupied space, the rider lands in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the pca, and the pca flees. At the end of the ride, the rider suffers one level of {@condition exhaustion}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The pca makes two Chain Whip attacks and one Hooves attack.

action.name: Chain Whip
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}) if it is a Medium or smaller creature and the pca doesn't have two other creatures {@condition grappled}. Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}.

action.name: Hooves
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.
A dark horse draped in thick silver chains emerges from the shadows between the trees, its eyes glowing with an eerie light.

This mysterious equine fey appears at night beside lonely forest roads and tempts weary travelers to ride it. Once upon its back, however, the pca takes the foolish individual on a nightmarish ride through the dark woods before returning them to where they started at dawn, exhausted. Those who have ridden a pca report seeing twisted, otherworldly forests and strange creatures.

entries.name: Redeemable
entries: The pca is a fey creature corrupted by shadow. If a rider who is pure of heart willingly climbs astride the pca, enjoys the ride, and thanks the pca when they return at dawn, the pca is cleansed of the shadow taint, and the chains fall away from its body. The pca is then free to aid lost travelers instead of terrorizing them.

entries.name: Pca in the Shadow Realm
entries: In the Midgard setting and the Shadow Realm, the pca can travel the shadow roads at will. During its nightmarish rides, it crosses in and out of these pathways, allowing riders to glimpse terrifying things. If a rider redeems a pca and asks for its aid, the rider can use the mount to gain access to the shadow roads.

trait.name: Blessings of the Sea Gods
entries: The puffinfolk has advantage on saving throws while flying over or swimming in ocean waters.

trait.name: Hardy Ocean Explorers
entries: The puffinfolk is considered a Medium creature when determining its carrying capacity. In addition, it can hold its breath for 30 minutes.

trait.name: Oceanic Recall
entries: The puffinfolk can perfectly recall any path it has traveled above or within an ocean.

action.name: Peck
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Quick and Nimble
entries: When a creature the puffinfolk can see targets it with a melee or ranged weapon attack, the puffinfolk darts out of the way, and the attacker has disadvantage on the attack roll.

monster.name: Pyrite Pile
languages: understands Dwarvish and Terran but can't speak

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the pyrite pile remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal pile of gold nuggets.

trait.name: Gold Fever
entries: When a Humanoid or xorn that can see the pyrite pile starts its turn within 60 feet of the pyrite pile, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} until the end of its next turn. A {@condition charmed} creature must take the {@action Dash} action and move toward the pyrite pile by the safest available route on its next turn, trying to get within 5 feet of the Elemental.

trait.name: Metal Sense
entries: The pyrite pile can pinpoint, by scent, the location of precious metals within 60 feet of it and can sense the general direction of Small or larger deposits of such metals within 1 mile.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The pyrite pile makes two Slam attacks. If the pyrite pile hits one Medium or smaller creature with both attacks, the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 16}). Until this grapple ends, the target takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) bludgeoning damage at the start of each of its turns. The pyrite pile can have only one creature {@condition grappled} at a time.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 3d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Hurl Nugget
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Eat Gold
entries: The pyrite pile absorbs 52 ({@damage 8d12}) gp worth of nonmagical items and coins made of precious metals, ignoring copper, worn or carried by one creature {@condition grappled} by it, and the elemental regains hp equal to half that amount. Absorbed metal is destroyed.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the pyrrhic podthrower remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a clump of crabgrass.

trait.name: Flaming Seedpod Regrowth
entries: The pyrrhic podthrower has four Flaming Seedpods. Used Flaming Seedpods may regrow each turn. If the pyrrhic podthrower starts its turn with less than four Flaming Seedpods, roll a {@dice d6}. On a roll of 5 or 6, it regrows {@dice 1d4} Flaming Seedpods, to a maximum of 4.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The pyrrhic podthrower regains 10 hp at the start of its turn. If the podthrower takes necrotic damage or if it is {@condition grappled} and removed from the ground, this trait doesn't function at the start of its next turn. The podthrower dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hp and doesn't regenerate.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The pyrrhic podthrower makes three Grass Blade attacks, or it uses Flaming Seedpod twice.

action.name: Grass Blade
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Flaming Seedpod
entries: The podthrower lobs a flaming seedpod at a point it can see within 60 feet of it. The seedpod explodes on impact and is destroyed. Each creature within 10 feet of that point must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 12 ({@damage 5d4}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

reaction.name: Unstable Bulb
entries: When the pyrrhic podthrower is {@condition grappled} and removed from the ground while above 0 hp, the unstable root bulb bursts. Each creature within 10 feet of the podthrower must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 12 ({@damage 5d4}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Keen Sight and Smell
entries: The quagga has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight or smell.

trait.name: Knife Dancer
entries: When the quagga hits a creature with a Twin Blade attack, it doesn't provoke {@action opportunity attack||opportunity attacks} when it moves out of that creature's reach.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The quagga has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the quagga's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Trampling Charge
entries: If the quagga moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a Twin Blade attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the quagga can make one Hooves attack against it as a bonus action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The quagga makes two Twin Blade attacks and one Hooves attack, or it makes four Javelin attacks.

action.name: Hooves
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Javelin
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Twin Blade
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

bonus.name: War Surge
entries: When the quagga reduces a creature to 0 hp with a melee attack on its turn, the quagga can move up to half its speed and make a Twin Blade attack.

trait.name: Earth Glide
entries: The qumdaq can burrow through nonmagical, unworked earth, sand, and stone. While doing so, the elemental doesn't disturb the material it moves through.

trait.name: Elemental Nature
entries: The qumdaq doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Final Gift
entries: When the qumdaq dies, it bursts in a shower of sand. A qumdaq of the dying qumdaq's choice within 10 feet of it regains 5 ({@damage 2d4}) hp, or the target gains 5 ({@damage 2d4}) temporary hp if it is at its hp maximum.

trait.name: Horde Tactics
entries: The qumdaq has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the qumdaq's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}. In addition, the qumdaq's weapon attacks deal an extra 2 ({@damage 1d4}) bludgeoning damage on a hit, if at least three of the qumdaq's allies are within 5 feet of the target and the allies aren't incapacitated.

trait.name: Sense Magic
entries: The qumdaq senses magic within 60 feet of it at will. This trait otherwise works like the {@spell detect magic} spell but isn't itself magical.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Desiccation Field (1/Day)
entries: The qumdaq extends its arms, sending sand and grit swirling around itself. Each creature that isn't a qumdaq within 10 feet of the qumdaq must make a {@dc 10} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 5 ({@damage 2d4}) bludgeoning damage and suffers one level of {@condition exhaustion} for 1 hour, or until it drinks at least 1 pint of water. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn't exhausted. A creature can suffer no more than a total of three levels of {@condition exhaustion} from Desiccation Field, regardless of how many qumdaqs use the action.

monster.name: Rafflesian
languages: understands the languages of its host companion but can't speak

trait.name: Symbiote
entries: A rafflesian can bond with a willing Humanoid creature that remains in physical contact with it for 10 minutes. While bonded in this way, the host creature gains a +2 bonus to AC and saving throws and has resistance to all damage, and the rafflesian's speed is 0, moving with the host when it moves. Each time the host takes damage, the rafflesian takes the same amount of damage. If the host is subjected to an effect that would force it to make a saving throw, the host can use its saving throw bonuses or the rafflesian's. If both are subjected to the same effect, only one of them is affected, the rafflesian's choice. The rafflesian and the host otherwise retain their own statistics and take separate turns. The rafflesian and the host can't be separated, unless the rafflesian chooses to terminate the connection. The rafflesian can detach itself safely from a host over the course of 1 hour, or it can detach itself from the creature as an action, which immediately kills the host.

trait.name: Symbiotic Thought
entries: The rafflesian and its host can communicate telepathically while bonded.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The rafflesian makes three Vine Whip attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Blood Root.

action.name: Vine Whip
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 3d8 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Blood Root
entries: The rafflesian launches a root toward one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The creature must succeed on a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or take 14 ({@damage 4d6}) necrotic damage as the rafflesian drains blood from it. The rafflesian or the host (the rafflesian's choice) then regains hp equal to the damage taken.

reaction.name: Last Resort
entries: When the host dies, the rafflesian can reanimate it for up to 10 days, provided the host's body is still intact. During this time, the host is protected from decay and can't become undead. The rafflesian can use a bonus action to cause the host to move as it could in life, but the host can't take any other actions. If the host could speak in life, the rafflesian can speak with the host's voice. A host body reanimated in this way can be restored to life by any spell capable of doing so.

vulnerable.note: from magic weapons wielded by good creatures

trait.name: Arcane Weapons
entries: The myrmidon's weapon attacks are magical. When the myrmidon hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@damage 2d4} force damage (included in the attack).

trait.name: Dedicated Warrior
entries: The myrmidon has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} and {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Limited Magic Immunity
entries: The myrmidon can't be affected or detected by spells of 1st level or lower unless it wishes to be. It has advantage on saving throws against all other spells and magical effects.

trait.name: Tiger Tag Team
entries: The myrmidon has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one friendly rakshasa is within 5 feet of the creature and that rakshasa isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The myrmidon rakshasa makes two Forked Scimitar or Arcane Bolt attacks.

action.name: Forked Scimitar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) slashing damage plus 5 ({@damage 2d4}) force damage. Instead of dealing damage, the myrmidon can disarm a target wielding a weapon. The target must succeed on a {@dc 12} Strength saving throw or its weapon lands in a random space within 10 feet of the target.

action.name: Arcane Bolt
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 4} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 4d4 + 2}) force damage.

reaction.name: Allied Parry
entries: When a creature the myrmidon can see attacks a creature within 5 feet of it, the myrmidon can impose disadvantage on the attack roll. To do so, the myrmidon must be wielding a shield.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The myrmidon casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 12}):

vulnerable.note: from magic weapons wielded by good creatures

trait.name: False Appearance (Object Form Only)
entries: While the pustakam remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary object.

trait.name: Limited Magic Immunity
entries: The pustakam can't be affected or detected by spells of 2nd level or lower unless it wishes to be. It has advantage on saving throws against all other spells and magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The pustakam makes two Claw attacks or uses False Promises twice. It can replace one use of False Promises with a use of Spellcasting.

action.name: Claw (Fiend Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) slashing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) psychic damage.

action.name: False Promises
entries: The pustakam whispers promises of power and riches in the mind of one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must make a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 18 ({@damage 4d8}) psychic damage and is {@condition charmed} for 1 minute. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn't {@condition charmed}. While {@condition charmed}, a creature has disadvantage on saving throws against the pustakam's enchantment spells. A {@condition charmed} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

bonus.name: Change Shape
entries: The pustakam transforms into a Tiny object or back into its true form, which is a fiend. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The pustakam casts one of the following spells, requiring no material or somatic components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 15}):

vulnerable.note: from magic weapons wielded by good creatures

trait.name: Limited Magic Immunity
entries: The servitor can't be affected or detected by cantrips unless it wishes to be. It has advantage on saving throws against all other spells and magical effects.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Hand Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Protecting Pounce
entries: When a rakshasa the servitor can see within 15 feet of it is the target of an attack, the servitor can move up to half its speed toward that rakshasa without provoking {@action opportunity attack||opportunity attacks}. If it ends this movement within 5 feet of the rakshasa, the servitor becomes the target of the attack instead.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The servitor casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 11}):

reaction.name: Proteting Pounce
entries: When a rakshasa the servitor can see within 15 feet of it is the target of an attack, the servitor can move up to half its speed toward that rakshasa without provoking {@action opportunity attack||opportunity attacks}. If it ends this movement within 5 feet of the rakshasa, the servitor becomes the target of the attack instead.

vulnerable.note: from magic weapons wielded by good creatures

trait.name: Limited Magic Immunity
entries: The slayer can't be affected or detected by spells of 4th level or lower unless it wishes to be. It has advantage on saving throws against all other spells and magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The slayer makes three Rapier or Light Crossbow attacks.

action.name: Rapier
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Light Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 9} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} until the end of its next turn.

bonus.name: Cunning Action
entries: The slayer takes the {@action Dash}, {@action Disengage}, or {@action Hide} action.

bonus.name: Gain the Upper Hand
entries: The slayer studies one creature it can see within 30 feet of it, granting the slayer advantage on the next attack roll it makes against the target before the start of the slayer's next turn. If the attack hits, the slayer's weapon attack deals an extra 9 ({@damage 2d8}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Shadow Leap
entries: When a creature moves into a space within 5 feet of the slayer while the slayer is in dim light or darkness, the slayer can teleport to an unoccupied space it can see within 30 feet of it. The destination must also be in dim light or darkness.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The slayer casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 16}):

trait.name: Good Dog
entries: If a Humanoid that hasn't harmed the relentless hound in the last 24 hours takes an action to offer the hound a morsel of food or speak kind words to it, the hound must succeed on a {@dc 12} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} by that Humanoid for 1 hour or until the Humanoid or its companions do anything harmful to the hound. In addition, the relentless hound has disadvantage on saving throws against the {@spell command} spell.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The relentless hound can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The relentless hound has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the hound's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Undead Nature
entries: The relentless hound doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The relentless hound makes two Spectral Bite attacks. If both attacks hit the same target, the target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or take 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage and its hp maximum is reduced by that amount. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hp maximum to 0.

action.name: Spectral Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) necrotic damage.

reaction.name: Multiply (3/Day)
entries: When the relentless hound takes damage while below half its hp maximum, it creates a spectral hound. The spectral hound uses the statistics of a shadow, except it doesn't have the Sunlight Weakness trait and it can't make new shadows when it kills Humanoids. It appears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the relentless hound and acts on the same initiative as that hound. After the spectral hound finishes a long rest, it becomes a relentless hound.

trait.name: Elusive
entries: The rochade has advantage on saving throws and ability checks made to avoid or escape an effect that would reduce its speed. In addition, nonmagical difficult terrain composed of natural rocks or cavernous terrain doesn't cost it extra movement.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the rochade has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) rolls that rely on sight.

action.name: Thieving Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage. Instead of dealing damage, the rochade can steal one item the target is wearing or carrying, provided the item weighs no more than 10 pounds, isn't a weapon, and isn't wrapped around or firmly attached to the target. For example, a rochade could steal a hat or belt pouch but not a creature's shirt or armor.

action.name: Rock
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 20/60 ft, one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

bonus.name: Relay
entries: The rochade teleports one object it is holding that weighs no more than 10 pounds into the empty hand of one friendly creature it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target isn't a rochade, it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw to catch the object, otherwise the object falls to the ground in a space within 5 feet of the target.

bonus.name: Short Step
entries: The rochade teleports to an unoccupied space it can see within 15 feet of it.

reaction.name: Switch
entries: When a creature the rochade can see targets it with an attack, the rochade can switch places with any creature it can see within 15 feet of it. An unwilling creature must succeed on a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw to avoid the switch. If the switch is successful, the switched creature becomes the target of the attack instead.

trait.name: Earth Glide
entries: The rock salamander can burrow through nonmagical, unworked earth and stone. While doing so, the salamander doesn't disturb the material it moves through.

trait.name: Stone Camouflage
entries: The rock salamander has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to hide in rocky terrain.

trait.name: Stone Spider Climb
entries: The rock salamander can climb difficult stone surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Manipulate Stone
entries: If the rock salamander is touching stone, it can manipulate stone contiguous with its location to create one of the following effects:

items.name: Rumbling Earth.
items.entry: One creature touching stone within 10 feet of the salamander must succeed on a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

items.name: Softened Earth.
items.entry: One creature touching stone within 10 feet of the salamander must succeed on a {@dc 12} Strength saving throw or be {@condition restrained} by softened, mud-like stone until the end of its next turn.

items.name: Stone Armor.
items.entry: The salamander's AC increases by 2 until the start of its next turn.

variant.name: Rock Salamander Familiars
entries: Some rock salamanders are willing to serve a spellcaster as a familiar. Such salamanders have the following trait.

entries.name: Familiar
entries: The rock salamander can serve another creature as a familiar, forming a magic, telepathic bond with that willing companion. While the two are bonded, the companion can sense what the salamander senses as long as they are within 1 mile of each other. While the salamander is within 10 feet of its companion, the companion shares the salamander's Stone Camouflage trait. At any time and for any reason, the salamander can end its service as a familiar, ending the telepathic bond.

items.name: Familiar
entries: The rock salamander can serve another creature as a familiar, forming a magic, telepathic bond with that willing companion. While the two are bonded, the companion can sense what the salamander senses as long as they are within 1 mile of each other. While the salamander is within 10 feet of its companion, the companion shares the salamander's Stone Camouflage trait. At any time and for any reason, the salamander can end its service as a familiar, ending the telepathic bond.

trait.name: Earth Glide
entries: The rockwood can burrow through nonmagical, unworked earth and stone. While doing so, the rockwood doesn't disturb the material it moves through.

trait.name: Elemental Nature
entries: The rockwood doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Persistence of Stone (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: When the rockwood is reduced to below half its hp maximum, Fossil Barrage recharges.

trait.name: Roiling Roots
entries: The stony roots of the rockwood make the ground within 15 feet of the rockwood difficult terrain for creatures other than the rockwood.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The rockwood deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Towering Reach
entries: The rockwood doesn't have disadvantage on ranged attack rolls from being within 5 feet of a hostile creature, though it may still have disadvantage from other sources.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The rockwood makes two Whomping Slam or Rock attacks. If both Whomping Slam attacks hit one target, each creature within 5 feet of the target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or take 9 ({@damage 2d8}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Whomping Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 3d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage, and if the target is a Large or smaller creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Rock
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit, range 60/180 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d10 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Fossil Barrage {@recharge 6}
entries: The rockwood sprays shards of stone in a 30-foot cone. feet around it Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 28 ({@damage 8d6}) piercing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The savior lumen swarm can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Fleeting Memory
entries: When the savior lumen swarm leaves a creature's sight, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or remember the swarm only as softly glowing lights.

trait.name: Illumination
entries: The savior lumen swarm sheds bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet.

trait.name: Immortal Nature
entries: The savior lumen swarm doesn't require food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The swarm has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The savior lumen can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny celestial. The swarm can't regain hp or gain temporary hp.

trait.name: Team Effort
entries: The savior lumen swarm is considered to be a single Large creature for the purpose of determining its carrying capacity, and it has advantage on Strength checks made to push, pull, lift, or break objects.

action.name: Flurry of Tools
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 0 ft., one target in the swarm's space. {@h}10 ({@damage 4d4}) bludgeoning damage plus 10 ({@damage 4d4}) piercing damage and 10 ({@damage 4d4}) slashing damage, or 5 ({@damage 2d4}) bludgeoning damage plus 5 ({@damage 2d4}) piercing damage and 4 ({@damage 2d4}) slashing damage if the swarm has half of its hp or fewer.

action.name: Dismantle
entries: The savior lumen swarm destroys up to a 5-foot cube of nonmagical debris, structure, or object that isn't being worn or carried.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The savior lumen swarm casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 14}):

trait.name: Blizzard Heart
entries: Nearby weather responds to the sazakan's desires. At the start of each hour, the sazakan can choose to change the precipitation and temperature within 1 mile of it by one stage, up or down (no action required). This effect works like the changing weather conditions aspect of the {@spell control weather} spell, except the sazakan can't change the wind, the conditions change immediately, and the sazakan can never make it warm, hot, or unbearable heat.

trait.name: Icy Nature
entries: The sazakan is infused with elemental power, and it requires only half the amount of air, food, and drink that a Humanoid of its size needs.

trait.name: Wintry Aura
entries: At the start of each of the sazakan's turns, each creature within 5 feet of it takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) cold damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The sazakan makes three Icy Wind Lash attacks.

action.name: Icy Wind Lash
entries: {@atk ms,rs} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) cold damage. If the sazakan scores a critical hit, the target is {@condition restrained} by ice until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Ice Whirlwind {@recharge 5}
entries: The sazakan surrounds itself in icy wind. Each creature within 10 feet of the sazakan must make a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 28 ({@damage 8d6}) cold damage, and is pushed up to 15 feet away from the sazakan and knocked {@condition prone}. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn't pushed or knocked {@condition prone}. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the creature is also {@condition restrained} as its limbs become encased in ice. A creature, including the encased creature, can break the encased creature free by succeeding on a {@dc 15} Strength check. The encased creature is also freed if it takes fire damage.

trait.name: Flesh-Eating Aura
entries: When a creature that doesn't have all of its hp starts its turn within 10 feet of the scarab, the creature takes 2 ({@damage 1d4}) necrotic damage. In addition, any magical healing within 10 feet of the scarab is halved.
