Some breakwater trolls have even been observed helping those shipwrecked during a storm, though they are as likely to attack shipwrecked victims as aid them.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The troll can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The troll has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Psychoactive Sweat
entries: Any creature that starts its turn within 5 feet of the troll must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The troll regains 10 hp at the start of its turn. If the troll takes acid or fire damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the troll's next turn. The troll dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hp and doesn't regenerate.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The troll makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks. It can replace its Bite attack with a Sticky Tongue attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d4 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Sticky Tongue
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be pulled up to 15 feet toward the troll.
A hunched figure climbs out of the ditch and creeps slowly down the street. It has a toad-like face, drab leathery skin covered in warts, and webbed feet. Its hands end in long, razor-sharp claws.

Standing just over six feet tall, gutter trolls are smaller, toad-like cousins of the common {@creature troll}. They make their homes in sewer tunnels beneath cities or under city bridges, creeping out at night to prey on the local population.

entries.name: Fey Origins
entries: The first gutter troll is said to have spawned from a {@creature troll} slain in battle with the {@creature Toad King|ToB2}, one of the fey animal lords. The troll took a big bite out of the {@creature Toad King|ToB2} before the animal lord and his servants took it down. The fey-touched flesh the {@creature troll} had swallowed changed when it regenerated, and it returned to life as a toad-like, wart-covered gutter troll. Like {@creature frog||frogs} and toads, gutter trolls cannot attack the {@creature Toad King|ToB2} if they encounter him, unless magically compelled.

entries.name: City Dwellers
entries: Although gutter trolls can still sometimes be found dwelling in swamps and bogs or near riverside villages, they are most common in cities and towns where they can find more plentiful food. Cowards at heart, the trolls avoid drawing unwanted attention from city authorities by hunting their prey in the worst parts of town, where beggars and street urchins regularly go missing.

entries.name: Sticky Tongues and Psychoactive Sweat
entries: Gutter trolls are stealthy hunters, emerging from ditches or sewers, grabbing victims with their long sticky tongues, and dragging their prey down into their lairs. Their warty skin secretes sweat with psychoactive properties, which weaken the victim's ability to fight back.

trait.name: Distracting Rattle
entries: The troll's shell plates rattle constantly, creating a droning, distracting noise. When a creature casts a spell with a verbal component while within 30 feet of the troll, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or lose the spell.

trait.name: Night Hunters
entries: While in dim light or darkness, the rattleback trolls has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The troll regains 10 hp at the start of its turn. If the troll takes fire damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the troll's next turn. The troll dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hp and doesn't regenerate.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The troll makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. While {@condition poisoned} this way, the target can't regain hp. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Venom Spray {@recharge 5}
entries: The troll sprays its venom in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 28 ({@damage 8d6}) poison damage and is {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn't {@condition poisoned}. While {@condition poisoned} in this way, a creature can't regain hp. A {@condition poisoned} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

The sound of rattling echoes around a boulder as a creature rises behind it. Black diamond shapes decorate its scales. The creature's underbelly is yellow, its claws are black as coal, and its mouth opens to reveal two long fangs and a forked tongue—but it walks on two legs.

Rattleback trolls are a terror of the badlands where they live and hunt. They are primarily nocturnal and sleep away the days in rocky holes or small caves. Humanoids living near a rattleback troll's lair often leave slain game as tribute at the entrance while it sleeps, in hopes that it will not go hunting too close to their village that evening.

entries.name: Venomous Killers
entries: The rattleback troll's bite injects a debilitating venom that rots the flesh around the wound, preventing natural healing. When surrounded or attacked by multiple creatures, the troll expels a gout of this poison to drive off its attackers. Fortunately, the rattleback troll rarely enters a fray without shaking itself into a frenzy first, and the shell plates on its back give off a warning rattle before it strikes.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The tumor troll regains 10 hp at the start of its turn. If the troll takes acid or fire damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the troll's next turn. The troll dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hp and doesn't regenerate.

trait.name: Uncontrolled Growth
entries: When the tumor troll regains hp from its Regeneration trait, it gains a random teratoma from the Teratoma Chart. The teratoma and its effects last until the teratoma is removed or replaced by another teratoma. The troll can have only three teratomas at any given time. If it would gain a fourth, the oldest teratoma fades and is replaced with the new teratoma.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The tumor troll makes two Bite attacks and two Claw attacks. It can replace one Claw attack with a Fling Limb attack. When it does, the tumor troll doesn't have disadvantage on this attack roll from being within 5 feet of a creature, though it can have disadvantage from other sources.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Fling Limb
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d4 + 4}) bludgeoning damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage. Remove one teratoma from the tumor troll. The tumor troll can't use this action if it doesn't have a teratoma.

footer.caption: Teratoma Chart
rows: {@b New Senses.} A bevy of new ears and noses give the troll advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing or smell.
{@b Many Feet.} The troll can't be knocked {@condition prone}.
{@b Adrenal Overdrive.} The troll can't be {@condition frightened}, and it doesn't suffer from {@condition exhaustion}.

{@b Clinging Limbs.} When this teratoma is removed with the Fling Limb action, it attaches to the target. While it is attached to the target, the target takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage at the start of each of its turns. A creature, including the target, can use its action to detach the teratoma.
{@b Echo Chambers.} The troll has {@sense blindsight} out to a range of 60 feet.
{@b New Pain Nerves.} The troll has disadvantage on any roll that is not an attack roll.

entries: Bulging, swollen flesh and vestigial limbs, teeth, and heads emerge from this creature without rhyme or reason. It rears back, screaming at the sky.

A tumor troll is a {@creature troll} that has developed a horrifying disease. The disease poisons the troll's blood and disrupts its regeneration, causing it to respond to even shed skin by generating new limbs and flesh. The result is a creature covered in teratomas and trapped in a cycle of endless pain. Tumor trolls are more aggressive than most trolls, as feeding is one of the few things that lessens their pain.

entries.name: Reviled by Trolls
entries: To other {@creature troll||trolls}, a tumor troll represents one of the worst fates imaginable. Most {@creature troll} tribes will have nothing to do with their misshapen brethren, while others throw them into funeral bonfires or drop them into deep pits, as acts of mercy.

entries.name: Accidental Creation
entries: Though tumor trolls occur naturally, magical experiments on {@creature troll||trolls} occasionally result in a tumor troll. If the experimenter survives, they might leash the troll to guard some section of their lair, as the creatures are easier to manage than troll mercenaries.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The trollkin gains 3 hp at the start of its turn. If the trollkin takes acid or fire damage, this ability doesn't function at the start of the trollkin's next turn. The trollkin dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hp and doesn't regenerate.

trait.name: Thick Skin
entries: The trollkin's skin is thick and tough, granting it a +1 bonus to Armor Class. This bonus is already factored into the trollkin's AC.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The fire shaman uses Mark Foe. It then makes two Hurl Flame attacks or three Staff attacks.

action.name: Staff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage, or 4 ({@damage 1d8}) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Hurl Flame
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 5} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) fire damage.

action.name: Mark Foe
entries: One creature the shaman can see within 60 feet must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or be wreathed in magical fire for 1 minute. While wreathed, it can't take the {@action Hide} action or become {@condition invisible}. The next time the creature takes damage, it takes an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage, and the magical fire ends.

reaction.name: Fiery Escape (2/Day)
entries: When the shaman takes damage, each creature within 5 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw or take 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage. The shaman is then wreathed in flames and teleports up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

The wizened trollkin, wearing thick robes and religious trinkets, raises its staff to the sky, fire coalescing around its hands. The ironclad trollkin beside it roars, hefts a large sword, and charges with the shaman's fire flying beside it.

The resilient desert trollkin make their homes in badlands and deserts. To most outsiders, theirs is a harsh culture, but to the trollkin, their unforgiving home demands strength, cunning, and hardiness.

entries.name: Fire Shamans
entries: Trollkin fire shamans are respected and feared among their people. They harness the fiery power of the desert sun, and they can incinerate anyone who dares to oppose them.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The trollkin gains 5 hp at the start of its turn. If the trollkin takes acid or fire damage, this ability doesn't function at the start of the trollkin's next turn. The trollkin dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hp and doesn't regenerate.

trait.name: Thick Skin
entries: The trollkin's skin is thick and tough, granting it a +1 bonus to Armor Class. This bonus is already factored into the trollkin's AC.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The ironmonger makes one Greatsword attack and two Slam attacks, or it makes three Throwing Axe attacks.

action.name: Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Throwing Axe
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/60 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

reaction.name: Impregnable Counter
entries: When a creature within 5 feet of the ironmonger misses a melee attack against it, the attacker must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

The wizened trollkin, wearing thick robes and religious trinkets, raises its staff to the sky, fire coalescing around its hands. The ironclad trollkin beside it roars, hefts a large sword, and charges with the shaman's fire flying beside it.

The resilient desert trollkin make their homes in badlands and deserts. To most outsiders, theirs is a harsh culture, but to the trollkin, their unforgiving home demands strength, cunning, and hardiness.

entries.name: Ironmongers
entries: Ironmongers are veteran trollkin armor and weaponsmiths clad in their creations. They act as vanguards for the desert trollkin.

trait.name: Brutal Claws
entries: A trollkin ragecaster's claw deals one extra die of its damage when the trollkin isn't ragecasting (included in the attack).

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The ragecaster has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects when it isn't ragecasting.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The trollkin ragecaster regains 10 hp at the start of its turn. If the tagecaster takes acid or fire damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the ragecaster's next turn. The ragecaster dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hp and doesn't regenerate.

trait.name: Thick Hide
entries: The trollkin ragecasters skin is thick and tough, granting it a +1 bonus to Armor Class. This bonus is already factored into the trollkin's AC.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The trollkin ragecaster makes two Claw attacks or two Elemental Blast attacks.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 3d8 + 3}) slashing damage when not ragecasting, or 12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) slashing damage while ragecasting.

action.name: Elemental Blast (Ragecasting Only)
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 7} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 3d6 + 4}) cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage (the trollkin's choice).

bonus.name: Ragecasting (3/Day)
entries: The trollkin ragecaster enters a special rage that allows it to channel the power of the elements for 1 minute. While ragecasting, the trollkin has disadvantage on Wisdom saving throws and gains a flying speed of 60 feet. The trollkin can end ragecasting as a bonus action. When the ragecasting ends, the trollkin descends 60 feet per round until it lands on a solid surface, and it can continue concentrating on a spell it cast while ragecasting.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting (Ragecasting Only)
headerEntries: The trollkin ragecaster casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 15}):

monster.name: Truant Devourer
languages: Common plus up to three other languages

trait.name: Heretic Sense
entries: The truant devourer can pinpoint the location of heretics of its faith within 60 feet of it and can sense the general direction of such creatures within 1 mile of it.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The truant devourer has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Turn Resistance
entries: The truant devourer has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead.

trait.name: Undead Nature
entries: The truant devourer doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The truant devourer makes three Devourer's Cleaver or Necrotic Bolt attacks. It can replace one attack with a Life Drain attack.

action.name: Devourer's Cleaver
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) slashing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Life Drain
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}17 ({@damage 3d8 + 4}) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or its hp maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hp maximum to 0.

action.name: Necrotic Bolt
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 8} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 3d8 + 4}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Invisibility
entries: The truant devourer magically turns {@condition invisible} until it attacks or uses Grasping Claws, or until its concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment it wears or carries is {@condition invisible} with it.

action.name: Grasping Claws {@recharge 5}
entries: The truant devourer calls dozens of ghostly, skeletal claws to erupt from a point on the ground it can see within 60 feet of it. Each creature within 15 feet of that point must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 31 ({@damage 7d8}) necrotic damage and is {@condition restrained} for 1 minute. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn't {@condition restrained}. A {@condition restrained} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

bonus.name: Dusty Step
entries: The truant devourer teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see. A cloud of dust appears at the origin and destination when it uses this bonus action.

trait.name: Deep Roots
entries: The tuberkith has advantage on Strength and Dexterity saving throws made against effects that would move it against its will along the ground.

trait.name: Dozens of Eyes
entries: The tuberkith has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight and on saving throws against being {@condition blinded}. In addition, if the tuberkith isn't {@condition blinded}, creatures attacking it can't benefit from traits and features that rely on a creature's allies distracting or surrounding the tuberkith, such as the Pack Tactics trait or Sneak Attack feature.

action.name: Peeler
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: Masher
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 12} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the umbral shambler has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Tenebrous Agility
entries: The umbral shambler's speed is doubled while in dim light or darkness, and it doesn't provoke {@action opportunity attack||opportunity attacks} when it moves, provided it moves only in dim light or darkness. In addition, when a creature that relies on sight attacks the umbral shambler while the shambler is in dim light or darkness, the attacker has disadvantage on the attack roll.

trait.name: Void Traveler
entries: The umbral shambler doesn't require air, food, drink, sleep, or ambient pressure.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The umbral shambler makes two Claws attacks.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) slashing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Twisted Step
entries: The umbral shambler can project itself beyond reality for a short time. Until the start of its next turn, the shambler can move through objects as if they were difficult terrain, provided an object is no more than 3 feet thick and at least one side of the object is in dim light or darkness. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it starts its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Passage Guardian
entries: The underworld sentinel can make an {@action opportunity attack} when a hostile creature moves within its reach as well as when a hostile creature moves out of its reach. It gets one extra reaction that be used only for {@action opportunity attack||opportunity attacks}.

trait.name: Turn Immunity
entries: The underworld sentinel is immune to effects that turn undead.

trait.name: Undead Nature
entries: The underworld sentinel doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The sentinel makes two Scythe or Death Knell attacks.

action.name: Scythe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d10 + 6}) slashing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Death Knell
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 7} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 3d8 + 3}) necrotic damage, or 22 ({@damage 3d12 + 3}) necrotic damage if the target is missing any of its hit points.

action.name: Grim Reaping {@recharge 5}
entries: The underworld sentinel spins with its scythe extended and makes one Scythe attack against each creature within its reach. A creature that takes necrotic damage from this attack can't regain hp until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Jungle Camouflage
entries: The constrictor has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to hide in jungle terrain.

trait.name: Poisonous Leaves
entries: The skin of the constrictor is embedded with vines and poisonous leaves that burn on contact. A creature that isn't a Construct or Undead that touches the constrictor or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage.

trait.name: Urushi Blight
entries: A creature infected with this disease manifests symptoms within {@dice 1d4} hours, which includes the gradual spread of a painful, itching rash that develops into inflamed and blistered skin over the course of the first day. Until the disease is cured, the infected creature has disadvantage on Constitution saving throws made to maintain concentration on a spell, and it has disadvantage on Dexterity and Charisma saving throws and ability checks. At the end of each long rest, the infected creature must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw. If it succeeds on two saving throws, it recovers from the disease.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The constrictor makes two Bite attacks or one Bite attack and one Poisonous Constriction attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d10 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Poisonous Constriction
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained} and takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) poison damage at the start of each of its turns, and the snake can't use Poisonous Constriction on another target. Each time the target takes this poison damage, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or contract the urushi blight disease (see the Urushi Blight trait).

monster.name: Vampiric Vanguard
languages: the languages it knew in life

trait.name: Bloodthirsty
entries: When the vampiric vanguard is below half its hp maximum, it has advantage on all melee attack rolls against creatures that aren't Constructs or Undead.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The vampire can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Undead Nature
entries: The vampiric vanguard doesn't require air.

trait.name: Vampire Weaknesses
entries: The vampire has the following flaws:
Forbiddance. The vampire can't enter a residence without an invitation from one of the occupants.
Harmed by Running Water. The vampire takes 20 acid damage when it ends its turn in running water.
Stake to the Heart. The vampire is destroyed if a piercing weapon made of wood is driven into its heart while it is {@condition incapacitated} in its resting place.
Sunlight Hypersensitivity. The vampire takes 20 radiant damage when it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The vampire vanguard makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks. If the vanguard hits one target with both Claw attacks, the target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or take 7 ({@damage 2d6}) slashing damage, and the vampire regains hp equal to that amount.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage. The target's hp maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken, and the vampire regains hp equal to that amount. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hp maximum to 0.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

bonus.name: Fleet of Foot
entries: The vampire takes the {@action Dash} action.

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks not made with cold iron weapons

trait.name: Fortissimo Fibber
entries: The veritigibbet can't be magically silenced or forced to tell the truth by any means, and it knows if it hears a lie.

trait.name: Ventriloquist
entries: The veritigibbet can make its voice sound as though it originates from any point it can see within 60 feet of it.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The veritigibbet makes two Repartee attacks.

action.name: Repartee
entries: {@atk ms,rs} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 3d6 + 4}) psychic damage.

action.name: Blather
entries: The veritigibbet asks a question of a creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must make a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the target must either answer the question truthfully and completely or have disadvantage on all attack rolls, saving throws, and ability checks for the next 1 hour, cumulatively increasing in duration each time the target fails the saving throw and chooses to take disadvantage. If the target chooses to answer the question, it can't dissemble or omit information relevant to the question being answered. On a success, the veritigibbet takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) psychic damage. Creatures that are immune to being {@condition charmed} aren't affected by this action.

action.name: Veiled Escape (1/Day)
entries: The veritigibbet teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space it can see, becoming {@condition invisible} when it arrives at the destination.

reaction.name: Liar, Liar
entries: When a creature lies while within 30 feet of the veritigibbet, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw or take 3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage and it ignites. Until a creature takes an action to douse the fire, the target takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

monster.name: Void Constructor
languages: understands Void Speech but can't speak

trait.name: Mobile Grappler
entries: While grappling a creature, the constructor can move at its full speed, carrying the {@condition grappled} creature along with it.

trait.name: Tainted Aura
entries: A Void constructor that has completed a Void henge gains necrotic energy while within 1 mile of the henge. At the start of each of the Void constructor's turns, each creature within 10 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Charisma saving throw or take 2 ({@damage 1d4}) necrotic damage. The Void constructor can choose for a creature it is grappling to be immune to the Tainted Auras of all Void constructors.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Void constructor makes two Slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Tentacles
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 4d4 + 3}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 13}). Until this grapple ends, the constructor can't use its tentacles on another target.

trait.name: Call of the Void
entries: If a creature within 5 feet of the Void knight attempts to move away from it, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be unable to move away from the Void knight. If the creature uses magic to move, such as the misty step or freedom of movement spells, it automatically succeeds on this saving throw.

trait.name: Construct Nature
entries: The void knight doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Immoveable
entries: The Void knight can't be moved against its will, except by magical means. In addition, the knight has disadvantage on Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) and Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks.

trait.name: Implosive End
entries: When the Void knight dies, it collapses in on itself, releasing a wave of Void energy. Creature within 5 feet of it must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw, taking 18 ({@damage 4d8}) force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Void knight makes two Void Gauntlet attacks or three Void Bolt attacks.

action.name: Void Gauntlet
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) slashing damage plus 18 ({@damage 4d8}) force damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Void Bolt
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 7} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 4d8 + 3}) force damage.

action.name: Pull of the Void {@recharge 5}
entries: The Void knight sends Void tendrils at up to three creatures it can see within 60 feet of it that are not behind total cover. Each target must succeed on a {@dc 16} strength Saving throw or be pulled up to 30 feet toward the knight. Then each creature within 5 feet of the Void knight takes 36 ({@damage 8d8}) force damage.

trait.name: Lava Bound
entries: The vorthropod can exist outside of lava or magma for up to 4 hours each day. If it starts its turn outside of lava and didn't take fire damage since the end of its previous turn, its shell begins to cool and harden. While its shell is hardened, it has a walking speed of 20 feet, an Armor Class of 18, and vulnerability to bludgeoning damage. If it starts its turn in lava or if it took fire damage since the end of its previous turn, its shell becomes molten again. If the vorthropod remains outside of lava for more than 4 hours, its shell becomes {@condition petrified}, transforming into basalt, and the vorthropod within goes into hibernation. Its body returns to normal if it is submerged in lava or magma for 1 round. It can stay {@condition petrified} in hibernation for up to {@dice 1d100 + 10} years, after which it dies.

trait.name: Lava Camouflage
entries: The vorthropod has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to hide in lava and volcanic terrain.

trait.name: Molten Shell
entries: If the vorthropod's shell isn't hardened, a creature that touches the vorthropod or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The vorthropod makes two Claw attacks.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) bludgeoning damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Molten Tail Slap {@recharge 4}
entries: The vorthropod unfurls its tail and slaps it down, showering the area with searing sparks and superheated rock. Each creature within 15 feet of it must make a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw, taking 28 ({@damage 8d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Bloodthirsty Pounce
entries: If the wakwak moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a Talon attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the wakwak can make one Beak attack against it as a bonus action, gaining temporary hp equal to half the damage dealt.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The wakwak has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The wakwak has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the wakwak's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The wakwak makes one Beak attack and one Talon attack.

action.name: Beak
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Talon
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Wing Slap {@recharge 5}
entries: The wakwak slams its sharp-edged wings together in front of itself in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) slashing damage and is pushed up to 10 feet away from the wakwak and knocked {@condition prone}. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn't pushed or knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Acidic Fog
entries: A creature that starts its turn in the wandering haze's space takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) acid damage.

trait.name: Cloud Form
entries: The wandering haze can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing, and the haze can enter a hostile creature's space and vice versa. The wandering haze's space is heavily obscured.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the wandering haze remains motionless, or floats on air currents, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary cloud or fog bank.

trait.name: Ooze Nature
entries: The wandering haze doesn't require sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The wandering haze makes three Pseudopod attacks.

action.name: Pseudopod
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d4 + 6}) bludgeoning damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) acid damage.

action.name: Sheath of Chaos
entries: The wandering haze wraps its cloudy form tighter around those within it. Each creature in the wandering haze's space must make a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 27 ({@damage 6d8}) psychic damage and is disoriented until the end of its next turn as its mind fills with the gibbering terrors of the chaos that created the wandering haze's form. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn't disoriented. When a disoriented creature moves, it moves in a random direction.

action.name: Acidic Cloudburst {@recharge 5}
entries: The wandering haze releases a deluge of acid. Each creature within 10 feet of it must make a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 35 ({@damage 10d6}) acid damage and its speed is halved for 1 minute. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and its speed isn't reduced. A creature with halved speed can make a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: The waterkledde can hold its breath for 15 minutes.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The waterkledde makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks. If it hits one Medium or smaller creature with both Claw attacks, the waterkledde latches onto the creature with its Beak, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, the waterkledde can automatically hit the target with its Beak, and the waterkledde can't make Beak attacks against other targets.

action.name: Beak
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Frightening Call {@recharge 5}
entries: The waterkledde screeches "Kludde! Kledde! Kleure!" in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 22 ({@damage 5d8}) psychic damage and is {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn't {@condition frightened}. A {@condition frightened} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

bonus.name: Change Shape
entries: The waterkledde magically transforms into a Small or Medium Beast, or back into its true, fiendish form. Without wings, it loses its flying speed. Its statistics, other than its size and speed, are the same in each form. No matter the form, its eyes are always an unnatural green. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

bonus.name: Supernatural Speed
entries: The waterkledde takes the {@action Dash} or {@action Disengage} action.

trait.name: Blazing Maelstrom Form
entries: The wild sirocco can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing. A creature that touches the sirocco or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage. In addition, the sirocco can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. The first time it enters a creature's space on a turn, that creature takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage and must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Elemental Nature
entries: The wild sirocco doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Water Susceptibility
entries: For every 5 feet the wild sirocco moves in water, or for every gallon of water splashed on it, it takes 1 cold damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The wild sirocco makes two Fiery Wallop attacks.

action.name: Fiery Wallop
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Scorching Winds {@recharge 5}
entries: The wild sirocco whips up scorching winds around it in a blaze. Each creature within 10 feet of the wild sirocco must make a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) fire damage, ignites, and is thrown up to 20 feet in a random direction and knocked {@condition prone}. If a thrown creature strikes a solid surface, the creature takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet it was thrown. If it is thrown at another creature, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or take the same damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. Until a creature takes an action to douse the fire, an ignited creature takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

trait.name: Beast Passivism
entries: No beast with an Intelligence of 3 or less can willingly attack the crone. They can be forced to do so through magical means.

trait.name: Speak with Beasts and Plants
entries: The crone can communicate with Beasts and Plants as if they shared a language.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The wilderness crone makes three Staff attacks.

action.name: Wild Staff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) force damage.

action.name: Needle Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The crone exhales pine needles in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in the area must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 28 ({@damage 8d6}) piercing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

reaction.name: Transmigratory Strike
entries: When the crone kills a Humanoid, she can immediately restore it to life as a {@filter Beast|bestiary|type=beast} with a challenge rating no higher the Humanoid's CR or level. This reaction otherwise works like the {@spell reincarnate} spell.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The crone casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 15}):

variant.name: Wilderness Crone Variants
entries: Wilderness crones vary, depending on their home. To create a wilderness crone of a specific environment, use the statistics presented here, except as described below. Their CR is unchanged.

entries.name: Arctic
entries: Often called "snow crones," crones of the boreal forests have icy skin and resistance to cold damage. A snow crone's Needle Breath is a barrage of ice shards that deals both cold and piercing damage.

entries.name: Underground
entries: Dubbed "stone crones," crones tending fungal forests underground have stony skin and resistance to poison damage. A stone crone's Needle Breath is a cloud of spores that deals poison damage.

entries.name: Volcanic
entries: Known as "cinder crones," crones seeding the soil of volcanic regions have red and orange skin and resistance to fire damage. A cinder crone's Needle Breath is a roar of flames that deals fire damage.
An elderly woman with gnarled, bark-like skin and a cloak of pine branches stands beneath the boughs at the forest's edge.
Wilderness crones are not hags or evil, but they are often mistaken for both. They are protective of their forests, but if approached respectfully, they can be amicable and welcoming.

entries.name: Wisdom of the Woods
entries: Many seek wilderness crones for their knowledge and magic, but crones have no use for gold. They share their knowledge or power only after petitioners complete a task to protect or expand the forest.

entries.name: Solitary and Reclusive
entries: Wilderness crones live alone in remote forests. While they befriend beasts and plants and tolerate most fey, they are highly suspicious of intruders. They frighten away woodcutters, hunters, or others they believe will harm their home and its inhabitants. If intruders don't flee, the crones resort to direct confrontation.

entries.name: Wild Crones
entries: Wilderness crones mirror their environments, leading to variations. The most common wilderness crone inhabits temperate forests and is known as a "pine crone."
An elderly woman with gnarled, bark-like skin and a cloak of pine branches stands beneath the boughs at the forest's edge.

They frighten away woodcutters, hunters, or others they believe will harm their home and its inhabitants. If intruders don't flee, the crones resort to direct confrontation.

entries.name: Solitary and Reclusive
entries: Wilderness crones live alone in remote forests. While they befriend beasts and plants and tolerate most fey, they are highly suspicious of intruders. They frighten away woodcutters, hunters, or others they believe will harm their home and its inhabitants. If intruders don't flee, the crones resort to direct confrontation.

entries.name: Wild Crones
entries: Wilderness crones mirror their environments, leading to variations. The most common wilderness crone inhabits temperate forests and is known as a "pine crone."

trait.name: Cursed Plant
entries: If damage reduces the wind witch to 0 hp, it becomes an inanimate tumbleweed and travels with the wind. It regains 5 hp every hour, regaining consciousness after the first. This trait doesn't function if the wind witch took fire damage on the same round it was reduced to 0 hp or if its body was destroyed.

trait.name: Flammable
entries: When a wind witch takes fire damage, it catches fire, taking 3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage at the start of each of its turns. The wind witch continues burning until it takes cold damage or is immersed in water. A creature that touches the wind witch or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it while it is burning takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage. While burning, the wind witch deals an extra 3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage on each melee attack, and it deals 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage to a captured creature at the start of its turn.

trait.name: Tumbleweed Form
entries: The wind witch can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The wind witch can make two Slam attacks, or it makes one Slam attack and uses Capture.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8+ 3}) bludgeoning and 4 ({@damage 1d8}) piercing damage.

action.name: Capture
entries: The wind witch envelopes one Medium or smaller creature in its space. The target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw or be {@condition restrained} inside the wind witch. While {@condition restrained}, the target can't be hit by the wind witch's Slam attack, but the target takes 5 ({@damage 2d4}) piercing damage if it takes an action that requires movement, such as attacking or casting a spell with somatic components. When the wind witch moves, the captured creature moves with it. The wind witch can have only one creature captured at a time. A creature within 5 feet of the wind witch can take an action to pull a {@condition restrained} creature out of the swarm. Doing so requires a successful {@dc 13} Strength check, and the creature making the attempt takes 5 ({@damage 2d4}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Bouncy Escape
entries: When it takes damage from a melee attack, the wind witch can move up to half of its flying speed. This movement doesn't provoke {@action opportunity attack||opportunity attacks}. The wind witch releases a captured creature when it uses Bouncy Escape.

trait.name: Deep Roots
entries: The witchalder has advantage on Strength and Dexterity saving throws made against effects that would move it against its will along the ground.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the witchalder remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a diseased or dying alder tree.

trait.name: Sunlight Regeneration
entries: While in sunlight, the witchalder regains 5 hp at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hp.

trait.name: Speak with Plants
entries: The witchalder can communicate with Plants as if they shared a language.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The witchalder makes two Slam attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Throttle.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 4d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage. The target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}) if it is a Medium or smaller creature and the witchalder doesn't have two other creatures {@condition grappled}.

action.name: Shape Wood
entries: The witchalder alters the shape of any one Medium or smaller wooden object (or portion of an object) no more than 5 feet in any dimension that it can see within 30 feet, forming it into any shape that suits the witchalder's purposes. For example, it could warp a boat's planks so it takes on water, seal a wooden door to its frame (or make a new door in a wooden wall), or twist a wooden weapon out of shape (or restore a warped one). Warped thrown or ranged weapons and ammunition become useless, while warped melee weapons give disadvantage on attack rolls. This action can't create items that ordinarily require a high degree of craftsmanship, such as a pulley.
If the target is being worn or carried, the creature wearing or carrying it can make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, avoiding the effect on a success.

action.name: Throttle
entries: One creature {@condition grappled} by the witchalder must make a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw. On a failure, the creature takes 18 ({@damage 4d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage and can't breathe, speak, or cast spells with verbal components until the grapple ends. On a success, the creature takes half the damage and remains {@condition grappled} but suffers no other effects of Throttle.

action.name: Pollen Cloud {@recharge 6}
entries: The witchalder releases a cloud of poisonous pollen. Each creature within 15 feet of the witchalder must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 22 ({@damage 5d8}) poison damage and is {@condition incapacitated} for 1 minute. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn't {@condition incapacitated}. An {@condition incapacitated} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

monster.name: Wrackwraith
languages: any languages it knew in life

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The wrackwraith can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Wrack Form
entries: While animating a pile of wrack, the wrackwraith has an AC of 18 and can use the Slam and Deluge actions. In addition, the wrackwraith loses its immunity to the {@condition grappled} and {@condition restrained} conditions and can't fly. If the wrackwraith moves through a creature or object with Incorporeal Movement while animating wrack, the wrack falls off its ghostly body, ending this effect. Otherwise, it can end this effect as a bonus action. If the wrackwraith takes 15 damage or more in a single turn while animating wrack, the wrackwraith must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or be ejected from the wrack, ending this effect.

action.name: Ghostly Touch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Slam (Wrack Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) necrotic damage. If the target is Large or smaller, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 13}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the wrackwraith can't use its Slam on attack another target. The target can't breathe or speak until the grapple ends.

action.name: Animate Wrack
entries: The wrackwraith animates wrack within 5 feet of it, pulling the debris into a protective covering over its ghostly body.

action.name: Deluge (Wrack Form Only)
entries: The wrackwraith fills the lungs of one creature it is grappling with seawater, algae, and other tiny ocean debris, harming creatures that breathe air or water. The target must make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the target takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) necrotic damage and begins choking as its lungs fill with water and ocean debris. On a success, the target takes half the damage and isn't choking. A choking creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

bonus.name: Wrack Jump {@recharge 4}
entries: The wrackwraith leaves its current wrack pile, magically teleports to another wrack pile within 60 feet of it, and uses Animate Wrack.

monster.name: Oathrot Wraith

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks not made with silvered weapons

languages: the languages it knew in life

trait.name: Aura of Oathbreaking
entries: Any creature that begins its turn within 30 feet of the oathrot wraith must succeed on a {@dc 13} Charisma saving throw or become cursed, losing its resolve in important oaths it has taken. While cursed, the creature has disadvantage on Constitution saving throws to maintain concentration and can't add its proficiency bonus to ability checks and saving throws in which it is proficient. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to the wraith's Aura of Oathbreaking for 24 hours.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The wraith can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Oathseeker
entries: The oathrot wraith can pinpoint the location of any cleric, paladin, celestial, or other divinely connected creature within 60 feet of it.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the wraith has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Life Drain
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}20 ({@damage 4d8 + 2}) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or its hp maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hp maximum to 0.
The wraith drifts forward with a spectral tome attached to its waist by tendrils of shadow.

Denied eternal rest, oathrot wraiths are the tormented spirits of those who broke solemn vows, causing tragedy by doing so. Unrepentant, they now roam the world constantly reminded of their weakness and failure.

entries.name: Chained to their Oaths
entries: Oathrot wraiths stand out from other {@creature wraith||wraiths} by the texts that are tethered to them. These tomes bear the oaths they once swore and later betrayed. If a {@creature wraith} chooses to read the text and reaffirm its oaths, its curse is ended and its soul is freed from undeath. However, most oathrot wraiths are too consumed by self-loathing, pride, or anger to read the texts, seeing the books as constant reminders of their failure.

entries.name: Drawn by Loyalty
entries: Oathrot wraiths can sense the aura of those who live by their word, especially those who draw power from an oath, such as {@class cleric||clerics} and {@class paladin||paladins}. Their presence fills the oathrot wraith with pain and rage, and they quickly move to destroy such reminders of their failures.

entries.name: Beacons of Doubt
entries: Oathrot wraiths are not only punishment for oathbreakers, but also trials for those who live by their oaths. Their very presence tests such people, as the guilt, doubt, and weakness the wraiths bear preys on the minds of those nearby. {@class cleric||Clerics} and {@class paladin||paladins} that survive an encounter with an oathrot wraith consider it a reminder that they must be vigilant in their loyalty, lest they too fall from grace.

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The xecha can move through a space as narrow as 1 foot wide without squeezing. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying is left behind when it goes through a space too small for the equipment.

trait.name: Assume the Dead
entries: The xecha can enter the corpse of a Small, Medium, or Large creature that has been dead for less than 24 hours, impersonating that creature for {@dice 2d4} days before the body decays. If the xecha takes 15 damage or more on a single turn while inhabiting a body, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or be ejected from the body, which falls apart and is destroyed. The xecha's statistics, other than its size, are the same in each body.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The xecha has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Transparent
entries: Even when the xecha is in plain sight, it takes a successful {@dc 16} Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check to spot a xecha that has neither moved nor attacked. A creature that tries to enter the xecha's space while unaware of it is surprised by the xecha.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The xecha makes two Pseudopod attacks or three Slam attacks.

action.name: Pseudopod (True Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 3d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) acid damage.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Sensory Overload {@recharge 5}
entries: The xecha sends out a psychic pulse. Each creature that isn't a Construct or Undead within 20 feet of the xecha must make a {@dc 15} Intelligence saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 24 ({@damage 7d6}) psychic damage and is {@condition blinded} and {@condition deafened} until the end of its next turn. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn't {@condition blinded} or {@condition deafened}.

trait.name: Construct Nature
entries: The yali doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the yali remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary statue.

trait.name: Flinging Pounce
entries: If the yali moves at least 20 feet straight toward a Large or smaller creature and then hits it with a Tusk attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 12} Strength saving throw or be thrown up to 15 feet in a random direction and knocked {@condition prone}. If the thrown target strikes a solid surface, the target takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet it was thrown. If the target is thrown at another creature, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw or take the same damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: The yali's long jump is up to 40 feet and its high jump is up to 20 feet, with or without a running start.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The yali makes one Tusk attack and one Claw attack.

action.name: Tusk
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d4 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Trumpeting Blast {@recharge 5}
entries: The yali unleashes a warbling sound in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in the area must make a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 10 ({@damage 4d4}) thunder damage and is {@condition deafened} for 1 minute. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn't {@condition deafened}. A {@condition deafened} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

trait.name: Eidetic Memory
entries: A zilaq remembers everything it hears or reads. It has advantage on Intelligence ({@skill Arcana}) and Intelligence ({@skill History}) checks.

trait.name: Two-Headed
entries: The zilaq has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks and on saving throws against being {@condition blinded}, {@condition charmed}, {@condition deafened}, {@condition frightened}, {@condition stunned}, and knocked {@condition unconscious}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The zilaq makes two Bite attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Sonic Yelp {@recharge 5}
entries: The zilaq makes a high-pitched squeal. Each creature within 60 feet of it and that can hear it must make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw, taking 21 ({@damage 6d6}) thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Enthralling Speech (2/Day)
entries: Each creature within 60 feet of the zilaq and that can hear it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition charmed} for 1 minute. While {@condition charmed}, a creature suffers one of the following effects (the zilaq's choice):

items: The creature becomes hostile toward another creature of the zilaq's choice that is also {@condition charmed} by the zilaq.
The creature must roll a {@dice d100} at the start of each of its turns. If the result is 51–100, it can take no action until the start of its next turn.

action.name: Phantasmal Oratory (1/Day)
entries: The zilaq describes a creature so vividly, the creature takes on a semblance of reality. The zilaq creates an illusory creature that resembles a {@filter Beast, Monstrosity, or Plant with a CR of 1 or less|bestiary|type=beast;monstrosity;plant|challenge rating=[&0;&1]} for 1 hour. The illusory creature moves and acts according to the zilaq's mental direction, and it takes its turn immediately after the zilaq's. The illusory creature uses the statistics of the creature it resembles, except it can't use traits, actions, or spells that force the target to make a saving throw.

trait.name: Firesight
entries: The smokeplume zombie can see through areas obscured by fire, smoke, and fog without penalty.

trait.name: Smoldering Death
entries: When the zombie dies, its body crumbles into smoldering coals, releasing a great plume of smoke. The smoke fills a 15-foot-radius sphere centered on the zombie's corpse and spreads around corners. The area is heavily obscured and difficult terrain. When a creature enters the area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, that creature must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw, taking 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The smoke lasts for 1 minute or until a wind of moderate or greater speed (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses it.

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the zombie to 0 hp, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the zombie drops to 1 hp instead.

trait.name: Undead Nature
entries: The smokeplume zombie doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) fire damage.

action.name: Smoke Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The zombie breathes a cloud of smoke in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in the area must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw, taking 9 ({@damage 2d8}) fire damage and 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The smoke remains until the start of the zombie's next turn, and its area is heavily obscured.
The massive zombie appears bloated. Its flesh is hardened into cracked plates of charcoal, and smoke issues from the seams and from its orifices. A heat haze shimmers around it.
Smokeplume zombies have a magical fire raging inside their bellies, scorching their guts and threatening to blow the creature to pieces.

entries.name: Burning Inside
entries: Powered by the flames of Hell, these zombies periodically howl in rage and pain as they are torn apart from within, belching gouts of acrid smoke. The pressure buildup gives them a bloated appearance and a waddling gait and threatens to burst them at the seams.

entries.name: Aggressive
entries: Smokeplume zombies are more aggressive than their cousins, simply because their attacks release a portion of the energy stored within, temporarily relieving some of their torment. This stored power becomes a giant cloud of smoke when the zombie dies.

entries.name: In the Cults
entries: Because of both their aggressive demeanor and unstable nature, cults don't often use smokeplume zombies near their temples. Rather, they use these zombies as shock troops in large assaults and as weapons of terror against large populations. These zombies aren't expected to last long.

trait.name: Erratic Movement
entries: {@action opportunity attack||Opportunity attacks} against the voidclaw zombie are made with disadvantage.

trait.name: Turn Resistance
entries: The voidclaw zombie has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead.

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the zombie to 0 hp, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the zombie drops to 1 hp instead.

trait.name: Undead Nature
entries: The voidclaw zombie doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The zombie makes three Void Claw or Void Bolt attacks.

action.name: Void Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage. If the target is a creature other than a Construct or Undead, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or take 3 ({@damage 1d6}) necrotic damage at the start of each of its turns as the wound burns with Void energy. Any creature can take an action to purge the tainted energy from the wound with a successful {@dc 12} Intelligence ({@skill Arcana}) check. The energy also leaves the wound if the target receives magical healing, ending the effect.

action.name: Void Bolt
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 5} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 4d6 + 2}) necrotic damage.

bonus.name: Nimble Fighter
entries: The voidclaw zombie takes the {@action Dash} or {@action Disengage} action
Faint black waves of energy surround the zombie. It seems agitated and then is just gone.

Voidclaw zombies are suffused with the magic of the Void, which twists their bodies into odd proportions, including overly large clawed hands, a shortened frame, increased intellect, and surprising speed. They are created in rituals invoking the Void, and they channel its dark energy.

entries.name: Efficient Killers
entries: These zombies have proven to be surprisingly capable killers, quickly clearing areas of all life. Cults of the Void and other doomsday cults often utilize voidclaws in their machinations. Voidclaws show a zeal for killing, and lesser undead instinctively defer to them, following them into combat with almost the same zeal.

entries.name: Voice of the Void
entries: When voidclaws speak, it is with an authority incongruous with their bearing, and many cult leaders hold the words and opinions of the zombies in high regard, believing some aspect of the Void itself speaks through the zombies. Voidclaws sometimes have an inscrutable mission of their own, a singular goal imprinted on them at creation by unseen forces within the Void. Most cultists have learned it is better to not interfere, waiting for the mission's completion before requesting the zombie's assistance.

trait.name: Aura of Courage and Protection
entries: As long as the field commander is conscious, all friendly creatures within 10 feet of it are immune to being {@condition frightened} and have advantage on all saving throws.

trait.name: Divine Weapons
entries: The field commander's weapon attacks are magical. When the commander hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@dice 3d8} necrotic or radiant damage (included in the attack), the commander's choice.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The field commander uses Battle Cry, if available. It then makes three Longsword attacks, or it makes two Longsword attacks and uses Spellcasting. If the commander hits one creature with two Longsword attacks, the target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage, or 9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) slashing damage if used with two hands, plus 13 ({@damage 3d8}) necrotic or radiant damage (the commander's choice).

action.name: Battle Cry {@recharge 5}
entries: The field commander shouts a frightful and rallying battle cry. Each hostile creature within 30 of it that can hear the cry must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A {@condition frightened} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. Each friendly creature within 30 feet of the commander and that can hear the cry has advantage on the next attack roll it makes before the start of the commander's next turn.

reaction.name: Bolster Soldier
entries: When a friendly creature the field commander can see is hit with a weapon attack, the commander calls out encouragement, and the creature gains 5 ({@damage 1d10}) temporary hp.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The field commander casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 16}):

trait.name: Armor of Foresight
entries: While the first servant is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Dexterity and Wisdom modifiers (included above).

trait.name: Divine Weapons
entries: The first servant's weapon attacks are magical. When the first servant hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@dice 3d8} necrotic or radiant damage (included in the attack), the first servant's choice.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The first servant uses its Awe-Inspiring Presence. It then makes three Divine Burst attacks or one Blinding Rod attack and two Divine Burst attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting.

action.name: Blinding Rod
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d6 + 1}) bludgeoning damage plus 13 ({@damage 3d8}) necrotic or radiant damage (the first servant's choice), and the target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition blinded} and {@condition deafened} until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Divine Burst
entries: {@atk ms,rs} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft., one target. {@h}23 ({@damage 4d8 + 5}) necrotic or radiant damage (the first servant's choice).

action.name: Awe-Inspiring Presence
entries: Each creature of the first servant's choice that is within 30 feet of the first servant and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw or be unable to use bonus actions or reactions until the start of the first servant's next turn.

bonus.name: Healing Hands {@recharge 5}
entries: The first servant touches a creature within 5 feet of it, and the creature regains 14 ({@damage 4d6}) hp.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The first servant casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 17}):

trait.name: Ritual Cleansing
entries: The fixer can take 10 minutes to perform a cleansing ritual on a creature, object, or an area within 30 feet that is no larger than a 20-foot cube. For the next 8 hours, the affected creature or object is hidden from divination magic, as if it was under the effects of the {@spell nondetection} spell. In an area that is ritually cleansed, divination spells of 4th level or lower don't function, and creatures within the area can't be scried.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The fixer makes two Shortsword or Sling attacks.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Hand Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage.

trait.name: Burning Cold
entries: A creature with resistance to cold damage doesn't have resistance to the cold damage dealt by the frost-afflicted. A creature with immunity to cold damage is unaffected by this trait.

trait.name: Icy Nature
entries: The frost-afflicted is infused with minor elemental power, and it requires only half the amount of food and drink that a typical humanoid of its size needs.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The frost-afflicted makes two Frigid Punch or Frost Bolt attacks.

action.name: Frigid Punch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) bludgeoning damage and 5 ({@damage 2d4}) cold damage.

action.name: Frost Bolt
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 5} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) cold damage.

reaction.name: Frigid Flare
entries: When a creature hits the frost-afflicted with a weapon attack, ice bursts from the frost-afflicted. Each creature within 5 feet of the frost-afflicted must make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw, taking 5 ({@damage 2d4}) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If the infested duelist is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the duelist instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half the damage if it fails.

trait.name: Parasite Sense
entries: The infested duelist has advantage on attack rolls against {@condition poisoned} creatures.

trait.name: Plant-Powered Mobility
entries: {@action opportunity attack||Opportunity attacks} made against an infested duelist have disadvantage. If the duelist is {@condition prone} at the start of its turn, it can immediately stand without costing movement.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The infested duelist makes one Slam attack and two Shortsword attacks, or it makes two Thorn Shot attacks.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d6 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage, and the target must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the target takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) poison damage and is {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. On a success, the target takes half the damage and isn't {@condition poisoned}. The {@condition poisoned} target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Thorn Shot
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d4 + 5}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage.

reaction.name: Spore Cloud
entries: When the duelist takes damage from a ranged attack, it emits a burst of thick, yellow spores. The spores surround the infested duelist and heavily obscure the area within 5 feet of it. The spores dissipate at the start of the duelist's next turn.

trait.name: Knowledge Charm
entries: The infiltrator carries a minor magical charm gifted to it by the organization. While wearing or carrying the charm, the infiltrator has proficiency in any two skills and is fluent in any one language (not included above). This proficiency and fluency last until the charm is lost or destroyed or until the infiltrator performs a 10-minute ritual to change the proficiency and fluency provided by the charm. If the infiltrator dies, the charm becomes nonmagical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The infiltrator makes two Shortsword attacks and one Dagger attack. It can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Light Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

bonus.name: Cunning Action
entries: The infiltrator takes the {@action Dash}, {@action Disengage}, or {@action Hide} action.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The infiltrator casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 13}):

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The merchant captain uses Fast Talk. It then makes three Rapier or Quip attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting.

action.name: Rapier
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Quip
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 7} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 3d6 + 4}) psychic damage.

action.name: Fast Talk
entries: The merchant captain baffles a creature it can see within 30 feet of it with a barrage of jargon, quick speech, and big words. The target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Charisma saving throw or have disadvantage on the next Wisdom saving throw it makes before the end of the merchant captain's next turn.

reaction.name: Inspiration (4/Day)
entries: When a creature within 30 feet of the merchant captain fails an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, the captain can force it to reroll the die. The target must use the new roll.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The merchant captain casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 15}):

trait.name: Elemental Weapons
entries: When the warlock hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@dice 3d6} acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage (included in the attack), the warlock's choice.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage (the warlock's choice).

action.name: Elemental Burst
entries: {@atk ms,rs} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 3d6 + 4}) acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage (the warlock's choice).

reaction.name: Genie Lord's Favor
entries: When the warlock takes acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage, the warlock has advantage on the next Elemental Burst attack it makes before the end of its next turn, provided the Elemental Burst deals the same damage as the damage the warlock took.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The warlock casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 15}):

trait.name: Air Senses
entries: The wind acolyte can't use its {@sense blindsight} while underwater or in an area without air.

trait.name: Air Weapons
entries: When the acolyte attacks, it conjures a weapon out of the air itself, the weapon appearing and disappearing in the blink of an eye. An air weapon is a swirl of wind in the shape of a simple or martial weapon, but it always deals {@damage 2d6} damage of the same type as that weapon. An air weapon shaped like a ranged weapon uses the range of that weapon, except the acolyte doesn't have disadvantage on ranged attack rolls when attacking a target beyond the weapon's normal range. Air weapons don't use any other weapon properties of the weapons they mimic. Air weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The wind acolyte makes three Air Weapon attacks. If the wind acolyte hits one creature with two Air Weapon attacks, the target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 15 feet away from the acolyte.

action.name: Air Weapon
